author: {'steamid': '76561198063329473', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1698933808}
review:
If you're here for complexity and turn based rpg strategy satisfaction, prepare to be disappointed. If you're here for a charming little dungeon crawler to play at your leisure give it a go. It can be quite a challenge so the strategy is there, but it's an 'INCREDIBLY easy to learn """SLIGHTLY CHALLENGING""" to master' kinda deal. 

Imo the missions themselves are well designed technically but due to the 'story'(which is pretty loose) you seem to spend most of the time in only one type of environment. Disclaimer that I didn't beat the game yet but I believe this to be the case all the way through. 

Using the brothel is unironically essential for your Barbarian lol. 

TLDR;    it's fun but not massively complex. It is probably better with friends, ala it's board game. I'm doing solo and enjoying it though.

author: {'steamid': '76561199088050965', 'num_games_owned': 1525, 'num_reviews': 494, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1696991706}
review:
A very good improvement on the first. Gives a good adventure where you can continually improve your party and get stronger.

Pros:
- Fun gameplay blending dungeon crawling and tactics
- A huge improvement on the previous
- A Now with cutscenes!

Cons:
- A lot of the things need to be slowly unlocked
- The traps system isn't my favorite
- Some of the upgrades don't seem quite worth it in comparison to others

I honestly think it's a huge improvement on the previous title and really shows the strength of the series. I give it 5/6 Heroes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012246112', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1691505320}
review:
[h1] Aber das ist ja HEROQUEST [/h1]

könnte man spontan ausrufen, wenn man sich die Screenshots so ansieht,
oder auf der Shoppingseite kurz mal ungeduldig im Video herumscrollt.

(Mir fällt auf, dass die Geduld und Aufmerksamkeit der Menschen ringsum rapide nachlässt...
sobald etwas nicht mindestens im 5 Sekunden Takt fesselt; wird geswiped, gewischt, vorgespult oder -wenn man mit jemanden spricht oder zusammen TV sieht - schnell aufs Handy geschaut.
Das Leben und die Informationen dringen nur noch als 2-5 Sekunden TikToks ins Hirn)

Sooo .. und mit diesem langweiligen Satz oben habe ich diese Zielgruppe auch sogleich verloren :-P

Fokus, Mister Dänjil... Okay.

Der Eindruck eine Spiele-Umsetzung des Brettspielklassikers vor sich zu haben entsteht schnell.
Und wird auch nicht wieder weichen.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3006239627

[h1]Die etablierten Heroen der Fantasiewelt (Barbar, Schurke, Zwerg, Paladin, Magier,...) sind einmal mehr auf dem Weg irgendeine Welt zu retten...
und dabei zig Orks, Goblins und böse Nekromanten [strike] zu schlachten, zu zerteilen, die zuckenden Kadaver mit den Stiefelspitzen auseinander zu schieben und auszunehmen um die blutigen materiellen Überreste wie Waffen und Gold in Ihre eigenen Taschen zu stecken[/strike] zu besiegen.[/h1]

Soweit so gewohnt.

Wie am heimischen Esszimmertisch (oder mittlerweile auch in nahezu allen klassischen RPGs alá Baldurs Gate 3 oder Solasta) wird dabei rundenweise jeder einzelne Heroe auf seine Quest geschickt.

[h1]Dabei nutzt jeder Charakter seine individuellen Vorteile (beispielsweise das Finden von verstecken Fallen) - hat aber auch ganz persönliche Nachteile (zb. nach 3 x auf die Mütze bekommen = tot umfallen)[/h1]

Typischerweise laufen Handlungen dann folgendermaßen ab:

Eine Anzahl x Schritte laufen,
und/oder
Gegner plätten,
Gold suchen,
Fallen finden,
Fallen entschärfen,
Gegenstand benutzen (Heiltrank, etc),
Kisten oder Gegner looten,
(sehr coole Feinheit: Archetypen wie der Barbar haben hier geringere Erfolgschancen etwas zu finden als zb. goldgierige Zwerge)
Schalter betätigen,
...
und vieles mehr.

Nach den einzelnen Leveln kehrt man in die Hubwelt (ein Dorf) zurück:
gibt das Geld aus,
kauft besseres Equipment, neue Moves und Spells,
ruht sich im Bordell aus (Ja! So läuft das hier)
oder besticht den Friedhofswärter, dass er gefallene Kameraden wieder ins Leben zurückholt ... ähem, Moment, ....bekämpfen wir nicht eigentlich Nekromanten?! Achso, ist ja nur der Friedhofswärter ;-)

[h1]Die Grafik ist dabei wunderschön handgezeichnet in einer Art isometrischer Draufsicht und erinnert herrlich nostalgisch an Cadaver von den Bitmap Brothers auf dem Amiga 500![/h1]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3021914496

Soundtechnisch ist es kein Ohrwurmkandidat oder BombastaufdieOhrengeber. Macht aber gar nichts. 

[h1]Der Multiplayer ist ähnlich top wie bei Solasta oder Divinity Original Sin[/h1]

Jederzeit kann ein Freund mit einsteigen und einzelne Charaktere übernehmen.

Jetzt hat man dann -gefühlt- wirklich sein Brettspiel Heroquest zurück!
(Welches es auch in einer Neuauflage gibt und sich immer noch zu spielen lohnt)

Hab das Spiel auf der Switch durchgespielt - und mir auch gleich noch mal in Steam geholt.

Schönes, kleines Ding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042499490', 'num_games_owned': 2166, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 897, 'last_played': 1690548928}
review:
[h1]Mouse-Only Crawling[/h1]

Spent the entire game on my back in my couch using only mouse. I wanted a lazy, relaxed, tactical fantasy game and this is exactly that. The classic Holy Trinity RPG classes are here, equipped with their usual playstyle that complement each other. (Tank, Healer, Barbarian, Archer, Wizard.. and a Chaos Monk) ^_^

It's a medium difficulty crawler with some quirks in it's coding, but the game works just fine. Art-style is fantastic and the music is good to. 

Took me 15 hours to 100% in a casual manner. One regular playthrough, and one Hardcore run that I almost failed. So some thinking is required there.

[spoiler]The achievement that requires you to amass 100K gold - can be sorted via a Workshop map. But I recommend doing everything else as intended.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198056404028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1689414287}
review: Dark Quest 2 stays the best of the three Dark Quest games, but Dark Quest 3 is only a bit behind. Dark Quest 2 has everything I could dream of from a casual RPG boardgame like dungeon crawler. It has splendid graphics, arguably one of the best graphic art I have seen in modern video games. Dark Quest 2 is fast-paced and has a lot of tactical options, skills, buyable equipment, and character variation. Besides offering an individual approach to the game by that variety, there are challenging, but not impossible missions, and a variety in enemies. Did I mention the prime art style that is a real pleasure to look at? I finished Dark Quest 2 a few years ago, and now I return to the game to experience it again. What else needs to be said to make clear that Dark Quest 2 is one of my absolute favorites?!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043595047', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1688859166}
review:
This game is absolutely worth the $3 dollars you might pay for it during a sale. I think full price of $8 is pushing it.

The game isn't very long. It took me maybe 5 hours to beat the game on normal and then hardcore difficulties. It's also very easy (if you run the strong characters, that is... I avoided the obviously weaker ones on my first two playthroughs). There is also a lack of polish, especially regarding camera angle, general spelling and grammar, and clunky drag-and-drop menus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321740054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1689440809}
review:
A simple but charming digital adaptation of Hero Quest, which has crashed on me already once in 20 minutes of play. I'll probably play it up to the 2-hour refund window and keep it if doesn't crash again as I feel that it's worth it at 70% off.

I don't really like the single-room view of the game and would much rather have a larger view like in the board-game but I can't complain much for a dollar's worth.

I have heard this described as a game with limited replay-value but in-between 6 heroes (almost 100 party compositions), half a dozen upgrades per hero and Steam Workshop support with almost a 100 maps uploaded, I feel that there is a little more here than meets the eye.

In particular, the game being beatable in under 10 hours makes this a potential title to come back to every so often and beat on a lazy sunday or over the weekend. Different difficulties, including an iron-man mode will further complement this option.

(Review in progress).

author: {'steamid': '76561198053328825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 883, 'last_played': 1683016900}
review:
Ech, you got me, I'm a total sucker for isometric perspective, classic RPG themes and turn-based combat. Bought this game quite a while ago, but never checked it out, as there were always more interesting alternatives to play. But the time has finally come, and I gave it a try.

Surprisingly, this is actually a quite decent casual little game. Don't expect a lot of strategic depth or polished RPG system - it's something meant to be played on tablets - but it's fun enough to click around for a while if you happen to be laying bedridden.

Painted graphics are really nice, dungeon locations look cute, the gameplay is simple, but engaging enough to spend about 8 hours completing the main campaign. Six not exactly balanced character classes to choose from to form your 3-man party, there are also very simple skill progression and item systems. Default difficulty offers a bit of a challenge and the the whole adventure will most likely be over before it will get boring. Game has a map editor, so there's some more replayability in the form of downloading user created maps through steam workshop. I actually played the whole thing twice back to back with different party setups.

If I wanted to nitpick, UI is not exactly stellar, often characters are blocking with their sprites certain tiles you'd like to move to. I'd also wish the game was somewhat longer, but I guess the price is fair for what the game has to offer. 

As long as your expectations are not too high, you should have some fun with this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198311989017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1682448396}
review:
https://blog.naver.com/jampuri/223086180506 <- 장문의 리뷰는 이쪽.

다국적 인디 게임 개발사에서 만든 보드 게임. 다크 퀘스트 시리즈의 두번째 작품.

전작은 게임 그래픽이 캐릭터 얼굴 그려진 코인을 옮기는 것이라 캐릭터의 움직이라고 할 수 있는 게 전혀 없었지만, 이번 작은 쿼터뷰 시점에, 캐릭터 크기도 리얼 사이즈로 커져서 이제야 비로서 좀 움직인다. 모션의 수가 적어서 좀 단순하긴 한데 그래도 없는 것보단 있는 게 나으니. 그래픽적인 부분은 확실히 발전한 느낌이다.

https://blog.naver.com/jampuri/223057239951 <- 게임 스타일이 1991년에 나온 '히어로 퀘스트' PC판과 비슷해졌는데. 게임 조작은 좀 더 편하다.

플레이어블 캐릭터도 6명으로 늘어났고, 무기/장비/아이템/마법/스킬을 전부 소비형 아이템 취급했던 걸, 각각 따로 분류해 놓은 건 개선점이라고 할 수 있다.

문제는 후반부로 넘어갈수록 적들이 기본 배치 수가 늘어나는 문제가 여전히 남아 있는 건데. 본작부터는 맵이 방 단위로 구성되어 있어 맵 크기가 존나 좁은데, 적들이 많이 나오니. 좁은 맵 안에서 난전을 벌이는 게 존나 답답하다. 일 대 다수의 전투 설계가 적들한테 너무 유리한 환경으로 되어 있어서 문제가 심각하다. 

그리고 최종 보스인 '이블 소서러'의 공략 난이도가 좀 미쳤고. 힘들게 클리어해도 이어지는 엔딩이 플레이어 뒷목 잡게 만들어서 아무래도 제작진이 좀 게임 개발 마무리 단계에서 정줄을 놓아버린 게 아닌가 싶다.

전작보다 나아진 점이 분명 있긴 해서 장점이 있긴 한데. 게임 플레이 환경적인 부분에서 심각한 단점이 있어서 장점으로 커버칠 수 없는 작품이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561199225168402', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1680950218}
review:
Нормальная игра. Приятная рисовка, незамысловатый, однако иногда заставляющий напрячь голову игровой процесс. Не знаю хорошо это или плохо, однако уровень в любой момент можно покинуть, поэтому совершение критической ошибки максимум может сказаться на вашем свободном времени, поскольку придется заново проходить подземелье. Плюс это позволяет просто фармить очки навыков на уровнях. И в конечном счете даже при самом неумелом прохождении можно просто перекачаться.
Проходил на максимальном уровне сложности, минимизируя фарм (проходил все уровни по одному разу), периодически сталкивался с любопытными тактическими вызовами, требующими хоть и не больших, но все же усилий. Даже пришлось пройти несколько уровней заново.
Графика и стилистика приятные, радуют глаз. Музыка простая, но со вкусом, создает атмосферу.
Кстати, затрагивая тему атмосферы. Несмотря на простенькую рисовку, иногда в игре встречаются откровенно жуткие элементы. Шел я себе никого не трогал (кроме орков да гоблинов), и решил обратить внимание на фон (стены, декор и прочее). И б**ть, тот кто рисовал повешенных явно переусердствовал, они реально выглядят очень детализировано и жутко. В общем Dark Fantasy 10/10. Ночью Снились кошмары. Одобряю.
Сюжета, как и в первой игре ноль. Убей злого колдуна и все тут.
Могу выделить только один существенный минус. Анимация передвижения героев. Перемещение всех персонажей из комнаты в комнату занимает некоторое время, особенно душит ближе к концу игры, когда подземелья становятся большими, а исследовать хочется все.
За 100 рублей можно взять, но вы ничего не потеряете если не пройдете Dark Quest 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031313794', 'num_games_owned': 8531, 'num_reviews': 3393, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1679400037}
review:
[h1]Описание:[/h1]
Пошаговая дигитальная настолка. Часть вторая. Появились новые герои. Появилась деревня где можно купить снаряжение, изучить навыки и т.п. между уровнями. Визуал подтянули и сильно... Игра стала очень и очень красивой. Гемплей особо не поменялся, только теперь не один большой уровень, а куча комнат с переходами. Проходится игра на обычной сложности за несколько часов (я снова уснул на клаве). Есть баги (иногда персонаж не переходит в следующую комнату застревая на кнопке перехода. Лечится исключительно перезагрузкой уровня. Жутко бесючая штука за прохождение раза 3-4 встречалась). Завезли возможность играть с другом (не опробовал) и редактор карт с мастерской (за 5 лет сделали меньше 100 уровней и интересных я там не нашел), зато с редактором можно читерить золото и т.п. (не пользовался). В целом игра понравилась, но меньше чем первая часть... Вышла еще третья и интересно посмотреть чего там наворотили. Эту рекомендую.

[h1]Оценка: 6/10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]
[quote] Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в кураторку
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/8114152] К и Ко [/url], там много других, хороших обзоров.
[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198072070416', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1677512687}
review:
TLDR;
Pros:
- Fun classes
- Short
Cons:
- Overall pretty boring
- Poor performance and bugs
- Poor music and sounds
- No camera controls
- No key bindings
- Boring
Overall Score 3/10
The game seemed like simple fun at first glance and I thought I could get into, unfortunately it was very poorly made. 
For starters the technical issues were plenty. I’ve had mission-ending bugs, I’ve had clipping issues, I’ve had tooltips remain on screen even though I closed the window. The QoL wasn’t any good either, there are no keyboard shortcuts or key bindings, there isn’t any option to rotate the camera, you cant leave mid mission and the worst of all whoever made that menu should consider hitting himself in the head a few times, who the hell puts exit game right under the options as a huge button? ended 3 runs early thanks to that poor design, at least there is a game speed increase, it would’ve been absolutely unplayable if lightspeed wasn’t an option. 
And there are other random things that are simply annoying, like one particular character having a resurrect spell where you target the remains of your allies to do so, and another class having an ability that makes clones of itself, very normal things you would think but oh no, if a clone dies it leaves behind remains as well, and believe me resurrecting a clone instead of the main hero is annoying as hell, WHY WOULD YOU EVEN HAVE THAT in the game!!???
This game could have potential but as it is its just a joke, a student project at best.

author: {'steamid': '76561199124437325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1677486948}
review:
Ultimately, what should be a good game is let down by mechanics and the type of difficulty. It just gets very boring and very samey and very grindy in a very short while. This could have been a great game, but sadly it isn't. 

UI Issues:

Drag and drop of portraits is finicky and its possible to glitch the portraits so you have 2 of 1 hero. if you don't place it within the small hidden inner drop zone then it doesn't register.

You can't see what is on the ground when an enemy or object is in the foreground. Since you need to target a location or object to move or cast a spell, you will need to jog your party around to click on exit locations and forget casting resurrection in combat if there is an enemy in the foreground hiding the body of your fallen hero.

AI is simplistic, so to cover this the game has preset levels, and since you only get one use of each ability (in general) per quest, knowing when to use each ability is basically a case of having played the level before. 

RNG: enough said. 

Most of the craftable items have absolutely no value. There is always a "best" item, because of the way enemies work.

Late game enemies deal unblockable chaos damage. Have fun wading through a room full of ranged unblockable damage while your heros are being spam-feared 

In the end I didn't finish it. The story is boring. The levels are insipid,. the characters are mostly lackluster and the few redeeming elements are swallowed up by the mess of the rest. After recovering 2 pieces of the amulet, and needing to get the third, I literally felt a sense of dread of having to play another quest. That's when I stopped. 

I'll add that the game marketing is extremely misleading.

The "Skull of Fate"? That just means your character avoids death once per Fate level you have, and survives with 0 hp (so 1 more hit will kill them). The game also has enemies that have Fate, mostly undead. There's no "twisted fate" to discover, this is simply a "if you take damage that would kill you, instead reduce hp to 0, consume 1 fate".

Likewise the "discover hidden doors". There's no hidden doors, they all are clearly visible and actually required to go through to complete the quest in most cases. They all also have exactly the same form of a raised tile which the game introduces you to in the very first quest. 

Pick it up if it's on high discount, and you just want to waste an hour or two tooling about, but big miss otherwise.

Tried hard to like the game but feeling isn't there, casual uninteresting turn base game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062667498', 'num_games_owned': 440, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1672589445}
review:
[b]TL; DR[/b] Dark Quest 2 is fun especially with friends, but it is short. It plays very much like a boardgame and you can make some comparisons with Hero Quest. However, it does have a few issues some of which are due to the implementation of multiplayer and others are more fundamental. 
 
[b]Note[/b] Dark Quest 1 is summarised within the opening cutscene and the first chapter of the game. I recommend starting with this one since the original game is less fun and less interesting.  

[h1] Story [/h1] 
There is a Sorcerer, and he is evil, stop him.

In other words, the plot is fairly standard and its definitely simple throughout. At most you will get a few sentences in a cutscene, but this is not a character or story driven game. 
What worldbuilding there is gets explained through the pre-mission summaries, but this is also rather simple, however, it does give you some slight insight into the state of this world and the motives of certain enemies. 

[h1] Presentation [/h1] 
Aesthetically the game draws influence from Sword & Sorcery titles which is especially clear with the designs for the Barbarian and Evil Sorcerer. Visually these and the rest of the characters are good, with a cohesive, slightly cartoonish artstyle and exaggerated animations.  
Furthermore, every enemy is visually distinct meaning that a cursory glance is enough to understand what enemies you will be facing in a room. I also enjoy the addition of less combat focused designs, such as the standard-bearers and the drummers which gives the roster some unique variety. 
While these designs are competently made, they are also generic and nothing else sticks out as interesting.  

No sound effect is particularly exciting but thankfully nothing is broken either. However, the sound effect which plays whenever a trap is uncovered and the little melody which plays when finishing a level are both a bit jarring to the overall soundscape. 
The soundtrack is a better experience, it is filled with good songs with a healthy mix of instruments and a few atmospheric tracks to even things out. However, the OST is very short which means you will hear certain songs over and over, which can get annoying if you are doing multiple playthroughs. 

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]
[spoiler][quote=Elder]I could give you some advice, but you wouldn’t know what to do with it[/quote][/spoiler]
As a sequel this improves on the original in a lot of ways, mostly by making the RNG better such as removing the chance for healing potions to not work but also with more practical things such as having Hero abilities be permanent upgrades instead of something you need to pay for between every mission. 
However, at its core its still very similar with a basic chance-based combat system and mostly simple combat encounters. 

The game itself is divided into two parts preparation in the village, and dungeon delving. The former includes getting upgrades, equipment and buffs, while the latter is the majority of the game including the combat. 

Every quest comes with its own sorts of challenges including boss monsters, ambushes, and various types of traps. There are also the [i]Skulls of Fate[/i] that can be activated for random effects such as wounding enemies or healing your Heroes. However, they can also be risky to use since they end your turn and since they might not do anything at all.
The core of the game is managing RNG and making tactical decisions based on your capabilities and those of your enemies. Is it worthwhile to use an ability for guaranteed damage or should you save one of your three uses for another room? Should you heal or can you afford to save it for later?

There are also mutually exclusive challenges for singleplayer and multiplayer. When playing solo, you are limited to whatever coins and upgrade potions you can find and these need to be split between the Heroes you are using. In other words, you will need to prioritise certain abilities or Heroes. 
Unfortunately, this incentivises you to stick to the Heroes you acquire early on as trying to change to a new un-upgraded hero on later missions is ill-advised. However, the management of upgrade points can be completely nullified if you replay missions which will also break the intended gameplay progression as you get too strong too quickly. 
 
In multiplayer this is not a challenge since each player gains resources independently, instead your issue is your hero count, as each player can only control one character. In the vast majority of cases this is fine and even easy with some minor tactics, however, on certain missions the RNG is heavily stacked against you which makes for a frustrating experience. 
It is certainly possible to beat every mission with only two Heroes or even a single one, however, this is highly improbable and would demand very exact tactics. Therefore, I would recommend playing certain missions solo so that you can actually enjoy the game. 

There are also a few quirks of the game that can be a nuisance. One of which is the movement on the isometric map as it is very difficult to click on the squares behind characters, instead you will select the hero or enemy you are trying to flank.  
A few QoL features are missing, for example, in the village you are unable to buff Heroes in a group instead everyone needs to get a buff individually, you are also forced to spend one upgrade point at a time which means upgrading takes a while if you have a dozen points in reserve. 
There is also Hardcore which does pose more of a challenge than the normal difficulty, however, it also accentuates some of the worst aspects of the RNG such as teamkilling. It also favours certain party compositions more than others which can make repeat attempts dull and repetitive. 

In any case the game is rather short and besides multiplayer or trying out different parties there is little reason to replay the campaign. Luckily, they did include a level editor which includes all the tools necessary to make dungeons as complex as those in the Campaign. As a result, there are a number of player-created maps for you to enjoy if you want more of the game, and the option to create your own is also there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006265371', 'num_games_owned': 790, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1682616777}
review: This is not a game for two player co-op. At a certain point in the campaign the game expects you to have a third and then eventually a fourth character in your party. The game is limited to only allowing a character per player in co-op. Which means at some point two players will no longer have to required characters to complete levels. It is just functionally not possible for only two players to complete the campaign. I can not recommend this game unless you're playing solo or with four friends. If you meet those requirements it is a great game. Extremely fun and interesting. Otherwise, pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061962921', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1676949343}
review:
Despite really liking the first game I feel the sequel is a superior game so far. Mechanics play about the same as the first game with new graphics, features, and a little more detail to the fantasy world you’ve been cast into. Still a neat little turned based adventure with some improvements and flaws.

Pros
(+) Nicer animation that the first game – like a cross between Rune Scape and Original Warcraft.
(+) More hero types and party combinations. I find the archer to be slightly overpowered, but I’m glad she’s on our side.
(+) Potions no longer have a chance to do nothing unlike the first game, and their cost has been reduced.
(+) Wizard has more spells, but they can only be used once unless you use a potion.
(+) Better music. First game just had the Main Title and Town music.

Meh
(/) Still a loot-and-buy heavy game. Most of my money goes toward spent potions so I haven’t gotten a chance to try blacksmith items.
(/) I wish each hero had a chance to spot traps. Makes it necessary to either have the dwarf or archer in the party, but even they can only see a trap if its within 2 squares unless you upgrade the ability.
(/) Hardcore mode with achievement to be unlocked to punish players with Completionism Compulsive Disorder.

Cons
(-) Not a big fan of Wizard spells only being able to be used once. Wish there was a cooldown instead of needing a potion for it.
(-) Barbarian skill tree seems lackluster compared to the dwarf and archer. Lots of chance abilities but nothing immediate.
(-) Kinda lame having and 80% change of hitting or triggering an ability only to have it succeed a fourth of a time.
(-) Needs better chances of perception and sanity tests.
(-) You start with far less health in hardcore mode, making your health bottles going toward trap recovery. 
(-) Multiplayer is pretty dumb - only get one hero per player so on missions where you need two or three can be pretty taxing. Also, sometimes items like potions and gear don't show up even if you selected them pregame.

Still a good game despite some flaws. Hope I get to finish this one unlike the first game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199174853497', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 3052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 959, 'last_played': 1671615267}
review:
As many other reviewers have stated, this game springs from the board game 'Hero Quest' from around the year 1989 or 1990.  I have many fond memories of sitting around the kitchen table with friends playing that for hours at a time.  Anyways...


[b][u]PRO[/u][/b]
1.  Great old-school feel to this game.

2.  Party-based, with 6 characters to choose from.  You can control up to 4 characters per quest, but usually only 2 or 3.

3.  While you're in the village, you can pay to resurrect dead characters.

4.  You don't have to mess with leveling up, or learning where to best use skill & ability points.  None of that stuff exists here.

5.  Some good challenges exist, especially when you're outnumbered something like 8 to 3.

6.  There are 2 quests which are nothing more than gold runs, and spending that gold right afterwards greatly helps your characters to prepare for what's coming later.

7.  Although the game is simple in itself, the biggest "thinking part" of the game is deciding which characters to choose for a particular quest.  There are some quests where 1 party will fail greatly while another party succeeds easily.  You sometimes need to find balance between melee, ranged, and magic.


[b][u]CON[/u][/b]
1.  Your party has to move and attack one-by-one, which can be a little tedious.

2.  Despite what the description on the Store Page says, there is no crafting of equipment or potions.  You just buy everything as you can afford to.

3.  The selection of equipment items and potions is very limited.

4.  Equipment items can only be swapped between characters while you're in the village.

5.  Each character can only carry 1 or 2 potions at a time.

6.  Even though the minimum specs are such that a wet potato should be able to run this game, I can't play for very long (about an hour at a time) because the game causes my computer to run hot.

7.  When I tried multiplayer with a friend, we only got to do 2 quests.  Then the game glitched, and we were invisible to each other.  Could not find a fix, and so we could not continue to play together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798626497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1666208960}
review:
Dark Quest 2 est un Dungeon Crawler tout à fait correct pour son prix. Principalement orienté exploration et combats au tour par tour avec de multiples classes à essayer (barbare, chevalier, archer, nain, magicien, etc...).

Perso, je recommande !

author: {'steamid': '76561198016116645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1665332915}
review:
A la par que entiendo las valoraciones negativas, pues es un juego que, entre otras cosas porque es básico, para móviles y todo lo que esto puede implicar, puede tener carencias; me parece divertido, con un mínimo pensar y contenido, pero que adquirido por 5€ está genial y da unas pocas de horas de juego, de probar qué composiciones van mejor o te gustan más, etc.
No es un Darkest Dungeon ni mucho menos, pero se hace entretenido y según la composición, "dificil"

author: {'steamid': '76561198400191968', 'num_games_owned': 1395, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 2099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2099, 'last_played': 1664078747}
review:
玩过一代之后继续玩的二代，对比一下

+画面和音效升级
+++增加了装备打造和人物技能树，两者结合可以生成各种有趣又实用的战术
+++创意工坊有不少有意思的地图，而且地图里得到的钱和技能瓶都可以保留，觉得实力不足又不想重复刷图的可以去创意工坊的图里玩玩

可以重复刷，这个不知道算优点还是缺点，我个人还是觉得可以的

-视角原因操作有时候不方便，时常有误操作情况
---地图由原来的大地图变成了一个个小房间，策略性大大下降，没有战争迷雾导致少了很多刺激感
--取消了回合限制，有时候可以慢慢磨，缺乏紧张感

总的来说是值得尝试的一作，推荐购买

author: {'steamid': '76561197969787923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1642796123}
review:
A dungeon strategy adventure - take your heroes on a turn-based crawl through a few levels and try to defeat the master sorcerer.

Good luck with that, this game is rock hard. Not much in the way of health and punishing random hits.

Can't say I really recommend this one, it's not bad for the asking price, but I didn't think it was a lot of fun.

I give this one 5 it's a random trap! out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960761807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2485, 'last_played': 1663897046}
review:
Okay, I gave it a try, really hard.
I see positive recommendations, which are 100% accurate. So probably there are people who enjoy this game. 

It is kind of painful to do any task, while the strategical choices are very limited.

A few examples:
- you cannot rotate the map, and thus it is often impossible to click on areas behind enemies
- you cannot move your party as a group through empty rooms, but you have to move everyone one by one
- Inventory management is cumbersome
- there limited tactics you can employ
- early dungeons are very simple, and suddenly it becomes much harder (but unfortunately not more interesting)

author: {'steamid': '76561198875752077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1663752707}
review: Idea buona, svolgimento carino e piuttosto intuitivo, ma sistema legnoso per movimento non potendo ruotare la vista (delle volte non è praticamente possibile cliccare sulla casella o l'oggetto che vuoi perché ci sono altri personaggi nel mezzo) e percentuali che non tornano neanche lontanamente con quanto dichiarato.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961191562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1663338730}
review:
Great little game with a nice layer of depth. Growing up with Hero Quest, this takes me back to those golden days and kept me engaged from campaign start to finish (roughly 12 hours, with maybe 2-3 repeat missions just so I could get a fourth character skilled up for the penultimate stage). Highly recommend if you're looking for a relatively casual yet addicting and satisfying gameplay loop with a solid character progression system and beautiful hand-drawn art and scene settings. Core mechanics are also relatively straightforward with a decent layer of depth. 

Final tip: don't try to level all 6 characters in one playthrough - focus on your top 3 and make that death squad your castle conquerors, with some love for a fourth character that you can swap in on the one level that requires 4 heroes. 

Verdict: 9/10, definitely worth your time and money. Thank you, devs, for this love letter to the rpgs of our formative years!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086749002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1664220110}
review:
This game is _simple_.
Lacks randomness in dungeon generation.

Yet if you want a turn brain off dungeon crawler its fun.
Do note that this game is the definition of a ghetto RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198293862212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 839, 'last_played': 1662946272}
review:
以矮人、圣骑和法师的队伍通了硬核模式，最后还是被邪恶术士负伤逃掉了。整个冒险旅程紧张刺激，探索时小心前行，尽可能敛财自强，战斗使用技能时精打细算以防遭遇强敌无技能可用。

矮人是T，装备加20%防御的的板甲，主要用来吸引火力，还可以发现、拆除和放置陷阱。

圣骑是队伍核心，除了治疗、复活、加盾外，群体加攻技能很给力，关键时刻还能给自己套盾做副T。

法师是主力输出，由于在妓院嫖到的buff是随机的，队伍基本都是等法师在妓院首先嫖到加攻的buff后才去探索新场景，未获得加攻buff就去已完成的老场景刷钱和技能瓶。

资金充足情况下，外出冒险需要带足两瓶药水以备不时之需。矮人带两瓶可以回满血的神圣药水，圣骑带一瓶神圣药水和一瓶回复技能的药水，法师带两瓶回复技能的药水。

不知是不是bug，有时候矮人放置嘲讽木桶挡路后，敌人就呆在原地不会进攻了，也不去打木桶，比如那个刽子手就在这种情况下被法师远程耗死了。

游戏比较影响体验的缺点就是不容易选中冒险场景里地上的目标，容易被人物模型挡住，比如进出门的箭头，比如在矮人和怪物间地上放置陷阱或木桶时不容易选中。法师的火墙排列方向比较迷，有时候横放有时候竖放，不知如何选择火墙的排列方向。

虽然游戏时长比较短、boss比较少，但体验到了久违的乐趣，很有策略性，推荐一玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198006977175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1662716029}

author: {'steamid': '76561198097599335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 631, 'playtime_forever': 1466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1443, 'last_played': 1659378118}
review: Довольно интересная  и  своеобразная рпг,  которая  тем  не  менее  по  многим  показателям  (по  крайней  мере по  моим  ощущениям) играется  скорее  как  настолка,  тем  более что есть вариант  сыграть  с  другом. По  мере  продвижения  по  сюжету  вы  сможете  нанимать в  городской  таверне  новых персонажей  (представителей  нового класса,  которых может  быть по  1),  каждый  из которых имеет  собственные  навыки,  доступные  для  него артефакты  и  экипировку (получаемые  за  задания  и  покупаемые в  лавке в  городе) и  прочее. На  высоких сложностях смерть   персонажа  фатальна для  него - вы не  сможете  его воскресить. Впрочем,  вы  и  сами  все  увидите,  сыграв - цена  со скидкой  более,  чем  доступная. Любителям  настолок  и  рпг  рекомендую к  ознакомлению.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120937837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1710015123}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009729580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1655038507}
review:
Not even worth 15, not even worth if it's free. It's a mess. It's clearly a cheap rip-off of a wannabe Darkest Dungeon game. The items are bugged, the game doesn't load half the time, the final levels are insanely unfair, nothing interesting to do in the town (what you see is what you get at the start). Played through it on hardcore, and it still felt like a bore. Please just avoid this game.

Now on a slightly unrelated note, I cannot believe this is the SECOND time they made this game. They somehow thought the first one was so well done and such a good idea that they just have to make a sequel. Then after this absolute sin of a game, they decided hey this concept is SO GOOD we just have to make another. There is another game after this. Unbelievable.

If anything, if you're an up and coming game creator, you should feel inspired by this game. You clearly don't have to have a good product for people to play your game. Make whatever you want!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963591466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1653846730}

author: {'steamid': '76561198167237657', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1669, 'last_played': 1640768933}
review:
Entretenido pero muy corto,

con 10 horas o menos es suficiente para darle la vuelta al juego, y un poco mas si quieres pasartelo en modo hardcore, es gratificante un juego de rol clasico por turnos, pero no es un gran juego almenos te deja jugarlo en cooperativo y para echarse un par de tardes esta bien, 
Tiene pocas opciones, los personajes no son nada personalizables ni en aspecto ni en builds se queda corto en todo
solo lo recomendaría si lo ves en descuento, estaba muy económico, lo compre por curiosidad  me llamo la atención jugarlo en cooperativo,
es muy fácil completar todos los logros, por si quieres archivar un juego con 100% de logros

author: {'steamid': '76561199153239945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1067, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1649419100}
review:
Dark Quest 2 inspired by legendary board game Hero Quest which was released as a video game back in 1991 for Amiga, Commodore 64, Acorn Archimedes, ZX Spectrum etc

Dungeon Crawler with Tactical elements and turn base fighting  as you go deeper and deeper into the castle
there is also a Map Editor so you can make you own quest and you can load them up to the steam-works workshop witch can be found under the community hub and other players can play your dungeon
 it is fun to play a classic game

author: {'steamid': '76561198064562716', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1650568831}
review: Easy Going Coop. We play this with three players online. It is a solid game to relax.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276917304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1648829965}
review: This was a surprisingly charming game that just seeps with a classic feel. It reminds me of old Warcraft missions that specifically revolve around the hero characters. The music, the art style, and the design are all simple and entertaining at the same time. Gameplay is very straightforward, and I often find that the mistakes I make are from being in too much of a hurry. Great way to spend a few bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011539063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1668297022}
review:
Produkt niedopracowany. Źle zbalansowany. Jakby wybrakowany.

Polecę, ale ostro mi coś tu nie pasuje... przeczytajcie powtarzające się uwagi ludzi, by uniknąć rozczarowania

Na pozór... fajna gra. Ciekawa grafika. Przyjemny klimat. Gra się naprawdę fajnie ale do pewnego czasu...

...uważam jednak że, już od początku zbyt ostro narasta poziom trudności i ma się nieodparte uczucie, że ktoś tu drwi z gracza  z podejściem - a niech się męczą oszołomy... - co dało mi uczucie niesmaku już po pierwszej godzince w tej grze...
Granie typu... może zdarzy się jakiś cud i ucieknę - nie jest receptą na jej sukces produktu ale drogą do porażki i szybkiego jej porzucenia przez graczy. Trochę śmieszne jest, że już w etapie kariery 5-6 odczuwa się dość ostro bezsens grania dalej, bo slotów medykamentów i na bajery mało, ogółem tępo to jest przemyślane i jakby wydane w pośpiechu. Nie tędy droga.

nieładnie tak traktować klienta, mimo to do zabawy polecam przy jakiejś promocji. za full cenę zdecydowanie odradzam, bo szkoda na to kasy przy tak nędznym zbalansowaniu rozgrywki.

szkoda że na Steam nie ma opcji do wyboru: nie polecam ani nie odradzam... bo tutaj bym jej użył z przyjemnością.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158192471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1643602693}
review:
Glitchy game that some one threw together to make a buck and never polished. Across the Obolisk is a much better game in the same genre.

If this game was free it would NOT be worth adding to the library.

author: {'steamid': '76561199125517036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1688576813}
review: Being a big fan of HeroQuest, I was very excited to find DarkQuest II. It satisfies my cravings for dungeon crawling and it is fun to play. I wish there weren't so many limitations on potions and weapons, but I can deal with that. It makes you have to pick and choose, so it adds to the strategy. The only negative that I find is that all the adventures I have been on so far limit your party to three. That is what made HeroQuest so engaging is that you had a complete party--A Barbarian (fighter) A Dwarf (second fighter trap disabler and lockpick) An Elf (Archer and Magician) and A Wizard (spell caster). If you could run four party crews it would be a stronger game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998141809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 1592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1708410010}
review: I'm pretty sure this is supposed to be a digitized version of a boardgame, and I think it does a fine job of doing just that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198941394719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1204, 'last_played': 1645903170}
review: Multiplayer is somewhat buggy. Still fun though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006434250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1645320241}
review:
I would rate this with a neutral review, but only barely, if it was possible here on steam. But since there's no such option, then I can't in good conscience give this a positive rating and by extension I can't recommend this game.

Calling it a "poor man's Darkest Dungeon" would be giving this way mroe praise than it deserves. About the only good thing this game has going for it is the art which is indeed very well draw and has a good "dark fantasy" aesthetic.

But the gameplay was only "average" at its rare best moments, because otherwise it's very mediocre because the game is rather simplistic and even then it is poorly balanced. Some classes are way stronger (dark monk, dwarf, paladin knight) and more useful than the others, and the upgrade system is not that rewarding.

Also the UI and menu navigation is very poorly designed and reeks of mobile design.

If it's very cheap and you literally have nothing better to play then maybe get this for curiosity's sake, but I don't recommend.

review: Turn based, tactical dungeon crawler. Nice mix of party skills which allows you to try different combinations of heroes to defeat certain maps. I would have liked more 4 hero maps though. I really enjoyed the artwork and atmosphere of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067054607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 355, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1707103738}
review: I think I played heroquest once growing up so comparing the two is not easy for me. I played the first game which played more like a board game then this but was different. This at least from my perspective tries to elevate the affair with better graphics and gameplay more like a turn based rpg then a board game, Its fun but yes it is grindy . I have enjoyed it the various time I played it . For me I have not burned out completely because I don't exhaust m efforts on a game like this because I know how it is going in . True you might be able to get this on mobile but what can't you these days. I say pick it up even at 8 its a good buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120990805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1636674857}
review:
It's a quite nice, small game. Starts quite well, but then you will have to grind and its clunkyness shows up in all its form. Not really bad, just not really good either.
Okay to buy in a sale and spend a few hours on, but after unlocking all the heroes and finding out you only ever use 3, max 4 it started losing its initial charm.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055362026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1636669239}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034530531', 'num_games_owned': 4365, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 1337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1337, 'last_played': 1636277238}
review:
Fun game that could be better. Looks good, sounds are good enough, story is no more than 'defeat the evil sorcerer and his minions.'

Not easy to 100% because you need to grind forever to get 100,000 gold and completing the game on the hardest difficulty is likely to be very very hard to do as it will require lots of grind and dying.

Downside to this game is poor game design that requires you to grind to be able to level up all of the skills and abilities. This could of been fixed by having more levels so that you don't have to play some levels repeatedly.

Mostly importantly though, it is fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025135223', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1630511759}
review:
Dark Quest 2 est un excellent jeu à la Hero Quest ou encore Warhammer Quest.
De l'aventure, du loot, des équipements, des sorts et des monstres, tout est là.
Dommage que les niveaux soient fixes et non aléatoires, car cela affaibli la rejouabilité.
Il reste qu'il y a beaucoup de héros disponibles, cela fait beaucoup d'équipes possibles, et donc beaucoup de plaisir à parcourir le jeu.
je le recommande.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059751414', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1630229892}
review:
Ein toller Dungeon-Crawler. Nach jedem Kampagnenfortschritt geht es in die Stadt zurück, um:
-Deine Helden zu verbessern (Skilltree)
-Rüstung/Waffen/etc. zu craften
-verschiedene Tränke zu kaufen
-neue Helden zu rekrutieren (6 Heldenklassen)
-verkaufen
-das Bordell besuchen (Extraboni für die nächste Karte)
7 Std. Spielzeit auf dem Schwierigkeitsgrad "Hardcore". Lässt sich auch wunderbar im Koop-Modus spielen. Das Englisch ist einfach gehalten und wirklich leicht zu verstehen. Ich will noch die schönen Texturen loben. Ein muss für alle Tabletop-Fans :)
Für mich eine 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198058662627', 'num_games_owned': 367, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1629584527}
review:
It's a port of a phone game, and boy does it feel like it. Crappy animation, bad art, rudimentary controls, all the usual stuff you get from mobile games.

But under that all, there is actually a halfway interesting turn-based strategy game in there.  But it's buried under a lot of Chinesium Ore that you'll have to drill through to get to it.

Pick it up if you need a time waster, when it goes on sale under 3 dollars.  Or don't. I'm not your dad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008091739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1628778558}
review:
DQ2 is a party-based, turn-based dungeon crawler. As part of the larger campaign, you delve into ~25 different "dungeons", all of which use a similar castle-type of graphics. For each dungeon you will use a party of 2/3/4 (usually 3), choosing from amongst a total of six typical character types (warrior, knight, dwarf, archer, wizard, dark monk). Within each dungeon, you will explore roughly 10-20 rooms. Each room contains a fixed (I think it is fixed anyway), number and type of enemies. On your turn you can use a potion (1 or 2 equipped per dungeon run), use a skill (limited in charges) and/or move/attack. Attacks may be blocked or missed. 

In between dungeon runs there is some minor character building using level-up potions (I forget the exact term) which may be found/farmed in the dungeons. That is, leveling up the various characters is comprised of locating these potions and then spending them on upgrades back at base. Any character may be upgraded, not just those that you used in the dungeon. As such, the typical concept of "experience" is not present. Stats are present, but these typically aren't leveled up either. Rather progression takes the form of passive and active skills.

Pros:
[list]
[*] Character skills are interesting for some of the characters.
[*] No permadeath on normal difficulty, which I prefer.
[*] The equipment crafting/purchasing provided a short-term use for money and provided some level of interest to me for a time (noting that I had bought everything roughly 60% of the way through).
[*] Cheap ($$) on sale.
[/list]

YMMV: 
[list]

[*] Story was basically non-existent. I don't typically care about story too much in a game like this, but if you do look elsewhere.
[*] I didn't care for the level-up system. Characters don't gain experience, they merely gain new powers, and even then they didn't even need to battle to power them up.
[*] If you like finding exciting gear in dungeons (and honestly who doesn't), you won't find any here. All gear (aside from a couple of artifacts) is simply bought back in base.

[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*] The tactical gameplay was severely lacking. You typically try to hit the guy closest to you. Some characters have some limited nukes they can use, but for the most part there aren't a lot of decisions to make.
[*] Given the point above, success in battle was largely attributed to luck as to how often you or your enemy blocked/dodged. This is common in many games (e.g. X-com), but the tactical combat here is so brain-dead that the drawbacks of such a system are highlighted.

[*] There was no real long-term team-building strategy involved, since you could always go back and farm the earlier levels for the level-up potions. That is, there was no specialization in character development. You always end up with a character with all skills maxed. If you had the patience, you could do this for all 6 characters. There are minor decisions as to which skills to level up first, which was fine; but ultimately such decisions didn't matter.

[*] Though you have a roster of 6 characters, realistically you only ever fight with the same 3 or 4. It just doesn't make sense to spend level-up potions on all characters, when you can only ever use 3. The dungeons themselves don't force you to mix-and -match, so I didn't. As such, I never used the archer or wizard since I unlocked them later in the game.
[*] All dungeons looked very similar. 
[*] There were only about 6 or 7 different enemy types across all dungeons.

[/list]

Summary: I initially found DQ2 amusing. The base-building (crafting/leveling up skills) looked intriguing. All those shiny characters and skills, so much to craft. Unfortunately, I found the long term team building strategy lacking and the tactical battles in the dungeons grew tiresome. I did finish the game as a bit of a completionist (where practical), but honestly I was ready to quit about 60% of the way through. If you have time to burn and get this on sale, it may be OK. But probably you should pass.

Overall: 4.5/10

review: Pretty fun Heroquest style game! A good sized campaign to play through. Gradually unlocks stuff for you as you play such as items, abilities and classes. Has a good variety of maps and challenges in the game to keep things interesting. Has Steam Workshop so a way to add more maps to extend the play time if you enjoy it and want more after the grand finale of the main campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071488869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1625004705}
review:
Eine sehr gut umgesetzte Anlehnung an meinen alten Liebling Heroes Quest, das ich damals schon auf dem Amiga bis zum erbrechen gespielt habe. Das Brettspiel war ebenfalls ein Gedicht.
Eine simple und dennoch sucht erzeugendes Game auf D&D Basis.
Einzig hätte ich mir gewünscht das die Animation der Chars ein bissel besser wäre, man hat immer das Gefühl das diese ein wenig humpeln. Die Hintergrund Musik ist Episch jedoch wenig abwechslungsreich.
Alles in allem ein klasse Game !

author: {'steamid': '76561197974784855', 'num_games_owned': 834, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1623836293}
review:
Game actually is a nice concept, but technical side requires a lot of polish.
I am already tired after encountering 2 gamebreaking bugs.
1) You character falls under playable area, you cannot move or do anything, all you can do is to retreat and then restart. It's fine when you just started, but I was near the end of the dungeon.
2) You cannot move at all. Same as #1: if it's early thats fine, but if it's late all you can do is to abandon and restart.

Other issues:
1) Moving is bad. I mean really bad. You want to move this hero in that specific spot during a fight, that happens to be between 2 enemies? Good luck trying to click exact field without either clicking enemy, selecting you other hero.
2) You are placed in a very small room and exit of that room is "hidden" behind your other heroes? Sometimes you need to click like 15 times to finally not select your other heroes, just move to that spot.
3) RNG or bad mechanics? It says in character screen, you have 60% accuracy, you go to fight, and sometimes during a fight (lets say 10 attacks), you are not hitting a single hit. Both: your and enemy stats asks for a lot.
4) Music is so loud. I have it on 3%, yet it's still louder than other things that I am running in the background at 100%.

This is riddicoulous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198407676368', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1623683758}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999868959', 'num_games_owned': 796, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1619282937}
review: I actually like this game. It has a great retro feel of playing the XCOM game in the 90s on an Amiga or a simpler dungeon board game like Hero Quest. Nice graphics and music loops. It strikes a good balance to difficulties. I so very much would want to give a positive review but it unfortunately has some irritating bugs like in "Chamber of Secrets" where my dwarf falls outside the playable area or I am unable to move any of my heroes so that I am forced to retreat back to the village and start the mission a new... After some of this incidents I rage quit the game. I hope this issues are fixed so I can continue my campaign and recommend the game in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347029477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1617652503}
review: A true homage to Hero Quest, bringing a board-game-based conversion classic in to the modern day. Would have liked to have seen more incentive to change party heroes - managing every level with just the Dwarf, Barbarian and Knight with ease - but otherwise I have no complaints. Graphics are good, mechanics are fun and the gameplay is nice and polished. Given the price, it's a no-brainer for any fan of the old turn-based RPG games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059825119', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 1492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1492, 'last_played': 1617540067}

Even better then the first one ( graphics is 3x better, 3 more classes to chose from, game is longer and has more depth, more gear and potions to chose from, more enemies ).

author: {'steamid': '76561198038514178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1687436808}

author: {'steamid': '76561198397654872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1616876247}
review:
There are definitely bugs in functionality. I have experienced all of them, but it would take too long to explain. At the end of the day, it doesn't really matter. You will get over it. I beat hardcore mode co-op with a friend where we were only allowed to use 2 heroes on each map. I am not going to spoil which characters and setups are broken. It is for you to experience. This game is phenomenal. That's really all I can say.

Here are my complaints:
The final boss was a little lackluster considering all the potions, items, and abilities you have acquired at that point.
There is no achievement for completing all the levels. You can skip levels and have *finished the game*.
The achievement to get 100,000 gold is pointless and a waste of time.
Achievements could have also been a little more creative.
2 of the 6 classes are pretty useless comparatively - balance the classes a little better.
You shouldn't be allowed to abandon quest mid fight, even in hardcore mode. It makes for low consequences because if you are going to die, you can just leave and retry.

Things I love:
Being able to give control to your friends to decide who moves first for more strategy
Being able to use abilities and still be allowed to pass control and then continues your turn later
Different story paths with different settings and enemies
Fate and magic resist are great mechanics. Would love to see more mechanics like these in future games.

Suggestions for Dark Quest 3:
Experiment with enemies summoning enemies. This could help make the final boss more difficult or serve as a tool for common rooms as well.
Add more levels
Make it more difficult
Improve achievement list
Maybe add a few more types of attacking other than melee, magic, arrows. Examples - a musician attacking with sound, a whip user for longer ranged melee, aoe attacks that have like a range of squares they can hit, etc.
Fix bugs, at least the ones that have to do with functionality

author: {'steamid': '76561197972011136', 'num_games_owned': 1271, 'num_reviews': 794, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1616630978}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057456440', 'num_games_owned': 2617, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1060, 'last_played': 1614364372}
review:
悪の魔術師を倒すべく、クォータービューのダンジョンを探索していく、ターンベースストラテジー系RPG。
Lvの概念がなく、習得スキルと装備品を駆使して進めていくタイプ。
ローグライクではなく、固有のマップシステム。

前作の記号だけで進めていく簡易的な描画ではなく、よく描き込まれたマップやキャラクターなので、頑張って作った感は伝わってきます。
キャラクターは前作3人（戦士、ドワーフ、魔法使い）に加え、ナイト（回復特化型）、アーチャー、モンクと、バリエーションが増えました。
ただ、ダンジョンでは実質3人パーティが上限なので、結局使わないキャラクターが半分は出てくることに。
満遍なく育てるよりは、「こいつは使える！」と感じたキャラを集中して強化した方が安定します。
クリア済みのマップに再度潜ることはできるので、アイテム類やお金はある程度十分に手に入ります。
（再度同じマップに入ると、敵が強くなっていたりしますが）

内容的には、1つの村を拠点とし、ダンジョン内の短めの各エリアを探索し、クリアすると次のエリアが解除される方式です。
ポーション（スキル習得に必要）の個数がマップ毎に決められており、それを探しながら出口へ向かうプレイがメインとなります。
1マップはサクッと終わる長さと難易度で、ノーマルでも比較的優しめで適度なものでした。
（終盤、かなりの敵が出てくるため、どのキャラのどのスキルを重視するかが鍵となります。）

ターンベースのため、こちらのパーティ全員が行動した後、敵全員が行動するという、『ファイアーエムブレム』に近い感じのシステムです。
違いとしては、スキル（魔法や技など）を使った後でも行動は終わらないことと、移動した後でも攻撃できることでしょうか。
（通常攻撃するとその場で終了になってしまうため注意）
例えば、ある場所に移動してトラップを設置してから逃げることも可能です。

スキルはかなり特徴があり、使用回数が限られていることからも厳選しなければなりません。
攻略にはスキル次第で成否が分かれるなど、なかなかシビアな局面も出てきます。
また、回復手段も魔法とポーション（２つまで）と少なく、リソース管理が必要となります。
この辺りは、序盤から少しずつ掴んでいけるので大丈夫でしょう。
トラップ解除や遠距離の敵をどうするかなど、様々な方法が考えられると思いますので、自分なりの攻略法を探るのは楽しかったです。


＜世界観レビュー＞

ダークファンタジーな世界観が魅力です。
キャラクターは全体的にベタではありますが、スキルで特徴を出せているため、それぞれに魅力があります。
主役は特に決まっていないらしく、誰でも自由に選択していけるため、バーバリアンは外してもOKですｗ
（個人的には、ナイト、ドワーフ、アーチャーがオールマイティで安定でした。）

おすすめスキルは、ナイトの「ブレス（PT全体の攻撃力が上昇）」、「ディバインシールド（攻撃、魔法吸収）」辺りです。
逆にドワーフの「タル投げ」はタルが近くにないと投げられないらしく、全く使わずにクリアしました。
使いどころを教えていただきたい！

BGMも雰囲気をうまく出せていて良かったです。
前作は最初だけ流れてほぼ無音な状態（あれはバグ？）でしたので、進化に感動しました。
じっくりと世界観に浸りながら、かつ比較的短時間でクリアしたい人にはお勧めなゲームです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198152360232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1612651477}
review:
You start off playing the barbarian character and explore various dungeons by speaker to the elder in the village.

As you accumulate gold you can buy potions/equipment or hire other heroes to join your cause. There are around 15-20 missions in total however I frequently replayed my favourite ones again and again to gain extra gold and magic pots which are essentially traded for upgrading skills. This game is essentially turn based and the below are a few tips:

For your turn each character you can use the following actions: a skill/moving and performing a normal attack for one such character. Note that I was using all my actions for one character and then moving to the next character.

I realise now that I had the option of say moving one character then using another character to perform a normal attack and then using another character to perform a special attack.

Use the mini map: Sometimes it can be hard to keep track of where you are and you might end up missing out on loot; places where you have not yet explored are visble but are faded out. 

When you find the treasure rooms use the dwarf for this mission if you have upskilled him in the art of getting extra gold.

A decent game and well worth the money spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060115118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1658401878}
review:
It's relatively simple in scope but interesting, challenging and fun. Good game for those who enjoy games like Hero Quest, RPGs and may remember the old dungeon crawler, Rogue but much better graphics, animation and dungeons. I even think D&D fans could get into it when they want a challenge but also to relax and drain out some of the days tension and stress. I would like to see more monsters and critters added to it other than goblins, orcs and goblin magic users; this would improve the scope of the game a lot. 
  But, I've only put six hours in on it so far and perhaps, as one gets deeper in the game, more variety of monsters and critters will show up. At least, one hopes so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093059898', 'num_games_owned': 683, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1609106128}
review:
Przyjemna casualowa gierka w gatunku Turn-based Tactics której daleko od hardcorowych męczarni Darkest Dungeon czy wyzwań serii XCOM. Ale to właśnie jej największa zaleta, odmienność od czołowych tytułów i bardziej na luzie podejście do tematu. 

Uproszczenie rozgrywki powoduje, że gramy sobie spokojnie mlaskając słodkie zbożowe ciasteczko popijając powoli gorącą herbatką zamiast smaku zagryzionych do krwi warg przy przedzieraniu się przez lochy Darkest Dungeon. Jednocześnie gra uniknęła największej pułapki casualowych skrótów czyli nie obraża naszej inteligencji i nie jest nudna, wymaga strategicznego myślenia i planowania, jest cały czas wyzwaniem. Co więcej była dla mnie na tyle wciągająca, że wpadłem w syndrom "jeszcze jeden quest, jeszcze jedna komnata" co skończyło się przejściem gry w 2 dni (ok 13 godzin).

Grafika jest świetna, rysunki postaci są mega klimatyczne w stylu komiksów fantasy, naprawdę chce się zwiedzać ten "świat" i poznawać nowe stworki i pomieszczenia (trochę szkoda, że podziemia i komnaty nie są generowane za każdym razem losowo).

Przed rozpoczęciem rozgrywki polecam przeczytać świetny poradnik zastępujący sekcję "Pomoc" w grze (która poza krótkim samouczkiem nie istnieje ;)). Na kilku stronach jest tam wszystko co powinniście wiedzieć a pozwoli uniknąć niepotrzebnych "niespodzianek" w temacie mechanik gry. Link:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1296039414

Gra ma obsługę Warsztatu Steam ale za bardzo nie ma jak czerpać z n1ego benefitów bo ile można przechodzić podobne mapki :) To może być największa wada gry, brak motywacji do ponownego przechodzenia jej od nowa. Ale czy naprawdę jest to wada przy tej małej, casualowej produkcji przecenianej 3x do roku -80% (6zł)? Moim zdaniem zupełnie nie. Za tę cenę dostajemy 10-20h przedniej zabawy i satysfakcji.

P.S. jeżeli chcecie zdobyć wszystkie osiągnięcia to polecam po 5-10 questach zacząć grę od nowa na najwyższym poziomie trudności. Zwykle wtedy znamy już wszystkie "sztuczki" i przejście gry na tym poziomie nie będzie wielkim problemem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006096059', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1377, 'last_played': 1609070054}
review:
Guilty pleasure for adults growing up playing Hero Quest™ as a kid

[b][u]Pros:[/u][/b]

- lovely animations
- reasonable amount of characters and skills
- reasonable campaign length and difficulty level(s)
- even a few cut scenes
- level editor
[b][u]Cons:[/u][/b]

- no voice over for in-game text messages
- benefit of artifacts not revealed beforehand
- advice feature in village totally useless

author: {'steamid': '76561198030501391', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1621125084}
review:
The question is; this game borrowed from Darkest Dungeon or vice versa?

Anyways, a decent game worth its price. I just think it could definitely be improved in a way that wouldn't bother the player for click click click issue. If only we could assign 1-2-3-4 for hero choices, everything could be easier. And a Divinity Original Sin type "Chain" feature could be useful. So out of combat all characters could be chained and instead of clicking them one by one you just one click to move them all. 

Despite of its simplicity and UX issues, it is definitely worth trying out. If you like old school (board like) rpg, dont miss this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041769225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1609754916}
review:
Gelegenheitsspiel ganz im Sinne unter anderem des Brettspiels Hero Quest.
Wer damals also Abende mit Freunden in Hero Quest versank, der kann gerne zugreifen. Leider minimalistischer als das Original aber aufgrund des Nostalgiefaktors kommt man gerne immer wieder zumal eine Mission selten länger als 20 Minuten dauert und somit ein optimaler Genuss ist für Menschen die weniger Zeit haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028749362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1606379416}
review:
Clickety-click-click........

Decent little Indie game but unfortunately suffers from a number of issues which make it tedious to play:

- The controls. For some brilliant reason, the developers decided this game had to be played entirely with the mouse. All those nice quality of life features you're accustomed to like pressing 'M' to bring up the map, ESC to close menu screens etc, are sadly lacking. Now you have to move the mouse and go clickety-click-click all over the place to do anything.
- The interface. You can eventually have a party of 4 characters but you have to move each character individually in a dungeon. Click once on the character to select them, click again on the tile you want them to move to. Click once again to move them to the selected tile. Rinse and repeat. For every single character in the group. You also can't rotate the camera so selecting a character that is partially obscured by another character or enemy on the screen can be a bit tricky.
- Fiddly mechanics. It's wonderful fun when my barbarian character misses 3 or 4 attacks consecutively against a goblin with a 20% block chance, yet that same goblin needs only 1 or 2 hits to hit my barbarian who has a 40% block chance against the goblin's attacks. And this sort of RNG bs seems to happen regularly. Makes me feel like I'm playing XCOM all over again.
- Poor tutorial for beginners and no in-game help function. You will have to look up any help for this game online.
- Repetitive music. Rather just turn it off completely.

I also came across an issue where my gold all disappears each time I enter a new dungeon. Not sure if this is a bug or how the game is supposed to work. What's the point of accumulating money if it just keeps disappearing each time I enter a new dungeon???

author: {'steamid': '76561198071952384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1628527542}
review: Definitely you should buy if you are a fun or not of the Hero Quest board game. Is has great art style , immersive music and combined produce an over all enchanting experience. The mechanics are simple but used together can be complex.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064904685', 'num_games_owned': 1184, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1696169582}
review:
На первый взгляд напоминает порт с мобилок. Уж больно там всё кликабельно, не хватает кнопок переключения конкретного персонажа - 1,2,3 и т.д. Кнопки карты, не вижу чего то сложного так сделать. Единственное что нашёл так это клавиша TAB - последовательно переключение между персонажами. Не ну рили, без хоткеев кликер какой-то...
Рисовка порадовала, есть катсценка с озвучкой, что тоже порадовало. Имеется кооп и чатик, нужно будет попробовать с кем нибудь. а то каждого персонажа задолбаешься прокликивать дабы вывести на новую локу. А вообще после зачистки  локации могли бы сделать функции - "следовать за игроком" К примеру первым героем пошёл на выход а остальные за ним. А так в общем пока смотрится весьма не плохо.

Вот тут я прохожу туториал на Русском языке https://youtu.be/W5CIsLKg-zM

author: {'steamid': '76561198068479644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1606058083}
review:
Yes, it's a Hero Quest clone. (For those born in the 90s and later, Hero Quest was very popular fantasy board game.) 

You play as fantasy characters (Barbarian, Dwarf Warrior, Paladin like Knight, Mage etc.) who have to walk through dungeons, slay monsters and search for treasure. Sounds good, doesn't it? 
It's a turn-based game, so you have time for tactics. You can level up your heroes and buy new gear. The dungeons are only slightly repetitive, but there are a lot of little differences to keep it interesting. There are many monsters with different skill sets, nasty traps and hidden passages.

The style is a bit comic; it has certainly some tong-in-cheek humour and looks very nice. The sound is also fine.

If you like these kinds of games, I can recommend this one to you.

The only real negative: It's a bit short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016949959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1633504813}
review:
Look, I love HeroQuest, the board game that Dark Quest 2 is based on, so I had to try this out, especially for the price.  

Unfortunately it just does not live up to HeroQuest's awesomeness.  The lack of personalisation with the Character sheets is disappointing.  They don't even have names and you cant name them.  HeroQuest also had good gameplay balance and immersive rooms with doors and furniture for a board game and Dark Quest seems to be lacking that?  Just the same old cliffs, bare rooms and corridors all over the place. Hard to believe a board game actually did that better. 

The balance seems completely off.  In HeroQuest you could play all 4 Characters right from the get go. Here you are forced to start with one character and earn the rest.  And the Monster to Player ratio gets insanely unfair way too early in the game and the Monsters seem to have just as high chance of blocking hits as players, which most definitely was not the case in HeroQuest. The monsters only had one block shield on each dice, so it was like rolling a 6 to block each hit.  The players had a much higher chance of blocking hits against the monster fodder, because they were Hero Adventurers of course! Not in Dark Quest 2, the overwhelming amount of monsters block many of their hits and the players fail to block a lot of theirs, leading to their death very quickly.  Also in HeroQuest any player could search for traps. In dark quest you need the dwarf. Only the dwarf can search! 

But then again, you can go back and redo the old easier quests, you have already done before moving on with new quests. That can allow you to gain more loot more easily. Which makes me feel like this has been done on purpose to create a repetitive grind in order to get your party well equipped enough to keep progressing through the campaign.  It really cuts down that element of feeling like you're achieving something and making progress.  It puts you in a boring ground hog day experience and I don't like that. 

Dark Quest 2 is sort of a feel good bit of nostalgia for me being a HeroQuest board game fan, but at the same time its very disappointing and fails to deliver what truly made HeroQuest a great game.  Plus you can't beat the social aspect of sitting around a table with a few friends and beers playing it.  Sorry Dark Quest 2, I still love HeroQuest and you make me wish even more that I currently had some cool nerdy mates around to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008724226', 'num_games_owned': 1933, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1601591637}
review:
Fun game at the beginning, absolute RNG garbage from mid to end.

There is no story, no "lore" in game just some random village and some random castle you have to go through to kill some E V I L sorcerer. Period.

Graphics are nice, but animations are almost non-existant.

Music is annoying and repetitive.

Gameplay... Almost every enemy has "defence" stat which translates as "chance to hit". No matter what the game shows the chances are terrible - fighters will miss 3 out of 4 attacks to enemies with 40% defence. Killing even 1 enemy with 70% takes shit ton of time and I literally saw my fighters miss 2 attacks in a row against enemy with 10% defence. Traps are OP, they do guaranteed damage and AI is so stupid you literally can put a trap right before his nose and he gladly step on it. There is no "back attack" or flanking, your gnome can stand with four enemies around him and he'll block all their attacks (or won't because RNG in this game sucks), same goes for enemies - you can spend several turns attacking one enemy from several directions and he'll block all atacks because his fucking defence is 70%. There are active and passive skills, but half of them are useless, like taunting barrel for gnome, others are a must have, like the ability to remove traps for the same gnome.

Game quickly becomes boring and annoying because of all RNG elements. And, during on of the missions my archer shot the enemy and game just froze - I could open menu or map, but couldn't continue the fight, the arrow was just hovering in air...
