author: {'steamid': '76561197972445514', 'num_games_owned': 1850, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1586064339}
review:
Gorgeous looking and great sounding dungeon crawler which unfortunately gets very frustrating and tedious after the first few missions where i found my party of two or three characters facing off against ten or more enemies packed into one room only to die or barely survive where my one single surviving character gets butchered in the next room facing the same overwhelming odds. 

I can only choose between two or three characters depending on the mission even though i have unlocked all of them which if memory serves me correctly are six in total. So here i am on missions where having at least four characters would have helped greatly but am unable to do so. I have heard it is even less in multiplayer mode.

The above is made worse due to character skills and magic unable to recharge so you can only use them once per mission. Potions which allow more then one use of skills or restoring mana for magic quickly get used up due to the overwhelming number of enemies. 

There is no way to pan around the map so many times i am unable to see behind enemies which is a major pain when my character is surrounded by a bunch of giant shield carrying orcs as i try to have said character do something. In one case my barbarian died and my healer was going to cast a resurrection spell but could not because my slain character was not visible. All the while the same healer can cast bless and party heal spells from anywhere on the map without needing line of sight.

Combat is also a mess especially in later levels where am constantly missing yet enemies keep escaping death over and over as they walk through my mages fire wall as the escaped death icon appears over them with diabolical laughter filling the air as they get close enough to do damage. Combat feels very unbalanced with way too much RNG going on.

Here is hoping with many a crossed finger that Brain Seal Ltd much anticipated upcoming pc board game version works out all these kinks and turns out to be as much fun as the first DARK QUEST game is. 

DARK QUEST 2, so much potential yet so unbalanced.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063817153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1596990784}
review:
Si eres un nostálgico del famoso juego de tablero "Heroquest" este es tu juego.
Se trata de un juego sencillo de gráficos bonitos y música agradable (puedes escuchar la banda sonora gratis en el famoso reproductor Sptfy o comprarla aquí) que es sencillo de aprender pero lleva tiempo dominar.

El juego no es muy complejo y tiene una variedad aceptable de retos y personajes a manejar (clásico Bárbaro, Mago, Clérigo, Arquero, Enano y luego el misterioso Monje Oscuro). Puedes volver a jugar las fases que termines aunque aumentan cada vez de dificultad y por supuesto hay un editor de mapas y puedes descargar gratis campañas y mapas que ha hecho la comunidad, lo que le da más vida al juego.

Además se pueden comprar pociones, subir habilidades, comprar objetos, armas o talismanes con propiedades mágicas y tiene varios modos de dificultad y multijugador.

Recomendado si eres fan de los clásicos juegos de Rol de toda la vida o el universo Tolkien, de vez en cuando sale de oferta al 50%,

author: {'steamid': '76561197963976964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1596615128}

review: Well it's good for 1 and 3 players. But if you intend to play 2 player co-op it like me and my bro did it's impossible. They don't give you the third character and thus you can't survive the dungeons later on because it doesn't scale down. If you play solo or find a 3rd player it can be fun. Kind of like a Hero Quest virtual feel. It's no punk game, it can be quite challenging, and 2 players it's impossible. I'll likely uninstall because finding a 3 player on when we are on has proved difficult. But the game is fun so I'll thumbs up it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066356335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1589315426}
review:
RPG a turni ispirato ad "HeroQuest", gioco da tavolo che avevo quando ero piccolo e che ho giocato fino a consumare le pedane delle miniature di plastica. Dark Quest 2 è fatto bene, la visuale isometrica e lo stile di gioco ricordano molto altri due videogiochi ispirati al famoso gioco da tavolo: "HeroQuest" e "HeroQuest II: Legacy of Sorasil" che giocai su Amiga 500.
Se vi piace il genere, fa il suo figurone in libreria.

author: {'steamid': '76561198301897701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1655705835}
review: Отличная игра, радует и прорисовка подземелий, героев, врагов и предметов, и атмосфера, а музыка вообще выше всяких похвал (для подобной игры).

author: {'steamid': '76561198043436185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1616136155}
review:
This is a great little game that tries to recreate the tabletop D&D or HeroQuest board games you played as a kid.  There's nothing bad I can say about this game! My play time was about 11 hours through the campaign.  The difficulty level keeps you on your toes and you can definitely get your party killed if you are not careful.  The heros themselves are cool and fun with unique powers and abilities, but you'll find the classes that match your play style and use and abuse them.

RPG elements are light, if you are looking for story-driven D&D a la Balder's Gate, this game is not it, it's pure dungeon crawling, baby!

This game is a total gem, very well done, and well made, and there's really no reason NOT to buy if you love tabletop games, strategy games, or dungeon crawlers,

author: {'steamid': '76561198021901175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 1109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1109, 'last_played': 1590074265}

A fun tactical boardgame rpg in the same vein as Heroquest and Warhammer Quest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062206693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1588230181}
review:
I only played this in single player. I was not expecting much so was actually pretty pleasantly surprised how much fun I had even if it felt pretty old school. Recommended for a short romp through dungeons in a D&D sort of setting. You can unlock all six characters in one playthrough and after the early-game, most levels will allow you to use 3 at a time. There is no leveling up - instead you enhance your heroes through skillpoints (by finding magic potions in the dungeons) and better equipment as purchased through gold. Thus, it is quite easy to catch up an unused hero to your party. 

Also mixing the cast can be beneficial as some excel at certain things than others. Some might easily die in areas with lots of ambushes for example, so speccing for survivability may be better. In other cases lots of AOE may help; and in some scenarios like against a lone boss, crowd control is useless.

It's a short game and can be completed in one weekend. I topped out just shy of 7 hours. After playing through once there isn't much point in playing again. There is a hardcore mode for challenging yourself or co-oping with others as reasons to keep playing if either is your things.

Anyways, fun short game, would like to see a sequel of sorts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972024114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1587886347}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008657294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 3914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3393, 'last_played': 1597532474}
review:
Superbe, magnifique, splendide.

Voilà tout est dit.

La musique (qui se compose de trois morceaux) est superbe, tout à fait dans l'esprit.

Ce jeu est une référence à Heros Quest.

Les combats se font au tour par tour, via des cases et chaque personnage possède ses propres talents.

Chaque quête nous octroirera un objectif à accomplir, jamais rédondant pour atteindre notre but final.

La durée est excellente en Hardcore, que je recommande, afin d'apporter un vrai challenge.

Rejouabilité très intéressante vu qu'il est possible de composer son groupe parmi 6 héros >> certaines quêtes n'autorisant que 2/3 personnages.

Un jeu à acheter les yeux fermés !

author: {'steamid': '76561197977197768', 'num_games_owned': 3607, 'num_reviews': 459, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1587584127}
review:
Dark Quest 2 est la suite directe du premier volet... Le méchant Sorcier est de retour et cette fois-ci les aventuriers sont bien décidés à le renvoyer en enfer pour de bon.

Plus joli graphiquement et mieux animé, mais cela n'est pas très dur car le premier volet ressemblait plus à un jeu de plateau avec des pions, on a le choix entre 6 héros aux capacités différentes (le barbare, la guerrière, le nain, l'archère, le moine sorcier et le mage).

Le principle est toujours le même, on choisit son équipe, on lui attribue l'équipement (qui est crafté une fois et qui reste permanent contrairement au premier volet), les potions que l'on veut. Et une fois cela fait, on part à la conquête d'un niveau du chateau...

On y récupéra des jarres d'expérience qui permettront de monter les skills actifs et passifs de notre équipe et l'argent qui servira à acheter les potions, la résurrection d'un compagnon le cas échéant et le craft d'équipements. 

Le jeu n'est pas plus difficile ou moins facile que le premier volet et il n'est pas rare de perdre faute d'avoir pris le ou les personnages nécessaires pour résister à certaines occasions. 

Il faut bien comprendre que pour avancer, le premier point à avoir en tête c'est de booster les skill de ses personnages quitte à refaire 2 ou 3 fois le même niveau...
La disposition d'un niveau ne change pas d'une partie à l'autre aussi, il devient très vite facile de savoir où aller en priorité, idem pour les ennemis qui sont toujours au même endroit...

Si je le recommande, c'est surtout au fait que malgré la difficulté apparente, il n'est pas si difficile que cela et que pour ceux qui aiment le tour par tour et qui trouverait qu'une douzaine de niveau c'est court, le Steam Workshop permet d'avoir de nouvelle carte pour éviter la lassitude.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023012065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1601062555}

author: {'steamid': '76561197984587940', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1586059616}
review:
There's a lot to enjoy about this game. Tragically, there are a handful of things which absolutely ruin the experience.

Pros:
-Diverse and interesting classes
-Diverse and interesting items and potions which can accent the classes
-Moderately challenging strategy
-Levels replayable at harder difficulty
-Downloadable maps via the steam workshop for potentially limitless gameplay

Cons:
-Multiplayer is broken. A decent chunk of the game is only playable by two characters. The majority of levels are playable by three characters, and at the end there are a handful of four character levels. Four players are allowed in a party, but the game is bugged and will not allow four players to play together at all. When you drag a character into the fourth portrait slot to begin the game, that character merely replaces one of the three characters there. Furthermore, each player is only allowed to control one character. So if you and a friend wanted to tag team a four player mission, you would be forced to do so with only two characters.

You would assume that a player could slot two characters in and control them in a multiplayer game. You would assume that since the game will adjust difficulty based on the number of times a level has been played, it would do the same to allow three players into a two player mission. You would assume that since the game allows four players to be in a party together that four players would be able to play together (or that it had even been tested, which it clearly wasn't). This is sadly not the case, whether it be a campaign mission or a downloadable map. On top of that, we encountered numerous bugs where we would have to back out of a level because somehow our games had fallen out of sync, or restart the client altogether because the game invites were broken.

This game would have gotten my recommendation with all the praise in the world for its charm and challenge. But since my group of four bought this game explicitly so that we could all play together, I can't give it a thumbs up. It's very disappointing to see the devs working on their next game while key components of this entry remain completely and utterly broken. All in all, this is least disappointing as a single-player experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039117039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1585972706}
review:
Don't buy this game if you are a group of four players.

We bought the game to play four players and it can't.

Even worse. I found some maps for four players in the workshop (by the way, the maps in the workshop are hidden into colections). When assembling the group, 4 slots appear, but we can only put 3 characters. If we put 1 more character, it takes the place of another already placed.

PLEASE, CAN ANY DEVELOPER RESPOND TO THESE PROBLEMS?

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

No compren este juego si son un grupo de cuatro jugadores.

Con un grupo de amigos compramos este juego para jugar de a cuatro, ya que a la hora de armar party te deja invitar hasta otros tres jugadores, pero no hay forma de jugar de a cuatro.

Toda la campaña es para tres (pero ojo! pueden conectarse cuatro jugadores).  Por lo cual dijimos: Bueno vamos a buscar/hacer mapas para jugar de a cuatro.  Despues de volvernos locos para encontrar mapas en el workshop (estan escondidos dentro de colecciones) encontramos unos cuantos que a la hora de elegirlos para jugar dicen que son para cuatro jugadores.  Armamos la party, somos cuatro en el lobby, elegimos el mapa, aparecen cuatro slots para poner los personajes... buenisimo!!!  NOOO solo se pueden poner tres, al querer poner el cuarto personaje en el cuarto slot, se reemplaza el segundo por ese elegido (el cuarto slot siempre queda vacío).

Estuve buscando en las discuciones sobre este tema y UN DESARROLLADOR en un hilo del 2018 reconoce que es un bug y practicamente que no tienen idea de como arreglarlo...

Pasaron dos años, el juego lo siguen vendiendo, y no solucionaron eso.  Lo mas frustrante es que como dije mas arriba, podes invitar y ser cuatro jugadores en el lobby del juego, pero es imposible jugar cuatro juntos.

En definitiva, SI SON CUATRO AMIGOS QUE QUIEREN JUGAR NO LO COMPREN, ES TIRAR EL DINERO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007189302', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1583463409}
review:
Ez a játék tulajdonképpen bevezetés a szerepjátékok világába, az első szint. Egy az egyben a Hero Quest a régi amigás és pc-s időkből. Még a karakterek is, de teljesen felhozták a mai színvonalra látvány stb. terén, megmaradva a faék egyszerűségnél.
Nosztalgiából ajánlom, illetve ha érdekelnek a szerepjátékok és most akarsz megismerkedni a témával. Jó volt újra megtapasztalni kicsit honnan is indultak a dolgok anno..

author: {'steamid': '76561197975640065', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1584885180}
review:
This game had promise and some nice ideas, however the execution was not good. It felt like it was released unfinished and/or without testing. Also it felt like it was translated to english from some other language and not actually that well. A bit grindy, super repetitive and way too random - I felt like I was fighting RNG rather than solving problems with tactics and strategy.

It felt like a poor port of a mobile game, like it was not meant to be played on PC at all. 

Only play this if you get it very cheap and you have tried Into the breach, Druidstone, Legend of Grimrock 1 and 2, Might and Magic X and if you really really need some more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988257417', 'num_games_owned': 1691, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1583905558}
review:
It's cute but very simplistic and the strategic layer is not very deep. I would not bother with this as there are much better titles in its kind.

PROS

- Cute art
- Simple and playable single handed, nice for when having launch or eating (should be a mobile game really)
- The fact that it is short to complete alevitates the fact that it is so simple, it doesn't overstay its welcome and ends just about when you're bored of it

CONS

- Lack of attention to details, it is often hard to click something because your hero or a monster is sitting on it or in front of it and blocking your click
- It surprises you with level ending, while you haven't done all the rooms... at first it's a very specific door, but other missions end when you kill a monster or click on an item, for this reason it's hard to know what is gonna make it end and you do miss loot because of that
- What characters and abilities are best is very obvious and there is not much variety in what heroes you pick because you do need your tank, your healer, and your magic damage, so the choices are too obvious
- Same thing with skills, the good ones are very far and above the others so you don't really strategize as much as just pick the obvious efficient skills

review: A very fun game with simple turn based mechanics and just enough tactical decisions to keep you going.  A steal at the current 4.79 sale price but also worth the 7.99 if you like these types of games.  A very pleasant diversion from other more complex games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988534641', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 2378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1698554921}
review:
It's not often do you find a computer game that can function well as both a video game and a table top dungeon crawler.  It's turn base mechanics are pretty simple, you get moves and abilities based off of Golden Axe Potions you find.  (Ok, well they look like the magic potions from Golden Axe) and you got yourself a grand ol time hacking and slashing green skinned freaks.

Each class has something to offer beyond their more obvious roles... Warrior is tanky and loves to do high damage, where as the Dwarf is tanky but loves to disable traps, Archer is high damage but good on utility like the dwarf...the Knight is tanky but can heal... the Monk kills everything and the Wizard... Wizard's stuff... and sometimes makes obscene balloon animals (not really).

Though...the campaign itself seems short with a tight curve on difficulty in some respects - the game shines really bright on 2 aspects.  Yes you can replay levels but each successful time ups the difficulty...and you can play custom maps that add to your "Phat Lewt" as you cool kids would say.  (No? Kids don't say that anymore!?)

Though while some custom maps are great... others are just straight awful - but that's the blessing and curse of user generated content.

Overall I'd say it's a fun lil romp though personally I'm curious about actually playing this with a couple of friends and seeing how well this translates to multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023295634', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1574105776}
review:
Tried playing it with one friend and the game is broken and you cant win it with just two players. The last maps are.. badly designed when it comes to coop unless you have all characters with you. 
Game mechanics are disabled in multiplayer, such as all the artifacts. Because they were bugged, and a year or more later it hasn't been fixed. I guess the Disable button is easier to find.

The game were fun until that last two maps where you cant win with two players, unless you cheese it and run past all enemies and traps. If they fix the multiplayer I'd really recommend the game, but now nope.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000368827', 'num_games_owned': 1253, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1582477005}
review:
This game may be deep in terms of the amount of stuff you can unlock, I wouldn't know. Unfortunately, the moment-to-moment core gameplay is quite boring and repetitive, and I found myself very quickly losing interest. 

This game is supposedly inspired by Hero Quest, but I fear it did not understand that most of the enjoyment in HQ came from the imagination of the players; while the board may have been sparse, the description of the mission, the presence of Zargon and the implication of actual space made up for a lot in the board game. In this game, however, the rooms are almost entirely empty in terms of setting, at least at the beginning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064952498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1582191633}
review: very nice game, reminds me Hero quest , in far better

author: {'steamid': '76561198025965617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 3385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1602381252}
review:
Très belle surprise.

Seul bémol, quand on joue à 2 on ne peut que jouer 2 personnages. Même pr les missions à 3 ou 4 max.

Recommandation :
1 - Monter Monk en premier. OP. 
2 - La Knight en 2nd. Soin très utile (longévité/polvalent)
3 - Nain ou le Barbare en 3ème. Selon votre préférence. Nain est mieux pour tanker, barbare pour dps.
4 - Wizard. Sorts intéressant mais plus faible que le Monk.
5 - Ne montez pas la chasseuse/archer. Trop faible à mon goût. Elle fait des choses moins bien que les autres personnages. Pas rentable.

Team idéale : Moine/Knight/Nain/Barbare ou remplacer le Nain/Barbare par le Wizard.
Le nain à l'avantage de repérer les pièges et d'apporter un bonus de gold.

Items : 
Moine  : Grimoire qui donne des charges en plus / Pendentif qui augmente les PV. 
Nain : Armure de plate / Casque à pique
Barabre : Épée du barbare / Épée normale ou Bottes de rapidité (bonus de déplacement)
Knight : Bouclier anti flèche (circonstanciel) / Armure de maille ou Pendentif de fate ou Bottes antipiège si vous ne jouez pas avec le Nain.
Wizard : Les 2 grimoires de dégâts de sorts ou Pendentif de Fate ou Grimoire qui vous donne une charge aux sorts en plus.

Farmer les missions du début autant que vous pouvez pour accumuler les Fioles pour les sorts. Ne finissez pas un niveau si vous n'avez pas toutes les fioles.

Potions : Les seules potions utiles à mon goût sont la potion divine qui vous rend full PV et la potion qui vous redonne une charge de sort. De façon circonstancielle, il y a aussi celle qui réduit les dégâts subis à 1pts de dégâts pour la salle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102323721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1550935632}
review:
Ce jeu m’évoque Donjons and Dragons, boîte rouge d’il y a quarante ans. Ce n’est pas foncièrement mauvais, c’est caricatural et… rigide.
Caricatural comme peu profond, pas simple (la simplicité est une qualité à mon sens), plutôt figé dans des certitudes d’un autre temps.
Rigide comme les animations qui ne font pas rêver. À titre personnel, je préfère le parti pris du carton de Cardhunter.
Mais ça se laisse jouer de temps à autre, par nostalgie, pourquoi pas.
Au rayon curiosité :
1. les attaques dans le dos ou sur le côté n’ont pas d’incidence sur les chances de toucher ou alors ce n’est mentionné nulle part, or il s’agit là d’un passage obligé de ce type de jeu qui singe le jeu de rôle. De plus, cela améliorerait l’aspect tactique du jeu.
2. en parlant de nulle part, il n’existe pas livret du joueur, nous devons tout apprendre en expérimentant ; le tutoriel de début est sommaire.
3. ne pas pouvoir échanger une ou des potions est totalement irréaliste.
4. n’avoir qu’une sortie possible à chaque donjon est ridicule puisqu’on est bien entré quelque part
5. devoir sortir ses personnages un à un même quand on a exploré toute une salle est fastidieux et profondément barbant.
Je ne fais pas souvent ça mais pour le prix, avec un peu d’indulgence, ça se tente. Ça n’est pas passionnant, ça reste divertissant pour peu qu’on apprécie le tour par tour (semi-)tactique.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000000375', 'num_games_owned': 4080, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1578260210}
review: Needs a little work. Pathing for your characters and enemies is weird. Enemies will only attack what is closest to them, not what is most strategic. If your character is blocking a square, it's frustrating to click around it. Starts off fun, but gets tedious. Replaying the maps gets really hard really quick. Once you get all the items and skills there is nothing else to keep the momentum going.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992765686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 828, 'last_played': 1577924799}
review:
I really enjoyed this. It's a fairly simple turn based dungeon crawler, with Dungeons & Dragons / Sword and Sorcery roots. 

The game is a little grindy, but I enjoyed that aspect of it. Theres some decent replayability.

The draw backs are that navigation can get a little tedious. I wish there was a group travel option to make movement through explored/non-threatening rooms faster. The game could also use just a tad more tactical weight- make flanking matter, make facing matter. 

Otherwise, great game. I recommend, especially for the price. I'll buy a 3 game for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032729422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1845, 'last_played': 1577737242}
review:
Not a massive game but worth picking up and playing as a “filler” although it may be best to wait for a sale to pick it up but it's pretty cheap anyway.

This is much improved over Dark Quest 1.  The character roster has been increased from the 3 in the original game to 6 and the range of monsters has likewise seen an increase.  The graphics have also been markedly improved and now work on an isometric system rather than the plain “top down” view of the original.

There are also a few Steam Achievements and Virtual Trading Cards / Badge for those interested.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030605800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1577427412}
review: I didn't really like it at first, as it's basically just a VERY stripped-down RPG.  However, I found it's perfect to play when I'm at work, as it doesn't overheat my laptop while it's running, and its 100% turn-based nature means I don't have to pause or anything in order to take care of work stuff, so I can just return to it at my leisure.  Also, the lack of any real plot or questing, just simple dungeon-crawling levels, and it's simplicity, means if I don't play for a while, when I come back, I don't have to refamiliarize myself with what's going on in the game and its mechanics.  I can just drop back in as if I'd just played yesterday.  Basically, this game has its place, and it suits it well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962207750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1578763677}
review:
- Yes it's simple

- Yes there is a version for phones

But that doesn't mean it's not fun. On the phone version there is no online co-op, so that's a major difference.

And the simplicity was a huge part of the appeal of the original Dark Quest. It's just here it's gone isometric and has character models, where before it was top down tiles.

It's more elaborate, but it's still inspired by a tabletop for ages 9 to adult. So that means it's not like these huge RPG's with endless stuff to learn.

If you're young, you can just get on and enjoy. And if not, this is something for when you're not wanting to go to the effort of quick real-time reactions, or anything too stressful. This is one that can just be played for a quick quest or two at a time, not endless massive sessions to take over your whole life.

It's a little resource management, finding then remembering where the exit was, grabbing loot, managing combat, levelling up... rinse and repeat.

One can tut at spelling errors or the occasional clunk like needing to move a character out of the way to do something with another, or reveal the tile you want to action. But none of that is really that important in a casual experience like this, where the emphasis is on simple enjoyment;

Bottom line: Unpretentious fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163243247', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1690029976}

author: {'steamid': '76561198971471182', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1615563954}
review:
***This review was updated on Sept 14th 2020***
I have more than 15 hours of gameplay at this moment.

This is a nice strategic RPG game. Very faithful to the original HeroQuest boardgame from Milton Bradley in 1991. Perfect for anybody who is feeling nostalic and is wishing for a great old school RPG experience. Fans of Final Fantasy Tactics, Arc The Lad, Dragon Quest, Fire Emblem might enjoy !! Anyone who is craving for a boardgame RPG experience should try this game.

However, I would like to point out that when you want to play multiplayer mode, you will actually succeed with 3 players co-op, but 2 players co-op is insufficient to have the upper hand on the monsters in the dungeon - - you will be defeated in no time. The developers should pay attention to this.

I want to add that with their beautiful effort, I am actually very excited about their upcoming DarkQuest Boardgame on Steam. I'll get my hands on it as soon as it comes out - I promise.

In the meantime, you may want to take a look at the mobile games ''Arcane Quest 1 / 2 / 3''.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155450601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1602383408}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044653396', 'num_games_owned': 714, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1575526118}
review:
I beat the game in normal mode.
7/10

It's a dungeon crawler kind of game with simple rooms to navigate until you reach the end or complete a simple objective.

The game is a bit basic and there isn't much depth to the skills, items, or story.
It feels like it could have been developed for mobile phones.
However, I did enjoy the time I spent beating the game (over 13 hours), and that alone is worth the sale price.

The graphics are pretty good but not 'amazing'.
The sound effects are basic but efficient.
The music is actually quite good.

I would recommend this game on sale but not full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041070499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1689124348}
review:
Molto simile a un GdR Tabletop ovvero ad un gioco da tavolo con un sapore vintage piuttosto spiccato. Tutto è come dovrebbe essere nella migliore tradizione Fantasy. La presenza del workshop permette di condividere mappe create da altri utenti per una rigiocabilità pressochè infinita. L'unica pecca in multiplayer si potrà utilizzare solo un personaggio anche dove vi sono mappe progettate per 3 o piu personaggi,nulla di impossibile da superare ma sarebbe stato carino poter utilizzare più personaggi per ogni giocatore.
Consiglio l acquisto a chi ama i giochi da tavolo fantasy stile Hero quest e chi ama i vecchi GdR nel quale si esplora un dungeon alla ricerca di richezze e fama!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035182410', 'num_games_owned': 1144, 'num_reviews': 372, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1574769974}
review:
It's ok. 

It has some issues though. It's almost impossible to move on the tile behind an allied character as that will always result in you selecting them instead. 

There is a lot of backtracking through empty rooms in the game, yet you always have to order all 3 heroes to the room exit each time. There needed to be a "move all units" button. Because it gets tedious after a while.

Also I found a bug that if you leave a room with a possessed enemy then you are permanently stuck as the rest of your team can't actually leave the room afterwards. 

Lastly the game relies to much on chances for my liking. Each character has an attack chance and defense chance (mostly 60%) so fights often devolve into miss - miss - block - block - miss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117379251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1639857748}
review: Bought the game and was having fun for a time. After the 2/11/2019 update my save games disappeared and could not start the game anymore. Contacted Brain Seal Support, which was a little rude and told me that the problem was that “I was trying to run the game without steam” (whatever that means). Considering that are hundreds of other games available on steam, save yourself some headache and go spend your money somewhere else, unless you are 100% sure that you can solve game running problems by yourself.
developer_response: Not sure what your problem is, you posted on the forums and send email at the same time multiple times. We replied and solved your problem in the end and even gave you some free codes for the trouble it and now you leave a negative review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077370295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1573891768}
review:
Simplified turn based RPG with 2 to 4 characters (depending on quest) that you can replay.

Very enjoyable on normal difficulty, good graphics, reasonable sounds, skill tree is easily filled up so bit short overall but you can play eventually any quest with any combination of characters and thats fun.

The town looks bit complex at the beginning - but it is actually very simplified and easy to understand too.

Recommended :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198116376659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1572756189}
review:
Purchased the game for around $2 during a sale. This is a reasonable purchasing price for a game that has potential, but lacks in any noticeable department.

*Interface/Controls
The game lacks a surprising amount of explanation for what its UI elements are, and how to use them. The options menu is adequate but you will not find any help. Learning how to equip items, how to upgrade, and more importantly, the movement of characters in the game is very difficult. You will spend much time pixel hunting, trying to move characters to specific parts of the map, simply because another characters model obscures it. There are no hotkeys to cycle through your heroes, levels end without prompting once objectives are met (despite rewarding exploration). You cannot change the camera  angle, as the games camera is fixed and the map is isometric, compounding the pixel hunting issue. 

*Gameplay loop
The primary objective of the game is to loot as much gold as possible while finishing the quest objectives with at least one hero alive. Unless you actively choose the hardest difficulty, death is only a temporary set back. There is no positive reward for killing an entire room of enemies unless it holds an objective. The rare moments enemies actually drop gold are a pitiful 10-20, while healing is the true precious commodity, the cheapest potion costing 120, and generic rests between quests costing 50 gold per hero, regardless of how much health is needed. Though exploration is pivotal to game progress, your tools are aggravating. Each individual hero (regardless of room clear) must traverse the length of the room to the exit.

In dungeons of 10-15 plus rooms, each encompassing roughly 5-10 squares of mandatory walking animation (even on fast setting) is a great bulk of game time. It boggles the mind that in general exploring heroes cannot be condensed into one square (one model representing the party). Exploring the dungeons does not become an engaging risk vs reward asset, but a tedious slog where players who've already played the game will know the optimal route. Of course, even completing a quest does not allow you to keep said map, forcing those who value their time to write it down or else wonder lost in the dungeons. As the core aspect of a dungeon-crawling adventure, the crawl is too literal.

On to more positive aspects, the combat is at least serviceable, though leaves many questions. Each hero holds unique playstyles and abilities, with minor overlap.  During your quests however, again killing enemies are generally useless. Avoiding combat for new players is my recommendation, as well as learning when it is better to take the loss and retreat or allow a party wipe (reviving dead heroes can be cheaper than individual heals). To progress in actual power, acquiring blue potions (I don't recall the true name) will allow your characters to improve their abilities, as well as gold being needed to buy equipment, all of which must be searched out in the dungeon. Both gold and blue potions are "farmable" if you find the correct map. (In the late game I prefer "Executioner" personally) Out of the 6 total heroes only 3 are allowed per quest, which is questionable, leaving the rest of the heroes useless once you enter mid game (unless you wish to farm). 

The enemies are varied enough themselves to not feel too samey, though you will recognize a pattern.  Goblins  have traps. arrows, and deadly spells, Orcs have support magic, high stats, and more bosses. Chaos, as the name implies, takes a bit of both. Beefier units, deadly unblockable spells, and magic that both supports their units and causes chaos for you the player. The game is mercifully short enough that by the time you get tired of a certain enemy type, you should be eased into the next. 

*Other features
The game boasts a dungeon editor, as well as multiplayer support. These features I have not used, thus cannot comment. 

*Story
The story is absent. While true you will have an opening cinematic, and a few in-game cutscenes the story is simple. Fight your way to the evil wizard and slay him. Avoiding spoilers, I will state that the boss fight and ending cinematic is just criminal. 10 hours of on an off gameplay to fight a boss with a few gimmicks and a story that gips you of any sense of accomplishment. Do you accomplish the primary goal? Technically yes, and it could've been a hell of a lot better.

*Final issues.
There are bugs in the game, and some abilities that you may rely heavily on for victory may just end up useless late-game. The trouble is, was it an intentional design decision by the developer or a lack of oversight during testing? The game as it stands has been out for a year, so I allow you to form that opinion. In short, I find many design decisions questionable of the developer, which hopefully by the time of Dark Quest 3 they will perfect their formula.

Is this game worth it? If you enjoy average dungeon-crawling in the style of hero-quest, for the price of a McChicken you'll technically get more value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122389049', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1572766396}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983740996', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1569270054}
review:
What was supposed to be a night of celebration in the kings castle turned into a night of horror. The sorcerer and his minions had returned and attacked when nobody expected. Within a few hours every man, woman and child was butchered, including the king. 

It is up to you to enter the castle to face madness and death on your ultimate quest to defeat evil.

Dark Quest 2 is a role-playing, turn-based dungeon crawler. The game starts as a very simple, primitive brawler, but gains tactical depth, the longer you play. That's because your characters change strongly throughout the course of the game and every new dungeon you enter is more demanding.

Dark Quest 2 lets you play with six different heroes. The barbarian, the dwarf, the dark monk, the wizard, the paladin and the archer. Each of these characters comes with very different characteristics, resulting in a very different game play experience, depending on the heroes you pick for your party.

While you start the game with a single hero, the barbarian, you can later play dungeons with up to four party members. During the game you can collect gold and potions. Gold can be used to craft better weapons, armor and magic items. Potions can be used to improve your heroes abilities. Additionally you can find special items in the dungeons that give you further advantages.

Each of the heroes comes with a very different set of abilities. The paladin has great healing and protection powers, while the barbarian shows advantages due to his physical strength. The wizard and the monk are physically weak but offer powerful magic. As expected the archer can carry out great long range attacks and the dwarf is a strong melee fighter and displays craftsmanship with traps.

Depending on the heroes you choose for your party and the talents you upgrade, you can influence the way you play. Defensive, aggressive or even stealthy.

In the late game you will counter an overwhelming number of enemies that you can only defeat with the right use of your abilities and tactics.

The game is very well balanced on normal difficulty and also very enjoyable. You will die a couple of times but you can re-play already finished dungeons to collect more gold and potions to upgrade your abilities and craft better equipment. That's the way it's meant to be played.

However, since the game comes with Steam workshop support there are ways to cheat. Some workshop maps allow you to easily collect gold and potions on specially designed maps. I do not recommend using these before finishing the game at least once. But of course this kind of help is helpful in hardcore difficulty mode.

Dark Quest 2 is a rather simple but very enjoyable old school game. If you have a nag for these kind of games I can strongly recommend Dark Quest 2.

Pros:
- it's fun
- simple but nice comic graphics
- very diversified heroes with very different abilities
- equip your heroes with special potions
- allows different tactics
- multiplayer mode
- Steam workshop support
- option to move very fast (helpful after first play-through)
- possibility to revive dead heroes in normal and easy difficulty (not in hardcore mode)
- you can visit a brothel before heading to the next dungeon to gain additional strength

Cons:
- I died a lot at the beginning
- after a while I found the music a little annoying  and turned it off

author: {'steamid': '76561198022121357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 891, 'last_played': 1640874649}
review: Se come me, dopo Heroquest, non avevate più trovato un gioco che gli somigliasse, a parte le sue trasposizioni su amiga e pc di tanti anni fa, adesso non dovete attendere più, ecco, lo avete trovato. Dark Quest 2 riprende in mano delle meccaniche molto simili ai dadi, dandoti l'impressione di lanciarli come in un gioco da tavolo, ma in realtà autocalcola tutti i risultati, senza mostrarteli: il risultato è un gioco fluido, che scorre molto bene, e che vi catapulterà negli anni '90 con tante aggiunte molto carine e soddisfacenti. Anche se è chiaramente ispirato ad Heroquest, Dark Quest 2 migliora tanti aspetti, una grafica disegnata in modo artistico, ambienti immersivi, musiche molto d'atmosfera epica, molte abilità da sbloccare e (Cosa che apprezzo molto) particolarmente coerenti con i personaggi stessi. E' un gioco che finalmente ha messo fine alla mia ricerca di epicità e sensazioni dei vecchi giochi da tavolo di una volta.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980138550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1569022383}
review:
Macht auf jeden Fall Spaß, war am anfange etwas frustrierend weil die Gruppe sehr schwach ist und man schon ein paar mal stirbt^^. Nach 2, 3 quests läuft es dann auch schnell besser und zum Glück kann man verstorbene Helden wiederbeleben. Ein schönes Designe gibt es außerdem. Wer auf TableTop games steht, dem kann ich es nur empfehlen! 

Ein Kontra hab ich allerdings, aber ist nicht die Welt.
Nach Ende eines Kampfes gibt es keine Funktion um zb. die ganze Gruppe zum nächsten Raum zu bewegen oder eine group selection oder so. Jeder Held muß dann einzeln zum Durchgang geschickt werden. 

Also 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198035847317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1547909387}
review:
Дуже достойна гра. Як любителю настольних ігор, мені дуже сподобалася. Покроковість, можливість все обдумати, ще й непогана графіка для такого роду ігор. Да і ще музика приємна.
З мінусів – малий час для проходження. У мене на все пішло близько 10 години, при тому що не всі місії проходили з першого разу. Було б краще, якби зробили ще якесь доповнення, щоб збільшити час, що витрачається на гру.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082875938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1566720649}
review:
Un gradevole gioco fantasy con combattimenti a turni, la trama non è il massimo dell' originalità, in pratica si deve sconfiggere il cattivo mago di turno, ma il suo sviluppo, attraverso le varie missioni è gradevolmente vario.
Le fasi di combattimento sono interessanti e le ho apprezzate, mentre certi meccanismi di gestione delle risorse dei personaggi nel villaggio mi sono parse un poco macchinose, pur senza essere frustranti. 
Nel complesso un bel gioco, che ho completato in modalità normale in 12 ore.
Da valutare la componente "collaborativa" (?!) con amici di Steam, inoltre data la mia scarsa abilità, non mi sono cimentato con la modalità Hardcore.
Non male.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156152765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1648114892}
review:
Начнем с минусов о них уже сказали, слишком просто, слишком казуально, слишком примитивно....
А теперь вопрос: "А стоило ли делать по другому??"
Да эта игра немного однообразна, привыкнув к механикам пройти ее не составит труда, да сюжет прост и примитивен, злой колдун захватил замок и так далее, да боевка проста и механики примитивны (хотя там есть много интересных нюансов).... 
А теперь к плюсам... Простые и понятные механики, простой незатейливый сюжет, музыка весьма не плохая (хоть местами и монотонная)... И все это при наличии такого количества недостатков, все равно создает полную картину... игра полноценная в отличии от популярных Игор - сервисов... и создает удивительную атмосферу старых и (сейчас скажу фразу от которой все поморщатся) "ламповых" игр, но чтобы полноценно насладиться атмосферой и вспомнить старое (почему то после запуска игры сразу вспомнился Голден акс) не нужно ее штурмовать часами... Играя по часику - два в день можно неторопливо наслаждаться атмосферой и музыкой... хочется гриндить - можно погриндить (хотя там это не обязательно) хочется идти по сюжетке можно идти прямой дорожкой...  в общем не 10 из 10, но твердая 7ка и еще + пол балла за пару хороших треков мой вердикт 7.5 из 10. Любители старых игр и казуалок могут вполне ознакомиться.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020346708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1566244235}
review:
Um jogo a la Tablet, movendo um herói de cada vez, combate resolvido aleatoriamente, bem como as poções. Não se sabe quanto causará efetivamente de dano, nem quanto curará a poção. A música torna-se monótona rapidamente.

Jogo simples, apenas para passar o tempo...

author: {'steamid': '76561198094933427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1565995489}
review: I really enjoyed this game. It was short and sweet.  Maybe bigger maps would add to the experience.  There was only one challenge that used 4 characters but it was exactly what I was looking for.   Dark Quest 2 goes on a fairly exclusive list of games where if Dark Quest 3 were to ever creep out of the shadows... it would be mine. A little tweek and....... awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074167152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1564965812}
review:
Could be a decent mobile game, completely fails as a PC game. It is like bare bones version of Hero's of Might & Magic meets Darkest Dungeon for 7-10 year olds. 

Cons:
1) Low content and none of the mechanics are fleshed out. (About 20 Items, 5 Traps, 20-30 Spells, 8-12 Enemy Types, etc...)
2) Most of the mechanics are heavy on RNG. 
3) Don't know why there are secret doors, its so obvious to find them. 
4) Moving characters around the room after fighting is a chore. 
5) Literally the only treasure you find in most maps is gold (20-30 gold that to). 
6) Blacksmith can craft 20 items most of which class specific - so 3 items per hero the entire game (2 Equip Slots Joke). 
7) Random quests, repetitive levels, no sense of progression. After 3 levels (1 hr) you have seen everything the game has to offer.
8) Hero resurrection is joke. You entire party can be revived with items for a pittance.
9) Useless NPCs, Merchant - sell some random things for gold (That is it, he does nothing else), Brothel - get a random bonus for 150 gold...
10) No town upgrades - No boss fights except the final boss...

Pros:
1) Music is decent but only 3-4 tracks on repeat.
2) Passable graphics and controls.
3) Tutorials were to the point and clear

Don't but this game as it is, it needs tons of content and updates.

Verdict: 3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198273375169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1562654852}
review:
I know I didn't play enough of the game for most of you to count it, but I enjoyed the short time I got to spend with it.

The combat is really simplified, down to single digits, and they expand upon the gameplay by allowing you to improve your characters. Personally the draw for me is the charm, it has these little animations for all sorts of things that make the game more enjoyable and shows the love the creators poured into making it.

One complaint I saw is that the game is apparantely too difficult, as repeating the same quest multiple times makes it gradually get more difficult. This to me seems like a silly problem, as I played this on hardest difficulty and have yet to lose a single troop, but maybe I'm just a super genius. I am willing to concede that.

Thats really all there is to it without spoiling every game mechanic for you to explore, its fun, its flashy, I like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282341624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1563131843}
review:
Nettes Game für zwischendurch. Da es nicht besonders teuer ist, will ich meine Kritikpunkte als Verbesserungsvorschläge verstanden wissen:

- eine minimale Sprachausgabe für die Helden wäre schön. Es fehlt ihnen an Persönlichkeit
- Im Kampf sind die Figuren nicht "transparent", d. h. dass sie einzelne Quadrate so blockieren, dass sie mit der Maus nicht angeklickt werden können. Somit können die Helden nicht immer so bewegt werden, wie man möchte und Fallen können nicht da platziert werden, wo man sie haben will.
- Es wäre schön, wenn im Kampf die Wegpunkte für den letzten Schritt des Helden (nachdem dann eine Aktion nicht mehr möglich ist) farblich in rot gekennzeichnet wäre, damit man weiss "Alles klar, wenn ich dahin gehe, kann ich in diesem Zug nicht mehr kämpfen"
- Ich habe es im ersten Versuch auf "Normal" durchgespielt. Der Wiederholungswert ist eher gering, da keinerlei Erfolge o. ä. implementiert sind
- Es gibt nur eine einzige Quest für vier Helden, ansonsten sind es immer höchstens drei. Da die Helden eher unausgewogen sind, bedeutet das, dass man immer mit denselben spielt. Der Zwerg ist besser als der Barbar, aber wenn ich den Zwerg habe, dann doppeln sich die Fähigkeiten teilweise mit dem Bogenschützen; der Mönch ist so stark, dass er unverzichtbar ist und der Magier ist besser als der Ritter. Also bestand meine Party immer aus: Zwerg, Mönch, Magier. Das ist einfach schade. Gut wäre, wenn es etwas mehr Infos über die jeweilige Quest gäbe. Mehr Fallen, mehr Monster, mehr Magie o. ä. Dann würde man mehr variieren, glaube ich.
- die Musik taugt nicht viel, ich habe sie im Spiel aufs Minimum runtergezogen
- es gibt nur wenig Gegenstände beim Schmied, die Wahl für den jeweils besten Gegenstand für den einzelnen Helden fällt sehr leicht und schon nach zwei Dritteln des Spiels hatte ich alles, was ich wollte
- Die "Wahnsinns-Fallen" sind eine nette Idee. Das Problem: Lasse ich nur einen Charakter im Raum und löse mit ihm die Falle aus, dann passiert mir gar nichts.
- Es wäre gut, wenn es einen "Quest beenden"-Button gäbe. Ich musste 2-3 Mal Schätze liegen lassen, weil die Quest automatisch beendet wurde bzw. weil eine "Secret-Passage" nicht als "Exit Dungeon" gekennzeichnet war
- Es gibt zwar 6-7 verschiedene Tränke, aber ich habe nur 3 davon benutzt. Auch hier sind die Unterschiede zu groß und es ist relativ früh klar, was man unbedingt braucht und worauf man verzichten kann

Also, wie gesagt, ein nettes Game und teilweise durchaus herausfordernd, aber auf jeden Fall verbesserungsfähig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068116100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2599, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1562945931}
review: [b]Sıra tabanlı bir oynanışa sahip olan bu oyunda; bir grup kahramanın kontrolünü sağlayıp, çeşitli maceralara adım atın. Oynanışın sıra tabanlı olmasından kaynaklı kararlarınızı alırken daha da dikkat edip, en iyi stratejiyi ortaya koymaya çalışabilirsiniz. Oyunun çok oyunculu seçenekleri sayesinde de, bu deneyimleri arkadaşlarınızla birlikte yaşayabilirsiniz.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970545932', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1562846750}
review:
Great little game, as an old fart who bought hero quest as a boardgame and then the original computer game, this has some strong influences. I enjoyed playing and would love to see the developer do another sequel or even attempt Space Crusade, an old 40k version of a similar boardgame.

Little annoyances : Clicking behind characters to move or loot can be troublesome in isometric.

In the village if you scroll left, there is a vendor to sell stuff and a brothel for buffs. Really should know that visually on the screen.

When moving across a room with no enemies, some kind of party follow mechanic would speed it up. Instead of manually moving each character.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019816374', 'num_games_owned': 1357, 'num_reviews': 1685, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1561030378}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058178955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1562705856}
review: Gierka prosta ale bardzo  przyjemna. Limit użycia zdolności bohaterów na całej mapie lochów sprawia,że trzeba trochę pogłówkować. W trudniejszych misjach nie  powinno się już na początku odpalać swoich najlepszych umiejętności a zostawić je na finałowe starcia. Sześciu bohaterów do wyboru to trochę  mało ale  kombinację naszych herosów są ciekawe ( głównie gramy 3- osobowym zespołem) i można stworzyć zupełnie inne drużyny. Na początku nie mogłem za bardzo połapać się o co chodzi z przedmiotami u kowala i jak je zmieniać ale szybko dało się w tym odnaleźć. Można w nią zagrać ze znajomymi jeśli posiadają  tą grę w swojej bibliotece co jeszcze nie testowałem ale zapowiada się na ciekawą opcję. Nie jest to gra bardzo skomplikowana w której musimy wytężać nasze umysły ale spokojna strategia turowa w którą jak poznamy jej zasady gra się płynnie i miło.  Polecam ją ze względu na niską cenę i taki klimacik starej dobrej strategi fantasy. Spędzone 10+ godzin na granie w Dark Quest 2 nie było straconym czasem a został jeszcze najtrudniejszy poziom trudności.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081899465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1581660081}
review: nice

author: {'steamid': '76561198073435460', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1414, 'last_played': 1562181329}
review:
Mouais... Allez, ça passe... 14/20, disons.

Si vous adorez le jeu de plateau hero quest alors on peut dire que ce jeu vous plaira bien. Tactiquement, c'est plutôt pas mal mais dès qu'on a compris comment fonctionne l'IA, on a quand même pris un gros avantage. Sauf pour tuer le sorcier final qui est quasi intuable et contre lequel il est impossible de plannifier une quelconque stratégie... Du coup la fin est ratée à mon avis.

Sinon, pour l'histoire, c'est ultra banal, complètement stéréotypé.

Pour le reste, c'est correct et même pour quelqu'un qui ne connait pas Hero Quest, il devrait pouvoir s'amuser quand même. 

Mention spéciale aux musiques qui sont... bizarres... Ou disons plutôt décalées : la guitare électrique dans un jeu d'héroïc fantasy old school, ça m'a fait une drôle d'impression. Remarquez ils auraient pu pousser le vice et coller de la variété française des années 80...

author: {'steamid': '76561197972646496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1652012219}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033355403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1562000960}
review: Très bon jeu, beau graphisme et à la difficulté bien dosée. Un minimum de tactique est nécessaire, il faut bien réfléchir avant de se lancer dans un combat sinon ça ne pardonne pas. Seul bémol la durée de vie extra courte, 4 h de jeu mais que du plaisir. Retour nostalgique à Héro Quest sur Amiga, il y a fort fort longtemps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027943933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1561210222}

author: {'steamid': '76561198329423562', 'num_games_owned': 4889, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1272, 'last_played': 1592924906}
review: I really enjoy this game. The graphics are hand drawn still. The game offers quests, different characters to recruit , and a clear path to game completion. I am now working on hard mode to complete the achievements. I would greatly recommend this to anyone that like turn based rrpgs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056587348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1568751995}
review: Wer das Brettspiel Heroquest kennt wird hier seine Freude haben. Es gibt zwar einige kleinere Unterschiede, aber es hat definitiv einen guten "immer wieder" Spielwert. Und im Sale für 4 Euro sowieso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036380683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1559503835}
review:
Man beginnt mit einem Helden und ist am Ende mit bis zu 5 Helden unterwegs, von denen man aber meist nicht mehr als 3 mitnehmen kann. Jeder Held hat eine andere Klasse. Man kämpft abwechselnd im Schloss und rüstet sich dann im Dorf aus. Im Schloss findet man Tränke mit denen man Fähigkeiten bei den einzelnen Helden freischalten kann. Für das gefundene Gold kann man ein paar Ausrüstungsgegenstände oder konsumierbare Flaschen kaufen.

So in etwa 10 Stunden ist man mit dem Spiel durch und hat den bösen Zauberer hoffentlich besiegt. Ich habe dann den Schwierigkeitsgrad erhöht und noch einmal angefangen. Irgendwie kam es mir dann nicht wirklich schwieriger vor. Als mir dann ein Held gestorben ist wollte ich ihn im Dorf wiedererwecken und siehe da das ging bei dem Schwierigkeitsgrad nicht. Na ja vorher lesen hätte nicht geschadet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003780341', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 868, 'last_played': 1636742853}
review:
Disclaimer: This review is from a co-op perspective only.

Dark Quest 2 is turn based game and actually a tribute to the 1989 Games Workshop boardgame title Hero's Quest, and does a great job with beutiful, quirky hand drawn graphics echoing of the 80's pen & paper rpg's. The lack of more generic 3d content is refreshing in the way it is made, and even though the animation might look a bit stiff remembering it's miniature game forefather might help. Another con due to the artstyle is the lack of customization, but honestly is out of the scope of the game and would feel wrong.

Beneath this rather simplistic looking surface the gameplay is surprisingly tactical in a way that encourages planning who will go first and doing what each turn.

The game is bascially a 'world' map where every mission marked on it is a dungeon of some kind. This is turn consists of a number of rooms and corridors filled with enemies and loot. Apart from money your most sought after bounty will be blue flasks of experience, which will let you upgrade your characters between missions.

Between dungeons you end up in the Village where you can rest, learn skills, buy potions, craft items etc.

Since each player can only control one character, a smaller party might have to decide on which one they will play depending on the type of challenge ahead. Luckily each player can keep a full roster of characters to play with and upgrades is not restricted to the character that collected the experience.

There are six different classes once fully unlocked and each one got seven or eight special abilities or skills:
* Barbarian - Think Conan with a big ass sword, a bunch of offensive mechanics and decent hp.
* Dwarf - Once fleshed out a decent tank, capable of digging in and holding the front. Also capable of some crowd control.
* Archer - A ranger type character with access to special arrow attacks and useful stuff like a heal, setting and detecting traps etc.
* Wizard - Can cast illusions, firewalls, lightning and wizardy stuff like that and is capable of dealing a decent amount of damage.
* Knight - A must have for a bigger group and can hold on pretty well tanking.
* Dark Monk - A strange bird this one, with situational abilities that sometimes are incredibly powerful. Can swap places with enemies and friends, make enemies attack eachother, kill any enemy and leach its hp, massdamage everyone in a room etc. 

The abilities/skills mechanics takes a while to figure out but in a nutshell:
* Abilites can normally be used once per mission. Upgrades, charges and potions can increase this number.
* Skills are either passive or active but can be used every turn.

Over this layer you also have a system of hit points, magic shielding and 'Fate' that you also have to take in consideration.

This means that the meta game consists of trying to figure out how you can combine different skillsets with your team mates.
The way you approach a dungeon with a Barbarian - Ranger duo is different from the solution you find with a Dark Monk - Dwarf one etc.
And that is the best part of the game in my opinion. Every character got a different playing style. If the Dwarf controls the horde of regular orcs, the Monk will pinpoint and take out ranged threats, like pesky witches that slowly sting you hp using needles and a voodoo doll.
Testing out your theories and watching this play out is a satisfying feeling.

The game also includes a Editor making it possible to craft levels for the Workshop, and even though it is a bit clunky and undocumented adds extra value and longevity to the game.

For gamers that enjoy co-op games like Divinity or Card Hunter this is a no brainer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030644336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1564843246}
review:
This game does an awesome job scratching that old HeroQuest itch. Yes, it's kind of luck-based. Yes, the combat is simple. Yes, the art, writing, and interface are all kind of hokey. Doesn't matter. I love this game. And there are enough choices in the party creation and character development systems between missions that you feel like your decisions have an impact on the way each dungeon plays out, which is important. Most significantly, there are a lot of items and skills for each hero, so UNLIKE in HeroQuest, the number of things your characters can do in combat ratchets up pretty quickly from the first dungeon.

Finally, a bit of open disclosure: I did get this game for free. I have a small YouTube channel, so small developers occasionally offer me free games to try. I just want to note, though, that as the owner of a 0-year-old baby, the limiting reagent in my gaming life is time, not money, so I ignore the vast majority of the games that I'm offered. I jumped at this one and fell in love with it immediately; my whole-hearted recommendation of this game is based on that fact, not on the fact I got it for free. I really hope this developer does well and makes many more games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040421250', 'num_games_owned': 19550, 'num_reviews': 743, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1560172965}
review:
In this video I take a look at Dark Quest 2 a dungeon crawling RPG game.
This is a simple title but fun and addictive. It has a simple graphical interface and gameplay mechanics but still offers very good strategic game play with it's turn based combat system. Once each mission is over you regroup at the town where you can buy, upgrade, rest, or improve. It also offers multi player if desired. It has a really cheap price and is well worth taking a look at.

Watch the video to see what the game is like.....
https://youtu.be/ltwngv9hKGc
Check'n Games, providing you with as many Let's Play's as we can.
Thanks for watching. Please like comment and subscribe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018878631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1563393966}
review:
Moin Leute, 

Dark Quest 2 ist ideal für Leute, die zu zweit Coop spielen wollen. Alleine kann man die Kampagne oder selbst erstellte Workshop Karten auch spielen, dann wählt man einfach mehrere Helden, die man nach und nach bekommt. Die Story ist simple. Tötet den Zauberer. Die Kamapgne spielt sich recht flüssig, manche späteren Karten können kniffelig sein, da muss man dann doch mal nachdenken wie man seine Lebenspunkte schont. Auf "Einfach" spielt es sich sehr angenehm, da wirds erst am Ende schwerer. Auf Normal sieht es schon anders aus. Da sollte man seinen Charakter schon beherrschen. Sonst gibts auf die Mütze und alles wird mühselig. 

Pro:
1. Grafik - Sehr hübscher Comicstyle
2. Sound - Musik, Kampfgeräusche, Todesanimationen; alles sehr passend
3. Skills - Die nach und nach freischaltbaren Skills machen Spaß und erlauben im Zusammenspiel mit anderen Charakteren tolle Kombis. 
4. Crafting - Simpel gemacht (Gold als einzige Ressource), aber nette Items, die spürbar wirken
5. Ansicht des Dorfes - Liebevolle Details vom Bordell bis zur Schmied(in). 
6. Levelgestaltung - Unterschiedliche Mobs - Von Einfach bis Knackig, von Haudrauf bis Zauberer
7. Es gibt Fallen :-) Je nach Charakter vermeidbar oder einfach übel
8. Tolle Karte mit Wegweiser (mehr oder weniger ;-))
9. Coop ! Macht zu zweit noch mehr Spaß
10. Gutes Spiel für wenig Geld 

Contra:
1. Umständliches Coop Menü (Ready oder nicht Ready ist blöd gemacht, Quest kann nur der Host starten, Manchmal sind Karten verbuggt, wenn einer einen Raum verlässt und der andere nicht mitgehen kann. Grade, wenn man zurückläuft passiert sowas manchmal. 
2. Kein Autoloot nach Kampf ( Wenigstens vom Gold was offen rumliegt wäre das eine schöne Option, wenn man das im Optionsmenü auswählen könnte)
3. Aktiver Spieler ist nicht deutlich genug sichtbar. (Grüne Umrandung schwer zu sehen)
4. Friedhof 20 %! des aktuellen Goldes ist zuviel! Meist muss man irgendwelche Tränke kaufen, um sich wiederzubeleben und dann wieder verkaufen, um für was anderes Gold auszugeben, wie das Bordell, Taverne oder Drinks für den wiederbelebten Charakter zu kaufen. Blöd gemacht!
5. Wegfindung manchmal doof! Wenn ein Charakter eine Falle ausgemacht hat umgeht der Charakter die nicht, sondern latscht gerne auch mal rein. (Kann natürlich auch vom Entwickler auf Old School gemacht sein)
6. Goldmenge erhöht sich kaum bei steigendem Schwierigkeitsgrad oder im Verlauf der Kampagne. So muss man meist einfache Karten nochmal spielen, um sich wieder was kaufen zu können. Bissle unbalanced. Grade für Neulinge doof. 
7. Es könnten noch mehr Items sein und es wäre schön, wenn das Itemmenü pro Charakter sichtbar wäre und nicht im Hintergrund noch die Symbole der anderen Items angegraut sind. Ist nicht so schick. 
8. Items manchmal buggy. Schwert +1 und dann trotzdem nur 1 Schaden, obwohl Normalangriff schon 1 Schaden macht. 
9. Kein Deutsch! Braucht man nicht unbedingt, aber wäre trotzdem schön. 
10. Fehlender dritter Teil !!! Ich brauch neues Futter!!! 

Alles in allem macht das Spiel (grade im Coop) viel Spaß, ist günstig, schöne Grafik, einfache Steuerung, tolle Skills, nette und teilweise doofe Gegner, lustige Geräusche und es spielt sich sehr kurzweilig. Und läuft auf alten Rechnern und Laptops. Mehr davon und weiter so, liebe Entwickler !

author: {'steamid': '76561198062772350', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1558973091}

author: {'steamid': '76561197974088172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1558438811}
review:
Overall: fairly simple, plenty of fun choices and cool moments when your tactical use of skills pays off.

In Dark Quest 2 you take a party of heroes through a series of dungeons, each made up of a series of rooms, and slaughter lots of nasty monsters in turn-based combat.  There are a nice variety of encounters, twice as many heroes available as you can generally take into a dungeon so you can choose your party composition, and a bunch of items and potions to customise your heroes for different strategies.  Each hero also has a selection of useful skills learned using a shared resource for additional choice.  Shoutout to my Barbarian who failed his 80% courage test every single time.  There were a few minor annoyances/bugs, but nothing serious enough (on Normal difficulty anyway) to stop me recommending the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134086602', 'num_games_owned': 995, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1623368512}
review:
Primer Vistazo de Dark Quest 2: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zhX7WUZe-PQ

Mi primer juego de miniaturas fue el glorioso Warhammer Quest de la empresa Games Workshop. Todavía lo tengo y cada tanto me hago una partidita, porque sigue siendo a mi gusto uno de los mejores boardgames del tipo dungeoncrawler que existen (si, a pesar de estar por momentos super desbalanceado y azaroso, eso no significa que no sea divertido)
Cuando me enteré de la existencia del Dark Quest 2 automáticamente pude ver las similitudes entre los juegos, y al probarlo me dejó un buen sabor de boca, ya que si bien no puedo decir que sea lo mismo, me hizo acordar a aquellas partidas, con el viaje a la ciudad incluído. 
A mi gusto, muy recomendable si te gustan los rpgs con batallas tácticas por turno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028612224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1537, 'last_played': 1555300793}
review:
Fun, light, casual game.

Leveling up without xp is very weird, specially cause you can explore the mechanics and level up all your heros to the max if you have enough patient to grab a flask and go back to town (repeat 200x).

Dungeons also can bug A LOT and leave your heroes stuck, making you lose your progress, frustrating.

Despite these two flaws, it's a really fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050016554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1555168594}
review:
Bof, je vais mettre un avis positif par défaut parce que je ne vois pas de gros défaut à ce jeu mais je crois que je vais le laisser de côté. Je ne sais pas trop pourquoi, je n'ai pas vraiment envie d'y jouer. 

Il n'y a pas la touche graphique et le ruissellement de stress d'un Darkest Dungeon, il n'y a pas la foultitude d'équipement et de butin d'un Monster Den, il n'y a pas l'atmosphère de mystère qui pousse en avant d'un Tower of Time. Peut-être que simplement j'ai trop de jeux du même style pour rendre justice à celui-ci, il me parait en quelque sorte banal.

Je joue solo, c'est peut-être plus sympa avec des potes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110569056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1553963089}
review:
I wanted to love this game. Huge fan of Hero Quest, still own the board game =D

For me the game breaker is the fact that when replaying a mission, the mission gets harder. More monsters/traps/ect.

How do you farm a previous mission to get stronger for the next, when the previous mission itself is vamped up so heavy?

Example, mission #3, first room, one bad encounter with 3 mage, 2 warriors, and an assassin mostly wiped the party outright, barbarian is left with 2 hp, so party throws up the white flag and hoofs it back to town. Not enough gold to revive and heal everyone. So we try and take the revived archer and the wounded barb on mission #2, That way we can earn some gold and revive the dwarf. And actually afford to sleep at the inn.

Mission #2 is now harder since we beat it once. Every room has more mobs and there are extra traps to trigger as well. The archer and barbarian do not make it. So one bad encounter basically ended the game. It was impossible to recover from an almost party wipe, even in the early game.

I don't understand the idea of making prior missions harder and harder every time it's played. How is someone supposed to recover from a bad adventure? I didn't like this aspect of the game at all and feel it ruins it.

Also as noted on other posts, why doesn't the hero that notices a trap on the floor, STOP? Would any adventurer you know keep walking over a trap they noticed before stepping on it?

Multiplayer is limited to one character each, any reasons? Why can't we control up to two each for a full party?

This could be a nice little game, but it needs work.
developer_response:
You can replay 1 or 2 times the same mission before it becomes too hard. Some missions should be avoided playing too many times as it can be very hard. There is no good reason to replay a mission that many times unless you are going farm blue pots which is why this mechanic was implemented in the first place....

You should venture forth and try new missions or try and reach the bonus dungeons which will give you significant boost in power. There are multiple ways of going forward but as you found out.... playing the same dungeon 10 times is not the way forward....

Traps, you can upgrade detect traps to level 3 on dwarf or archer so they can stop falling to traps.... they will test their perception when stepping to a trap.

Multiplayer, we decided it would be easier if each player just controls their hero. Maybe it was not the best idea... however the game is still beatable with 2 heroes only if you have the right heroes... but it’s a bit of a challenge...

If you find the game too challenging, then consider restarting with a better hero setup (some abilities are more useful than others)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032796346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1553764315}
