author: {'steamid': '76561198049813652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 3196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2191, 'last_played': 1619223912}
review: You like old dungeon games? Then you can not miss this one out. Nicely executed, carefully drawn old style Dungeon Crawler. Typical story, nice enemies, crystal clear rules and fitting abilities. Few characters to choose from, each is balanced and good. Nice playground for all the skills and possibilities. You will find just the right amount of everything here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119501998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 828, 'last_played': 1592754892}
review: Довольно неплохая игрушка в олдскульном стиле, сильно напоминающая древнюю игру Heroe's qwest, чем и привлекла мое внимание. Понравилось, что поощряется обшаривание комнат уровня, а не только прошел насквозь и до свидания.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062206253', 'num_games_owned': 440, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1550597205}
review:
[b]Sehr cool gemacht allerdings auch mit kleinen Bugs[/b]

Rundenbasiert durch die Dungeons und vorsichtig die Gegner niedermetzeln. 

Optisch hat es etwas von Hero Quest und leider genauso zufällig laufen teilweise die Kämpfe ab. Ist der Held noch nicht so hoch geskilled haut man mit dem Schwert der Axt doch sehr gerne mal ins Leere und die Gegner treffen gut. Etwas grinden muss dann von Zeit zu Zeit doch sein, oder man nimmt sich eine Custom Map mit der das schneller geht. 

Leider sind, wenn man auf Bugs trifft diese spielzerstörend. Einmal musst ich aus dem Level flüchten, da es für den Barbaren angeblich keine Möglichkeit mehr gab weiter zu laufen. Im Level vor dem Zauberer kann in der Anfangsformation der Helden ein falscher Schritt bedeuten, dass die Figur den Level verlässt. Dann ist es im Prinzip nicht mehr zu schaffen. 

Für mich eine Kaufempfehlung, ggf. auf einen Sale warten. 

+ Einfach zu erlernen
+ Skills sind ziemlich interessant
+ Musik nervt zu keinem Zeitpunkt

+/- Animationen der Helden beim Laufen (gerade vom Barbaren) etwas sonderbar
+/- Unbeskilled muss man sich anfangs durchbeißen 

- Minimale Bugs, die jedoch Gamebreaker sind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107774137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 18191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14741, 'last_played': 1690645517}
review: Très bon jeu, un hero quest amélioré avec des personnages bien équilibrés. Le nain, le barbare devant  pour la baston et l'archère elfe et le mage à l'arrière pour le combat à distance. Il y aussi une femme templier pour les soins et un moine dévastateur. Le workshop est bien garni, ce qui permet de faire de nouvelles aventures crées par les autres joueurs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198392108152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1590099510}
review:
冬のセールで購入し、積んであったものをスタート。
とりあえず一周（Easyモード）したので書いてみます。

・最初はBarbarian一人でスタート。クエストクリア数が増えると仲間キャラがアンロックされる
　最終的には6人から、各Mapの条件に合う人数（最大のMapで4人）までを出撃させる
・Lvの概念はなく、ステータスも成長しない
・ダンジョン内で拾えるmagic potを消費してAbilityとSkillを覚えたり強化する
・武器防具のドロップはなく、BlacksmithでCraftする程度（ただし19種のみで重複不可）
と、結構シンプルな作りなため、用意されたMapだけだと、（Easyモードでは）ものの8時間程度で一周できました。

ただ、他ユーザが作成したMapを導入できること、何より元値が安いことから、気楽に遊ぶには良いかと。
英語も簡単なもののみなので、あまり苦戦することはないかと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561198039007368', 'num_games_owned': 664, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1549982482}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025478065', 'num_games_owned': 736, 'num_reviews': 355, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1546787812}
review:
Ayant pas mal joué au jeu de plateau Hero Quest et ayant aussi apprécié la version DOS, Dark Quest 2 a tout de suite attiré mon attention dès que je l'ai vu dans les suggestions du store.

Le jeu est un peu amateur et manque de finition. Ce n'est pas non plus aussi tactique que le [url=https://www.gog.com/game/the_temple_of_elemental_evil]Temple du Mal Élémentaire[/url] par exemple, mais j'ai passé de bonne heures dessus. C'est assez addictif et parcourir les donjons avec une équipe variée est amusant.

C'est un peu répétitif et simpliste, donc à réserver pour les fans du genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099013029', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1547507156}
review:
[b]Dark Quest II 3/5:[/b] Titul, který přichází s notně originálním konceptem. A sice taktické tahové RPG strategie, u které není třeba ani ždibec přemýšlet, využívat omezené zdroje či jakkoli taktizovat. Působí to grafickým stylem, rozvržením obrazovky a především ovládacími schématy jako port z přenosných zařízení, byť tomu tak není. 

 Na statických obrázcích to nevypadá graficky až tak zle, ovšem guilty pleasure rozměr to získává až v pohybu. Nedokázal bych z hlavy jmenovat jediný titul, kde by byl pohyb tak nechtěně otřesně rozanimován, že u toho budete nevěřícně obracet oči v sloup i po několika hodinách. Jakmile se mocný „Conan-like“ barbar rozcupitá jak špatná parodie na homosexuála ze šedesátých let, tak (bohužel) víte na čem jste.

 Úrovně i nepřátelé jsou na jedno brdo, těch několik málo změn v prostředí či typů protivníků nemá na hratelnost dopad. Prostě si vyberete družinu a vydáte se na deset až patnáct minut do kobek v notně na dřeň osekané verzi [i]Dungeons & Dragons[/i]. Při střetu pak použijete nějaké to kouzlo či speciální schopnost. Nepřátelé činí to samé a úroveň (ne)sofistikovanosti jejich AI je taková, že bez výjimky napadnou prostě toho, kdo je nejblíže. 

 Ovšem navzdory všemu výše uvedenému to umí být chytlavé čili jako prokrastinační jednohubka na deset minut jednou za čas ideální. Speciálně pokud máte rádi fantasy tahovky a potřebujete nahradit v zaměstnání Solitaire na vyplnění obědových pauz.
------------------------------------------------------------------
[i]-: Případná další (ne)doporučení jsou k nalezení na mé [url=store.steampowered.com/curator/9557800-%28do%29Hr%C3%A1no/]kurátorské stránce[/url] :- [/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197994411572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1561879124}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986030006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1548028755}
review:
Rating for Single Player Thumbs Up! Rating for Co-op Thumbs Down. 

Concept and gameplay loops are good and co-op is fun until you reach the last 5 or six missions. Granted I am playing on Normal with a friend, but artifacts do not work in co-op. Also most misisons allow three characters but for some reason in co-op you can only use two. In one map we managed to kill 8-10 werewolves with only two of us just to die to the next room. Artifacts need to be allowed for co-op or at least the full player amount. Unfortunately at this point if we want to beat the game it will have to be single player.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040122432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1547840911}
review:
It is quite good game. Simple and linear. It is not the best one, I do not how many devs worked on it, but it is most of the time decent. Music is nothing special, graphics are enough good to play. Animations are almost zero, but it do not destroy game. 

There are few little annoying things:
1. You can not move your party togheter. You need to move everybody one by one. I have 3 characters for now, later I probably will have more. In addition that there are a lot of empty areas, you need to move them one by one - it takes time and is waste of gameplay.
2. You can not use wasd keys... camera only move with arrow keys. I discovered it like after few frustraction moments, when camera behaved strange.
3. Sometimes there is problem to pick items - especialy when you party member is in front of it. Sometimes there is also problem with moving to the next room - the same reason.

In overall, there are a lot of better choices than this. Still, if you love turn based games, you like linear story, you like that there is no countless items (in this game every item is exactly one and unique), you do not bother with little flash-like graphics, you do not need great music, and you like to finish game in finite time - guess it is position good consider.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007286350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1625042103}
review:
Picked this up on sale for less than 5 euro. It was a positive surprise. Easy to learn, easy to play but challenging on normal. I like the maps, graphics and music and a very large and attractive userinterface.

What I lack is more items to buy. The equipment is very limited and static right now. So if you find a level too hard you can only replay it and hope for better random results in a combat. While there are some tactics involved in how you use your characters and in which order and also placement I would like to see initiative, flanking etc in a sequel. But other than that, well worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317799164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1547740032}
review:
Bon jeu, très bon jeu même.

On peut refaire les donjons plusieurs fois, mais les monstres y deviennent plus forts.

Par contre, j'ai remarqué qu'à partir du 5 ou 6eme essai les donjons deviennent très/trop difficile, nos chances de toucher avoissent les 10%, alors que les monstres n'ont aucune difficulté à nous toucher.

J'espère que les artefacts à gagner permettent de palier à ce soucis, car me faire défoncer 2 persos par un seul mob totalement intoucheable dans un donjon niveau 6 ça fait un peu mal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015768220', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1546123829}
review:
Interesting game with a lot of potential that is held back by bad design choices and game-breaking bugs (or unexplained features).

[u][b]Negative[/b][/u]

It was pretty disappointing to find out that playing it in 2 player co-op results in each player controlling only a single hero, and not 2 heroes each. It comes down to combining the 2 heroes to create some borderline cheese strategy to beat some of the levels later in the game. It also makes blue pots for skill points almost useless as soon as you level up your main hero to max as you can only use 1 hero in a level (it's only worth collecting them to level up a different hero in case your 2 hero setup doesn't work against particular level's creatures or if you really want to play a different one every level to not be bored). Similar thing happens with items as you can easily purchase the items for that hero in the first few levels and after that the gold isn't really used for anything other than refilling potions and buffing up before each level. Levels have max player count in their description, but it's perfectly fine to start a 1 player mission in 2 player co-op. 

Some mechanics really don't make sense, such as an archer being able to spot the floor traps, but still having to step onto them because it's the only path into the next room. Combined with pathfinding, it would be normal to either go around the trap once it's detected, or at least stop the turn for the player to select a new destination (to recalculate pathfinding). The result, however, is your archer just stepping into the trap even though it got discovered, because you have no way of stopping the movement. There were also instances where pathfinding preferred to go over the curse event tiles rather than over the free path that got cleared by the partner's hero clearing one of the curse event tiles. Since camera angle is fixed, it is really hard to aim at a specific tile behind a unit (especially behind big units), which makes some moves almost impossible (and during the "cutscenes" the black bars sometimes even hide pieces of dialogs).

Then there are description errors. The archer heal description says it heals for 3/4/5, but it heals for 2/3/4. Unique artifacts say they give +1 fate, +1 magic armor, but neither is given. Some things could use some additional description to know how they work, for example Monk's flame circle deals 2 dmg lvl 2, and on lvl 3 it casts a circle from each friendly hero, but that circle only deals 1 dmg now.

Finally, there are bugs like converting a unit with a Monk and going with it first into the next room, which makes your heroes unable to enter that room and not able to choose a different room as everyone has to go into the same room. From what I've seen on the Steam forum, the said bug has been known for a while (although it may have been fixed and then reappeared, but it should still be fixed as it soft-locks the level). During co-op desync happens randomly without any warnings and non-host player is soft-locked.

[u][b]Positive[/b][/u]

The levels are short to medium length with limited equipment and ability usage which makes strategising important. Abilities are quite different between characters , but still simple to learn and get used to if you want to switch characters often.

The visuals are nice, enemy units especially look great.

Co-op is well made with players being able to give each other order of turn execution to allow deeper strategies between the players.

Custom maps to provide some sort of extra content (haven't tried them personally).

review:
It's rather straight and simple for what it is. If i could recommend a slight change needed then it would be during the dungeon crawl/walk through you have to do each character individually for movement through each room which can get quite tedious. The game play is not very complex. You can also farm the items needed to upgrade skills so it can either be challenging or easy depending on how you want to go about it.

I would not recommend this for the full price though. It is a good game for when you just want something simple to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128840035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1048, 'last_played': 1545504782}
review:
I thought it was a fun game, I got it on sale and it was more than worth the price.  

It has a straightforward system that's easy to jump in to.   Lots of small quests which are all interesting and don't drag on or get repetitive.   No grinding is required in this game.

The amount of content is limited but enough to have given me 18 hours to finish it for the first time, I tried a couple of parties along the way.   There is not a giant learning curve but enough to reward good strategy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999263046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1636190117}
review:
SYNOPSIS:
As others will likely write, this is a modern homage to Hero Quest. But if you didn't grow up or are unaware of Hero Quest, it won't matter; it's merely a quick way to describe this game in one sentence.

This is a turn-based isometric dungeon crawler but each dungeon is "misson-based" - meaning that this is not an epic 'top-to-bottom' romp like a roguelike, but broken down into smaller dungeons, each with a specific task/designs in mind.

You start with the Barbarian, who is as you would assume - melee and damage; but the more missions you complete, you can add more people to your backend team - I say that because you can collect up to 6 adventurers but most of the time can only take in 2-3 within a mission; never 5 or 6 and only one instance there is 4 allowed.

Buy potions, weapons/armour, spells/abilities (dependant on adventurer), visit a brothel for an extra edge into the next mission and heal party embers when necessary.

Gameplay consists of "Move and Action"; you can Move a certain amount of tiles and you can Attack once (by default) with each adventurer. Same rules apply for the enemies.

And that's it, in a nutshell - this is a simple game but has a lot a enojoyment for the time to you do spend on it.


SUMMARY:
For me, I really enojyed this game and I hope the Devs add more content (more missions, adventurers, equip, GFX, etc) in the future - note: there is an editor included with the game - I haven't tinkered with this yet and unfortunately there is yet (as of this review) to be any custom dungeons made.

I think for some people, this will not be enough content and depth to immerse into - it's not a "roguelite" but more akin to being a "boardgame with life" if that makes sense. For my tastes, I love the GFX, the Isometric look and feel (the music in this is Awesome, by the way - sounds similar to the Amiga Hero Quest game ). It is a massive improvement upon the first Dark Quest, 

I'd recommend getting this on Sale as it stands only because (I believe) it needs more Dev Content - having an editor is great, but at end of it, we are limited by what content is provided to us. I can't make a swamp level if the tiles don't exist, etc..

author: {'steamid': '76561198015889996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1543791699}
review:
Very fun game. Brings back memories from Hero Quest. Gameplay is easy to learn and hard to master, with tactics becoming very important late game.

Pros: nice graphics, custom maps, diversity of heroes, good RPG feel.

Cons: Clicking on tiles is somewhat difficult on some battles, repetitive music, little variety of itens.

If this game had deeper RPG aspects like hero levels, more equipment slots, more named dungeons with procedurally generated maps (and bosses that droped loot) and equipment diversity it would be perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055725979', 'num_games_owned': 1326, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 1312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1312, 'last_played': 1541200781}
review:
Combates tácticos bajo algunas directrices estratégicas, trabajando bajo un sistema de numeración reducida y probabilidad estable. Esto resume formalmente y repetitivo lo que haremos durante todo el juego.
Los combates se inician al entrar en una sala con monstruos. Se juegan por turnos, enteros para cada jugador y hasta su finalización o huida. Se desarrollan en un plano cuadriculado e isométrico que sirve de base para la táctica. 
En el turno podremos hacer hasta cuatro cosas con cada personaje en el orden que queramos: mover, atacar, usar habilidades y usar pociones, con la regla de que ejecutar el ataque básico gastará todos los puntos de movimiento. Las habilidades y uso de pociones no gastan acciones, aunque tienen que ser usados con sabiduría porque se gastan. Los puntos acción unicamente se asignan al movimiento, delimitado para cada uno de nuestros personajes y monstruos.

Presenta poca complejidad en la jugabilidad pero se realza por el margen de maniobra que se logra en la cuadrícula. Así mismo, la evolución y personalización del grupo lo nutren de forma considerable para formar una táctica sólida.
Tiene un desarrollo jugable de erosión en el que los fallos y errores no se castigan, más bien se basa en un compendio general a largo plazo que puede resultar asfixiante si no jugamos bien. El fuerte del juego radica en jugar con las habilidades y con todos los personajes durante el turno, racionando y estabilizando, con la idea de subsanar los fallos y mantener una integridad hasta el final de cada misión. Para lograr un desafío primordial que conjugue con su jugabilidad no podremos hacer uso de recargar la partida si algun suceso no nos ha gustado.

La estructura del juego va por misiones y preparación en un pueblo: tenemos que aguantar hasta finalizar la misión para volver a recuperarnos. Cada misión finalizada nos proporcionará oro y nuevos puntos de habilidad en relacción a lo que hemos conseguido, con la razón de evolucionar los personajes, comprar objetos y demandar algún que otro servicio renovador.
Las misiones son mazmorras. La morfología de cada una va por salas de distinto tamaño con uno o más enlaces en sus lados para interconectarlas, formando un conjunto de salas de diferente índole que atribuye una secundaria jugabilidad de ir descubriendo y navegando por la mazmorra. Las trampas y tesoros, junto a las salas ocupadas por enemigos, cubrirán y sustentarán la base de combates de estrategia táctica. El juego se convertirá en medianamente firme.

Comenzaremos jugando con el heroe de clase Barbaro y al finalizar la primera misión, ya en el pueblo, reclutaremos a otro de los disponibles. En total son 6: Barbaro, Arquero, Enano, Caballero, Monje Oscuro y Mago. Para acceder a los siguientes tendremos que ir completando más misiones, aunque solo podremos llevar un número máximo para cada misión, tres por regla general. Cada heroe y monstruo cuenta con su ficha de personaje y habilidades. La ficha sirve de referencia para comprender todo su sistema de juego de forma gradual. Es una ficha ligera y simpática.

Tiene su firmeza e incluso un atractivo visual de fantasía pero está demasiado encauzado a un único fin que siembra una pena y gloria. El apartado técnico en dibujo y animaciones resulta bastante limitado y genérico. El componente literal, interpretativo u observatorio apenas existe. El protagonismo y libertad del jugador y las posibilidades de juego general están demasiado dirigidas hacia su pilar; carece de objetivos y aspectos secundarios. Bajo estos menesteres decae bastante porque no resulta arraigado, no tiene fundamento representativo y argumentativo.

Nota: 3,3
1,2 combates tácticos por turnos
0,8 decisión recaida al jugador 100%
0,8 sistema de reglas, probabilidad estable
0,3 ficha de los personajes y monstruos
0,2 atractivo visual isométrico

Índice de recomendación: 60%

author: {'steamid': '76561198030785140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1708, 'last_played': 1539901852}
review:
Dark Quest 2 is a dungeon exploring game with very simple mechanics. Almost everything can be done with a click of the left mouse button. However, it’s not an easy game. 

You start the game as a Barbarian, but are later able to change or add additional heroes to your party. There are a total of 28 quests. Each quest has its own maze of a map to explore, complete with gold, gems, magic pots, traps, and monsters. The gold and gems are used to buy potions, craft items, obtain temporary bonus stats, heal heroes, and resurrect them if they have fallen. Everything is expensive, and money can be quite scarce. The magic pots are used to upgrade abilities and skills. These are also relatively scarce. Traps can only be detected by a skill or by the use of a crafted item, and some traps are unavoidable. 

Each hero can only have up to 2 crafted items and at most 2 potions. Once equipped and set out on a quest, your heroes cannot trade items or potions amongst themselves. Very early on in the game you’ll enter rooms with enemies vastly outnumbering your party. To succeed you have to use the limited abilities and skills of your heroes and pray for some luck. Also, since, all abilities can only be used once per quest, you have to be prudent in their use, and again lucky. If you use a powerful ability to kill a weak goblin in one room and then enter the next room to face a strong werewolf, you’re in trouble. However, if things start to go really bad, you can quit the quest, keep all discovered pots, half of the discovered gold, and head back to town to heal (assuming you have enough cash).

I liked a lot of things in Dark Quest 2:
•	The setting with a group of heroes off to fight an evil sorcerer locked in a castle was great.
•	The characters and maps are all beautifully drawn.
•	The music is very good, though it does quickly get repetitious.
•	 The various quests, with different maps, loot, and enemies were fine.

Some things I didn’t like so much:
•	Combat is turn-based and hero placement is important, but the camera is fixed. A couple of times I was unable to place my hero on the desired spot. A camera rotate function would have been helpful. 
•	I assumed that my party would continually grow, but only 1 quest allowed more than 3 heroes.
•	A number of abilities are weak, or next to worthless.
•	A few quests I had to quit because a character got stuck and I could not continue.

All in all, Dark Quest 2 was well worth its asking price. For me, the plusses far outweighed the minuses. If you’re looking for a beautifully drawn dungeon crawl, requiring you to carefully budget your hero’s money and abilities, Dark Quest 2 will give you 20+ hours of light-hearted fun.

review: Only played just over an hour and had to write a quick review, This game is Fantastic really easy to learn and play it seems very easy to start but as you progress deeper, tactics really come into play, Correct potions, party members, who to fight first it becomes very interesting and I can see me playing this for many more hours to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057839034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 889, 'last_played': 1536435448}
review:
Pour moi le meilleur Heroquest like disponible.

Vous devez mener vos aventuriers occomplir des missions dans des donjons. Il faut composer une équipe avec le Barbare, le Nain, le Moine sombre, la Paladine, l'Archère et le Sorcier. Entre chaque mission vous revenez en ville pour acheter des potions ou de l'équipement, améliorer et réanimer ses personnages.

La gestion est des plus rudimentaire, c'est du tour par tour, mais bien prenant et rempli parfaitement son rôle pour le prix auquel il vendu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011184099', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1645361812}
review:
Dark Quest 2 è un dungeon crawler piuttosto semplice, ma soddisfacente in tutti i suoi aspetti. L'editor di livelli, nonostante la macchinosità, ha del potenziale ed è sicuramente una bella aggiunta. Se vi piacciono i giochi da tavolo e gli RPG a turni, questo è il titolo che fa per voi!

Voto: 7\10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970716750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1535272607}
review: Look, the game itself gameplay wise, is not terrible. Combat it the early stages is fairly easy but it has the potential to be quite difficult nearing the end of the game, requireing conservation of resources. Positioning, good use of skills, etc. The problem overall is how absolutely unwieldly the interface is. EVERYTHING is through the mouse. Every. Single. Thing. No hotkeys, no shortcuts, nothing. Want to see the map? Nope, don't push M, you go click on it. Want to close a window? Nope, don't hit Esc, you go click that X in the corner you slave you. Perhaps you'd prefer to move say, your Dwarf first each turn so you can check for traps? Well by god you'd better be ready for hovering madness and hoping you click that shorty each and every time because A) there's no way to make him the first default character (no dragging portaits to move turn positioning around here, no SIR!) and B) there's, you guessed it, no keybind to select a given character slot! For the icing on the cake, besides aaaaall the other clicks you have to do already, you'd better be ready to click your freaking FINGERS OFF so you can finish the game because JUST moving from room to room (and each map/quest has 10-15 minimum) you have to double click the exit of that room for every. single. character. ALL OF EM. Have a party of 4 and realize you need to backtrack 5 rooms so you can get all your skill potions? Well then partner be ready to click a minimum of 80 freaking times to do that simple wander about. A double click per toon, per room= "there and back again: a Dark Quest story". All this might be fine if it was a touch screen game but this is a freaking PC game folks. It goes beyond inane to not even have a rudimentary system of hotkeys or at a BARE MINIMUM the ability to move your entire party from room to room without clicking a bajillion times. There's a decent game here but it is positively buried underneath a UI that has no idea where it is or what its doing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088206645', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2318, 'last_played': 1574270145}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014313110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 875, 'last_played': 1535037892}
review:
If you like turn based combat games, this game is quite allright to be bought in a sale.
It's fun, simple and pretty (not very original though)
A lot of people mentioned it has a feel of a very eased out Darkest Dungeon, and it really does

However, there are several things that are just wrong in this game:
- UI and usability are weird and bad, it's hard to click on the desired tile sometimes, usual key shortcuts aren't there and despite some tutorial screens, some things lacks explaining.
- Very short, very easy and forgiving... except for the character permadeath on hardcore mode, which is disproportional to everything else.
- Lot's of exploits, specially around upgrades and gold
- Almost no lore at all
- 4 members party only shows up at the very end of the game, very frustrating
- Multiplayer is completely useless

author: {'steamid': '76561197997438733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1534948659}
review: Игра не стоит своих денег ( даже 200 р ). Игра интересна первые 10 минут, потом все становится примитивно и бездарно. Все что есть выше ( на скринах к игре ) это и есть, по факту, вся игра. Не покупайте если вам больше 7 - 10 лет или если это не ваша первая игра в принципе ( для ПК игра ничего из себя не представляет ( кроме "невероятной" концепции кооператива (которая почему-то отсутствует во многих других соверменных играх того же жанра, соответственно, респект за кооператив, за все остальное дизреспект), на телефоне было бы норм, возможно), рефанд.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998568769', 'num_games_owned': 671, 'num_reviews': 828, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1534023240}
review:
8/10

I loved Dark Quest 2. I'm always interested in co-op turn based strategy, so I've had my eye on this one since Early Access. However, I waited on the full release before taking the plunge. For the co-op experience, both you and your partner control one character. I focused on the Dark Monk, the Holy Knight, and the Archer, and my co-op partner focused on the Dwarf, Barbarian, and Wizard. You have a town that serves as your "home base." While here, you can buy potions and items, spend blue vases (skill points) to acquire or upgrade skills, heal or resurrect your characters, sell treasures, or even visit the brothel for a temporary stat boost. When ready to depart, you'll be taken to an overworld map that looks something like the overworld in Super Mario Bros. 3. From here, it's clear where you need to get to, but there are multiple routes to do so.

Often, while playing, we'd run into a level that seemed insurmountable. However, we typically just chose a different direction to pursue on the overworld map, and we were then able to make progress. Later, we would often acquire new skills or think of a different way to use skills that we already had, and conquer the previous levels that had defeated us. We were eventually able to complete every level (on the normal difficulty, at least). Our favorite combination of characters was the Wizard and the Holy Knight. Here's a sample highlight: we ran into a difficult room with a good number of hard-hitting enemies, each with 3-4 health a piece. However, I saw that there was a 1-square wide bottleneck that the enemies would be forced to use in order to approach. I (the Holy Knight) activated my damage-absorbtion shield and stood right at the exit of the bottleneck. Although I took a hit or two, the enemies then lined up as expected in the bottleneck on their respective turns. The Wizard, anticipating this development, then cast a Tornado spell that travels in a straight line as far as possible, dealing 4 damage to every enemy it touches. Just like that, five goblins were defeated!

You'll often run into situations where creative thinking can get you out of a jam. Other spells that have great utility are the Wizard's "Fire Wall" spell and the Holy Knight's "Bless" ability. However, don't underestimate the power of the Dark Monk, who can simultaneously kill an enemy and steal its health with one of his spells.

Although I had a ton of fun with Dark Quest 2, there was no shortage of bugs to be found, and these hampered the experience a bit. First of all, the magic shields that you acquire for your characters seem to block the magical attacks of very few enemies. Especially towards the end of the game, I was repeatedly getting struck by lightning (if this isn't a magical attack, what is?) that penetrated my magical shields. This was especially irritating as the Holy Knight, who has a passive ability that can steal magical shields from enemies that are successfully damaged. In addition, the ability of the Wizard to turn an enemy to ice is also supposed to cause adjacent enemies to lose their turns - in practice, we did not witness this, with enemies around the frozen enemy still taking their turn as normal. My co-op partner also glitched into a set of stairs in one of the later levels, forcing a restart. Additionally, we often had to restart the game when my co-op partner was unable to see that I had launched a level and was waiting for him to join.

I also felt that the "fate" mechanic is not explained well (or at all). For new players, each instance of "fate" allows you to stay alive after taking lethal damage. Another oddity is the way that the player must move to pick up gold. After clearing a room of enemies, you can pick up all of the gold in the room in one turn, provided you only move to empty spaces surrounding the gold, rather than clicking on the gold itself. If you click on the gold, you'll move to that pile, pick up the gold, and your turn will end. In addition, as other reviewers have said, it can be difficult to target a space behind one of your other characters. However, I found that I could typically move here if I took a little bit of extra time to ensure that my mouse cursor was positioned in the small window that allowed me to do so. It could be that this issue is less important when playing with fewer characters in each map (as in co-op).

However, if you like co-op turn-based strategy and don't mind putting in a bit of extra thought in terms of approaching some of the situations on offer, I feel confident in saying you'll dig Dark Quest 2. Hopefully, the developer will patch the game to include some additional clarification for certain mechanics, to ensure that spells work as intended, and to improve general stability for online play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975735048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1660256919}
review:
Un jeu qui sent bon se bon veil Héro Quest tout en apportant sa patte graphique et son lot de nouveautés. Si vous trouvez que ce jeu n'est pas si difficile, c'est uniquement parce que les modes "facile" et "normal" sont l'entrainement, le vrai jeu commence au hardcore avec le permadeath qui va bien.
Le point délicat c'est l'équilibrage entre les perso, car franchement je me vois mal comment me passer d'un Nain aussi pratique : détéction et désamorçage des pièges, peu replacer des pièges désamorcés, bouclier impénétrable et qui renvoit les projectiles, peu placer des barils qui bloquent et blèssent les monstres ... et le top c'est le buff du drop d'or.
Aprés les autres persos ont aussi leurs points forts, le Barbare qui fonce dans le tas en mode berzerk, le Moine Sombre qui tiens le role du nécromentien, la Paladin qui peut réssusiter les compagnons morts et les soigner, le Mage qui fait des gros trous dans les rangs énemies et enfin la Scout qui fait un peu de tout et qui sert à rien ... Il faut donc bien prévoir son coup à la composition de chaque équipe.
Un bon point également d'avoir la possibilité de créer des maps et de les partager sur le workshop !

author: {'steamid': '76561198006260288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1587016317}
review:
Never had soo much fun in a dungeon.

I decided to give it a try despite the apparently damning Sinistrad review, as there seemed to be a stack of alternative views. I have no regrets - some people seem to like the sound of their own voice. I had no problems!

Have only played to date on the normal level. It seems (at this level) to give you a bit of latitude. There were the normal learning curve experiences, but, past that it has been great to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064989269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1651843751}
review:
Simple y llanamente: la mejor adaptación de HeroQuest que encontrarás en el mercado.

Entre 6 y 8 horas de mazmorreo por turnos con los míticos arquetipos de héroe: Bárbaro, Caballero, Brujo, Arquero, Enano y Monje. Miles de salas por explorar, trampas a evitar, orcos y goblins por doquier a los que derrotar...y un malvado hechicero que se oculta en lo más profundo de su fortaleza. Una delicia ochentera, vamos.

Pros:
- Feeling HeroQuest por los cuatro costados
- Mazmorras en general muy bien diseñadas y entretenidas
- El sistema de habilidades es simple, pero suficientemente amplio como para resultar divertido.
- Diseño de personajes, entorno y apartado audiovisual vistoso y agradable.
- Engancha de principio a fin.
- El precio: 7,99€ es una ganga, y si lo pillas en rebajas ya es un auténtico chollo.

Contras:
- Algún bug aislado con el que lidiar (en la penúltima mazmorra uno de mis personajes desapareció del escenario, teniendo que reiniciar el nivel)
- Las animaciones de los personajes son bastante ortopédicas.
- Es un juego muy de nicho, para fans de los juegos de tablero, por lo que no gustará a quien busque un rpg o un juego estratégico de mayor profundidad.

Recomendadísimo a los que esperaban un videojuego que hiciera justicia a Heroquest: este es vuestro juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080123570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1532860454}
review:
Finally finished DQ2...
Loved the music (even if a few more tracks of the same quality would have been nice) and art.
Nice numerical adaptation of the boardgame with simple mechanics but some different ways to crawl through the dungeon  environments.
Characters really have different roles and each one may shine if paired well, allowing a few different team setups.
The modding tools and Steamworkshop are well implemented as well.

My two cents for DQ3 or any following project:

1/Visibility:
Some squares can't be targeted due to characters blocking the path. Either use larger squares and smaller unit models or add a toggable transparency feature.

2/Pathing:
Some traps seem to be recognized by the AI, some not. I would settle for something like "everything you've spotted" is taken into account during AI pathing.

3/Counter intuitive:
The first character leaving a room should end up in the frontline in the next room and not in the back row.
Moving to the movement range limit ends turn while clicking on an enemy positioned outside your movement range makes your unit move and attack. Both "click" methods should yeld the same result imho.

4/Gear:
Would have loved more "game changer" objects, granting skills rather than "+ to x".

author: {'steamid': '76561197995161319', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1537544213}
review:
Some thoughts on Dark quest 2

Short: I really like the game; the base mechanics, theme/artstyle, graphics and drawings are really nice. The game is enjoyable and easy to pick up. Also the price is low.

I posted this reveiw also as a thread in the forum:

I just wanted to share some thougts about Dark Quest 2.

Things that I would like to see in the game or on a successor:

- A unclick/abort option(on heal/abilities)
- More voices/voiceover.
- Option to abort started action.
- More medieval themed music that fits the game.
- Tooltips/info when hoovering over stats.
- Status effect info.
- Farer view on map.
- Show marker for end dungeon when reavealed it.
- All the things Stormchaser mention in the post: "Wishlist for DQ 3"
from 18 Mar @ 11:34am:

- Names for characters.
- Deeper XP / level up / skill / magic / equipment system.
- More tactics (initiative, flanking, more active skill / spell uses etc).
- Dynamic visuals for armor and weapons.
- Random procedurally created dungeon crawling?

Other things:

- A litle too much animation on the breathing animation effect?
- Block turn potion, dosent work in the end of players turn?
- Bug when all party dead it costs money from brothel without any effects.
- Right click veiw is unresponsive.
- The game seems to use alot of CPU/GPU, why?
- Its possible to die to save money...
- Some exits do not show up as a exit.
- Stairs is a hassle.
- Stair stuck bug.
- Stuck outside map bug.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067626300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1532711340}
review:
日本では認知度が低いHero Questという卓ゲをベースにしたPT＋ターン制RPG。
多言語対応は未定であり、[u]現状では英語のみなので注意。[/u]

既成のキャンペーンは分岐はあるものの有数のダンジョンをゴールに向けて突き進む形。
エディタが付属しているので自分でダンジョンを作成するも良し、ワークショップから既存のユーザーメイドのものをサブスクリプトして増殖するも良し、といったプレイヤーにとって息の長い一作。
（ワークショップへの直リンク：[url]https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/browse/?appid=453690&browsesort=trend&section=readytouseitems[/url]）

[プレイの流れ]
 ・ダンジョンをひとつ選んで攻略。各ダンジョンにはPTの人数制限があり、毎回面子を選んで向かう。
 ・ベースキャンプである町に戻り、買い物やキャラ強化等の準備をして次のダンジョンへ。


[旧Hero Questとの相違点]
Amiga時代に出ていたオリジナルのHero QuestをCRPG化したものとは以下の点が異なっており、PT制の側面を徹底強化したシステムに大きく変わっている。

１．資金と入手品のインベントリがPT共有となった
２．仲間キャラや町の施設はダンジョンの攻略数が増えるにつれアンロックされる
３．ダンジョン内の行動量がキャラ毎に振るダイス目ではなく、個別設定された[b]AP制[/b]に
４．アクティブシーンを全員が揃った（入った）部屋に限定。[u]同時進行で別行動が不可に[/u]
５．[u]隠し扉や罠などのシークレットを発見対処する為の”調査アクション”が無くなり[/u]、パッシブスキル依存の床のスパイクトラップ発見＋ドワーフ固有スキルの罠解除のみ
６．[u]敵は全てルームガーダー[/u]となっており、部屋を出てプレイヤーキャラを追うなどの移動を一切しない
７．基本的に同じダンジョンを何度でも攻略できるが、[b]クリアする度に敵が強化される[/b]
８．ダンジョンの攻略はいつでも中断できるが（例外あり）、[b]その際持ち帰れるのは入手済みのスキルポーションのみ。[/b]（※スポイラー:[spoiler][b]7.の理由があるのでこれを逆手にとってダンジョンをクリアせずにキャラ強化に勤しむのが基本。）[/b][/spoiler]
９．キャラが死亡しても蘇生する形に。町で行う場合、[u]蘇生費は一律で[b]資金の20％[/b][/u]
１０．[b]常時オートセーブのみ。[/b]キャラの死亡など、不都合時に強制終了させてもきっちりセーブ


元々が卓ゲで双六的な進行を最大限に活かした内容だったが、サイコロの出目に依存するシステムを廃止し、そこから発生する煩雑さや理不尽さといった要素をばっさり切り捨てている。
セーブスカミングも不可能になっている事を考えると選択肢が減り表現力が低下したと言えるが、結果的にPT制のダンジョン攻略型RPGとして極めてスムーズなプレイが可能になったので端的な退化ではなく、整頓されたという印象の方が強い。


[難点 (バグには*印)]
・キャラや装飾オブジェクトのグラが邪魔になり、スタックしたアイテムや出入り口などを[b]クリックしづらい事が多々。[/b]
・入室時に[b]虚弱なキャラを最前面に配置[/b]する場合がある
・[b]出入り口のマス込みで経路を取る[/b]為、[u]予期せぬ退出[/u]や部屋間移動不能化*を誘発
・段差などにある亀裂(ワープポイント)を使うと移動不能*になる場合あり
・床に落ちている売却専用のアイテムが分かりづらい


[総評]
気になる仕様上の難点や若干のバグがあるものの、遊んでいてさほど気になるものではなく、やり繰り上手を求められるタクティカルなRPGとしての面白さはかなりのもの。
また、シンプルな操作性とクリアなデータの取り扱いのお陰で取っ付き易く、これは特筆すべき美点だろう。
ゲームとしての寿命を見た場合、しっかり充実したメインのキャンペーンに加えエディタ付属という事でオープンエンド性も確保しており、遊び応えは十分。
文句なしにお薦め。

author: {'steamid': '76561198425378972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1676094041}
review: This has been a really enjoyable game that captures some of that HeroQuest nostalgia but showcases a unique appeal in its own right. It is fairly short, even with a second play through on hardcore mode. However, this seems to fit the nature of the game, and I believe it is still worth the $8 price tag. I do have to give a strong warning that this game is not without its bugs/glitches. Multiplayer can be troublesome to initiate (but this is how I played the whole game and I think the actually gameplay shines in multiplayer!!). Exiting rooms and accessing stairs can cause the game to lock up. Also, do not plan to play this game with four people as very few missions actually allow four player. Most are limited to two or three players and there are a few solo missions. Overall, I had a blast playing through this game with my friends! I am hoping there are plans for a Dark Quest 3 in the works!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991107884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1567715755}
review:
Alors pour ma part, j'ai acheté le jeu vers 21h et je l'ai fini a 2h00 du matin....
Je pensais au moins trouver des cartes alléatoires avec un system de difficultées plus ou moins grande en avancant.
En faite, plus on débloque de sorts et plus le jeu devient facile malgrés les ennemis grandissant... 

La mécanique du jeu rappels le jeu de plateau de Héros Quest des années 90 avec des plus...
Bon pour le prix on est pas volé, le jeu est bon mais bien trop court.... Ce jeu devrait proposer assez de map pour tenir un joueurs acharnée comme moi pendant au moins un bon mois.

Le jeu propose un éditeur de map et de partage, mais la communautée à l'air assez pauvre.  
Je n'ai rencontré qu'un bug ou un personnage est resté bloqué lorsque j'ai monté un escalier. j'ai du abandonné la partie. sinon rien de fâcheux. 

Des maps add-on avec contenue multiplier par 20 serait la bienvenue.... car en finissant le jeu, je m'attendais voir une suite avec plus de difficultées... Ce qui en fait vite un jeu vide d'interet! 

8/10 Quand même car le jeu est sympas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008434983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1625099760}
review:
The art style and animations are charming. The dungeons and character abilities keep things interesting. I'm sure this was a labor of love for the devs and I feel that playing the game, too. For $8 it is a steal.
There are still quite a few annoyances: Accidentally leaving a dungeon before you are ready. Wizards being put in front of the party in a new room. The leveling system is weak towards the end of the game. Etc...

author: {'steamid': '76561198000959806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1530468899}

developer_response: You can still beat the game with 2 players if you play good but each player controls 1 hero in multiplayer

author: {'steamid': '76561198006722733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1529853934}
review: A very nice surprise, not expensive, and quite fun to play. If you enjoyed Darkest Dungeon, and want something a little more "light" or "casual", then Dark Quest 2 is the game to go. Less frustration than in Darkest Dungeon since you can revive your characters (except in Hardcore mode), but still pretty enjoyable with replay value. If you never played Darkest Dungeon though, I would suggest to go for it instead, since it is at the same price roughly, but more deep and more "hardcore".

author: {'steamid': '76561198033154477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1672764716}
review:
A lo mejor Dark Quest 2 solo resulta atractivo a los que hemos jugado al prehistórico Hero Quest en sus diferentes versiones  -tablero, Spectrum, PC, etc. Las reglas y el concepto artístico son tan similares que me pregunto si no han tenido problemas con el copyright.
Para los que no conozcan el sistema de juego, ahí va un resumen -la verdad es que es tan simple que tampoco hay mucho que resumir:
-Hay una campaña con mapas prediseñados formados por cuadriculas y con tan solo unos cuantos elementos con los que interactuar. Que yo recuerde: puertas, pasajes "ocultos" -en realidad muy visibles- palancas, tesoros, trampas, objetos valiosos y una docena de tipos de monstruos.
-Para completar las misiones cuentas con un número de jugadores que está predeterminado para cada mapa -entre 1 y 6. Los personajes son prediseñados: bárbaro, paladín, enano, mago, monje y arquero.
-En cada mapa hay una cantidad fija de botellas azules que son lo que más merece la pena esforzarse en conseguir porque sirven para aprender habilidades nuevas o mejorarlas hasta tres niveles. Cada personaje tiene su conjunto de habilidades. Los mapas se pueden volver a jugar, pero las botellas no se regeneran. Así que solo merece la pena repetirlos si necesitas dinero o te has dejado alguna botella sin coger.
-El otro modo de "personalizar" a tus héroes es comprarles objetos y colocarlos en los dos huecos que tienen a tal efecto. También pueden llevar una o dos pociones. El número de objetos es limitado y solo hay uno de cada clase. La parte estratégica del juego está sobre todo en seleccionar para cada tipo de mapa el equipo de parsonajes adecuado con los objetos y pociones adecuadas.
-Los jugadores se mueven, cogen cosas, caen en estúpidas trampas, lanzan hechizos y dan y reciben -sobre todo esto último- mamporros y, además, caen en nuevas estúpidas trampas. Si se mueren pueden ser resucitados por un porcentaje de tu cash en ese momento -moraleja: compra muchas cosas antes de resucitar a alguien. Si tus personajes se rinden antes de terminar el mapa, pierden los objetos y la mitad del dinero que hubiesen conseguido en ese mapa -pero todo lo demás queda intacto.
-El combate es como en Hero Quest. Hay un tanto por ciento de ataque al que se le resta un tanto por ciento de defensa. Si tienes éxito, haces un punto de daño. Lo intentas tantas veces como puntos de ataque tengas. 

No he terminado todavía la campaña, pero hasta ahora me está resultando fácil ¡y que me resulte fácil a mí es algo digno de notarse! Que yo sepa, no se puede salvar la partida dentro de un mapa -y digo salvar, sin más, para dejarlo y luego seguir otro rato, no hablo de esa delicatessen para mi paladar degenerado, que es el savescum con Voll Damm.
Todo esta emocionante aventura se desarrolla en unos preciosos cuartitos isométricos, que a mí por lo menos me encantan y me ponen nostálgico. Vamos, el apartado artístico, es de lo que más me gusta.
Algunas pegas -aparte de lo de no poder salvar y continuar en medio de un mapa:
-Los muñecos son tan grandes que a veces resulta complicado hacer click en tal o cual parte, porque la están tapando. 
-Las trampas. No les veo la gracia. Tampoco se la veía en el juego de tablero.
-Se hace corto. Hay un editor y mapas en Workshop pero no los he probado. A mí me parece que los autores deberían haber incluído por lo menos cuatro o cinco campañas más, o algún tipo de modalidad con mapas aleatorios. También es verdad que los skills de los personajes no dan mucho de sí. Enseguida tienes al máximo los que más te interesan.
-Los personajes diría que están un poco desequilibrados: el arquero y el mago me parecen muy flojos, y el monje es un megaOP (no dudéis en reclutarlo enseguida y en gastar en él las botellas azules).

Bueno ¿y qué? ¿Recomendable? ¡Por supuesto! Os hará pasar dos o tres buenas tardes. Y tendrá sus fallos, pero es un Hero Quest. Es decir:  será una mierda pero es nuestra mierda.

EDIT: Se me ha olvidado decir que tiene modo multijugador, pero como no lo he probado, pues...

author: {'steamid': '76561198069613158', 'num_games_owned': 1326, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1527916893}
review:
[b]Grupo na Steam: [/b] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/mariopertile] Clique aqui [/url]
[quote][b]Pra quem não gosta de ler:[/b]

[h1]Primeira 1 hora Gravada ao vivo na Twitch[/h1]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mFFG9ANGyrc
[/Quote]

[quote][b]Pra quem gosta de ler:[/b]

[h1]Pra quem gosta, e pra quem não.[/h1]
Eu sou um megablaster fã de todos os universos de RPG, tanto pelos universos em si, quanto pela ideia do role play. E também gosto muito da idéia da decisão por dados, cada um ter sua vez, todos os cálculos nas folhas de personagem, a hierarquia, a poha toda. Porém, pra mim, essa poha toda, digitalmente, perde um pouco o sentido. Sim, sou velho, coisa analógica eu gosto de fazer analogicamente. Logo, não sou um grande jogador de RPG (sobretudo com tendências a tabuleiro) no videogame, apenas jogo que gosto muito da história porque simplesmente hoje em dia eu não tenho mais saco para turnos (na época do FFVII eu adorava). E a surpresa é, eu adorei Dark Quest 2!

[h1]Gráficos:[/h1]
Os gráficos são bastante simples porém bastante evoluídos em relação ao seu antecessor. A movimentação e o volume dos sprites evoluiu nitidamente, bem como os detalhes dos cenários e masmorras. As imagens estáticas que não são in-game são desenhadas, como um livro de história e o mundo das quests é um mapa, tudo bem característico.

[h1]Som:[/h1]
Trilha sonora e som nada muito a destacar também, tudo muito na média para o que o jogo se propõe. Se dá para destacar algo é a trilhazinha lounge do lobby que é massa bagarai e não dá ideia de tempo passando.

[h1]Jogabilidade:[/h1]
É o forte do game. Tudo clássico de RPG, upgrades, classes, quests, masmorras, recrutamento, etc. Porém tudo muito simples de mexer pra quem não tem saco e com bastante conteúdo para quem já é experiente no estilo. Você joga com até 3 personagens e, diferente da maioria dos rpgs, os 3 ficam visíveis e ocupam espaço no tabuleiro. Você se movimenta de maneira point and click e também executa as ações desta forma. Em muitas salas você tem que fazer todo um cálculo da vida, dos turnos, dos inimigos e contar com a sorte do sistema de dados para conseguir passar e ainda assim é divertido. E o sistema de checkpoints é bem maneiro também, não te fazendo percorrer muitas distâncias já percorridas.

[h1]Diversão:[/h1]
Diverte e entretém na medida. É aquele tipo de jogo que você vai até travar, larga ele por um tempo, volta e resolve de primeira. Eu me divirto com jogo assim.

[h1] Conclusão: [/h1]
Vale o preço cheio tanto para quem gosta de rpg por turnos quanto para quem não tem saco. Alguns problemas de interface as vezes frustram, mas nada que prejudique a jogatina.

[/quote]

[quote]
[h1][b]Prós: [/b][/h1]
[list]
[*]Gráficos estilizados e evolução ao antecessor;
[*]Desafio alto e gradual;
[*]Uploads simples mas que alteram o gameplay;
[/list]

[h1][b]Contras:[/b][/h1]
[list]
[*]Música na média demais;
[*]Problema de indicação na interface as vezes nos deixa perdido.
[/list]

[h1][b]Recomendado para quem gosta de:[/b][/h1]
[list]
[*]Dado;
[*]Tabuleiro;
[*]Classes;
[*]Para quem não gosta de nada disso e gostaria de experimentar;
[*]Clima de RPG no talo
[/list]
[/quote]

[quote]
[h1]Gostou do review? Avalie como útil para apoiar![/h1]
[b]Grupo na Steam: [/b] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/mariopertile] Clique aqui [/url]
[b]Página de Curador:[/b] [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/12036628/] Clique aqui [/url]
[b]Lives diárias c/ reviews, games indie e competitivos:[/b] [url=www.twitch.tv/mariopertile] Siga na Twitch! [/url]
[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198164310371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1527821939}
review:
I only played through this game once.

I noticed that it was easy to play through the second level several times to get 4 skill potions per run if you just surrender the dungeon instead of completing it. Suggestion: Make it so that you could only replay levels for the first, second... time after completing the entire game once, twice, etc.

I found that the logical choice was to use the Dark Monk and the Dwarf up until the chaos levels, at which point it was necessary to swap out the Dwarf for the Knight. I chose to use the Archer as my third character, but I feel the difficulty of the game would be about the same using either Barbarian or Wizard in place of the Archer.

The inability to walk to squares that you could not see because of the camera angle was annoying.

There should be a keyboard shortcut to toggle "confirm moves", it would be nice to be able to change it without having to go into the menu.

There were some weird glitches, but that did not detract from my overall enjoyment of this game. I'll admit that I got pretty into this game for a couple of weeks, but there is not that much to it.

In my opinion, the highlight of this game is playing with the Dark Monk. Its abilities are all pretty fun, and its even more fun with the Staff of Teleportation. I enjoyed using Chaos Wave to do tons of damage, and using Friends from the Past to buddy up with your enemies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012337571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1179, 'last_played': 1597151969}
review:
[h1]Gelungene PC Umsetzung vom Brettspiel Hero Quest[/h1]

Ich möchte mich bei den Entwicklern für das wirklich gut gemachte Spiel bedanken!

Dark Quest ist recht schnell durchgespielt - aber genau das fand ich gut. So konnte die Spannung bis zum Schluß erhalten bleiben und es gab keinen Motivationseinbruch.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
- stimmige Grafik
- guter Soundtrack
- auf mittlerem Schwierigkeitsgrad fordernd, aber machbar
- rundenbasiert mit taktischen Kämpfen
- langsam ansteigende Lernkurve
- keine Bugs die das Spiel behindern (habe nur einen gefunden, der beim Treppensymbol einen Helden festgesetzt hat)

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- keine Einstellmöglichkeit beim Wiederspiel der Levels den steigenden Schwierigkeitgrad abzuschalten
- manchmal verdecken die Helden Zielfelder für andere Helden


[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Sehr empfehlenswertes Spiel für RPG Taktikfreunde. Es macht einfach Spaß!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020313592', 'num_games_owned': 986, 'num_reviews': 576, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1526854780}
review:
[h1] Review - Dark Quest 2 [/h1]
This review was brought you by [url=www.saveorquit.com]Save Or Quit![/url], visit us!

===

[h1] RATING: 7.0 / 10 - Fantasy Adventure 101 [/h1] 

===

[h1] Overview [/h1]
Dark Quest 2 is a turn-based RPG dungeon crawler. The storyline kicks of in one of the most classical ways: the king is dead, an evil sorcerer seized the castle and his horde of minions is ravaging the lands, bringing death and destruction. Only a handful of valiant heroes are left, and theygather in the last free city of the kingdom, where an Elder will task them with various quests aimed to destroy the enemy forces and save the land. Even if the story is quite the fantasy stereotype, it isn't so bad. You will then be placed in command of a party of maximum four heroes, chosen by a pool of six, each with their own abilities and attack types, other than different values for passive traits such as Perception, fear resistance, or chance to parry an attack. The combat is turn-based and not very complex at that, but does the job and provides even a good challenge in some levels.

===

[h1] Gameplay Analysis [/h1]



[b] General Gameplay [/b]
In Dark Quest II you will have to manage a company of heroes in their quest against the Sorcerer. To do this, you have an entire city at your disposal with different functions: a blacksmith will forge you new gear to give to your heroes, for a price in gold. Some pieces of gear only can be given to specific heroes, some others to anyone. These pieces of gear will have different effects, such as more movement points per turn, more damage per attack, inflicting damage on enemies that attack you, or more uses for spells, and more. Each hero can equip maximum two gear pieces. Then you have the Alchemist, selling powerful potions to aid you in combat, such as health regen, refresh abilities to use them again, damage reduction and so on. Also in this case, two maximum per hero, except the Monk, he can carry only one.

The other facilities in the city are Gravedigger, can resurrect dead heroes for 20% of your gold in exchange, Taver, heroes can rest there to regain full HP, 50 gold each, the Brothel, where your heroes not only can have some fun but also receive a random bonus in their next level, and finally the Merchant where you can sell items you find in dungeons such as jewels and gems, for gold.

The campaign levels are articulated in a map, finishing a level will unlock all the ones linked to it, some levels are special rooms filled with treasure, but are on the edges of the map and difficult sections are before them. Each level has a set number of heroes that can partecipate, not always four, but often three or two heroes are maximum, forcing you to make difficult choices for party composition. Campaign missions are quite varied and provide a good number of different enemies, situations and objectives, like liberating prisoners, collecting pieces of an artifact, or killing a boss. 

Each hero has a dedicated skill tree with unique abilities, they can be upgraded by finding Blue Potions in levels, each level has a set number of them, plus a bonus one awarded for defeating all enemies. Other than skills, heroes also possess attributes, which are Courage, Sanity and Perception, all used to pass skill checks in specific situations or resist enemy effects: for example Perception is used when looting corpses or avoiding traps, while Courage is used to resist Fear spells. Some items can enhanche attributes slightly. 

If all your heroes die you get nothing from a level, while Retreating gives you 50% of the gold you gained and you can keep all the blue potions, so escaping can always be an option if things are looking grim. The fact you can repeat a level any number of times to accumulate blue potions and gold is good on one side, so you can level all your heroes enough to overcome more difficult levels, but on the other it's rather boring having to do the same level a lot of times to get enough potions to upgrade all heroes to their best.


[b] Combat System [/b]
Combat in Dark Quest II is turn-based, each character has one movement action, one attack action, and one skill action per turn, and so do enemies. Damage types are Physical, Magic and Chaos. The first two can be avoided respectively by parrying or evading, with anti-magic shields or special protection skills, while Chaos damage is unavoidable in all cases save for the Priest's barrier spell.

Bear in mind each enemy has a different percetange of scoring a melee or ranged hit, damage values, damage type, parry chance, all these things can be seen by hovering on an enemy and must be taken into account to choose the right hero for the right situation. A balanced team composition with support characters, frontline melee and also distance fighters will be paramount for success, as enemies will become a lot tougher in the later stages of the game.

Overall, the combat of Dark Quest II may not be complex like some other turn-based RPGs, and sometimes i found it a bit too tied to RNG, but still can provide fun and is overall well balanced and works alright.



[b] Content [/b]
It took me around 7 hours to finish all levels. Other than the campaign, a level editor is available to share custom levels on the Steam Workshop and download other players' creations, a nice addition, but with a quite complex and professional-looking editor that needs dedication to learn.


[b] Balancing [/b]
I found all classes and enemies to be fairly well balanced, with no particular things standing out as broken or underpowered.


[b] Challenge [/b]
This game can provide a decent challenge and is engaging enough.


===

[h1] Technical Analysis [/h1]



[b] Graphics [/b]
The hand drawn 2D style has its charm, and while animations in cinematics are a bit wonky and weird, overall the art style is good and different from what we're used to see around, it's a nice depiction of a grim fantasy world. Don't expect modern effects and graphics, since everything is hand drawn with 2D sprites.


[b] Sound [/b]
An average sound compartment with no particular things standing out.


[b] Performance [/b]
Nothing to report, should run on a toaster.


[b] Stability [/b]
Nothing to report.


[b] AI [/b]
Enemy AI is decent, only problem with it is that enemies will always attack the character nearest to them, doesn't matter if some other character is more vulnerable, they always attack the closest. This can be taken advantage of.

[b] Quality of Life [/b]
Some things could use a rework, like showing in the quest map how many Blue Potions each level cotains without having to enter that level, same for gold and enemy number. There should be an option to better select character when they are covered by enemy models, as many times it happened that my characters were very hard to control because overlapped by enemy models.


[b] Bugs / Issues [/b]
Nothing to report.

===

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]
Dark Quest II is a rather basic but satisfying turn based dungeon crawler that can give out some hours of fun at a budget price. The editor has potential and is definitely a nice addition. I'd say if you like turn-based and want something a bit different, try this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048573494', 'num_games_owned': 1383, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1525869698}
review:
Dark Quest 2 mne nalákalo především naprosto úžasnou grafikou ve stylu fantasy kreseb z 90. let a naprosto mne nezklamalo. Ruční kreslená grafika plná detailů a trochu toporným pohybem postav, ale tak nějak hezky a stylově toporným (podobně jako třeba u Deathtrap Dungeon). Asi bych hru nedefinoval jako RPG, spíše jako tahovou strategii trochu ve stylu Heroes of Might and Magic dosazenou do komornějšího prostředí dungeonů. 

Podobně jako v HOMAM se na začátku a mezi misemi ocitnete ve statické obrazovce města, kde si můžete najmou nové hrdiny, vyléčit zranění, oživit padlé hrdiny, koupit lektvary, naučit nové schopnosti (za speciální předměty, které najdete v misích) a pořídit nějakou tu výstroj, která vám přidá například +1 k útoků, nějaký ten život navíc a podobně. Každá mise sestává z relativně krátkého dungeonu, ve kterém vás čekají nepřátelé, pasti, ale také poklady. Každá vám zabere od 10-ti do 40-ti minut. Příběh zde hraje druhé housle a víceméně ho ani nebudete registrovat, RPG prvky jsou vcelku ořezané, ale dungeony jsou krásné, souboje jsou zajímavé a různé kombinace hrdinů především s velmi rozdílnými speciálními schopnostmi v vybízejí k jiné taktice. Velmi jinak se bojuje v otevřených prostorách plných pastí, kde navíc čelíte přesile, nebo na úzké cestičce.

Abych ale jen nechválil, několik výtek mám. Některé věci by stály za bližší vysvětlení, příkladně u pár speciálních schopností zjistíte jak fungují až poté, co si je pořídíte, protože jsou opravdu... no prostě speciální. Velký neduh je nedořešené chození vyplývající z izometrického pohledu. Pokud chci jednou postavičkou jít na políčko, které je v zákrytu jiné postavičky, tak je to skoro neřešitelné. To samé, když na to políčko chci dát třeba past. V podstatě se musím s tím, kdo zavazí, pohnout jinam, čímž samozřejmě ztratím 1 pohyb. Možná to je řešené nějakým ovládacím tlačítkem, ale to by musel být někde seznam ovládacích kláves. Dvakrát se mi stalo, že AI zmátlo, když jsem postavil s trpaslíkem nepřátelům do cesty sud s ostny (spec. schopnost na odlákání pozornosti), nepřátelé zůstali stát na místě a místo toho, aby sud rozbili, se nechali ustřílet mojí lukostřelkyní. Bavíme se ale o 2 místnostech za hru... 

Že hra nevznikala se závratným rozpočtem je asi zřejmé hned, nicméně bavil jsem se po celou dobu (12 hodin na střední obtížnost) velmi dobře. Za mě 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970217405', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1527806784}
review: This is a very nice looking Heroquest style game that is well presented. Starts off fun, but then quickly becomes impossible it seems. Unless I am doing something very wrong, after the 3rd map the odds seem very unfairly stacked against you. 3 members in my party and any room with 3/4 or more enemies will wipe my party out. My fighters dont hit often nor does my archer. enemies nearly always hit.  So it doesnt seem possible to level my party up at all.
developer_response:
You can ask in the forums for some help instead of leaving a negative review. The game is not that hard, if you are not carefull it will result in a party wipe out though. You can find some guides in the forums to see how to improve your experience.

With that said here are some quick tips:
- Try to make it to the bonus room quest which will yield lots of treasure.
- Start over in easy mode and use some of your experience to make better decisions.
- Get multiple level 1 skills in the begining.

- Go for barbarian, dwarf, wizard 

- Barbarian(get rage, counterattack and double attack passives)

- Wizard(lighting bolt, inferno, illusions)

- Dwarf (detect traps level and disarm trap level2 + barrel block)

These are good starting points

author: {'steamid': '76561198003181303', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2038, 'last_played': 1561608310}
review:
I'm loving this game.

I'm only about half-way through this game (and played some Custom Maps), and I am already hoping for new content (like another DLC campaign).

I got this to play a co-op, turn-based, fantasy RPG with my friend, and it has been super addictive. I think I would compare it to Warhammer Quest as far as similarity in game because I've never played Hero Quest.

After the tutorial, you start out in the Village. Generally, you choose a group of your characters for a certain quest, swap out any items you want assigned to each character, make sure the characters have the potion types they may want, and select the quest (you usually have a choice of quests, and they get harder each time you repeat them, so it's good to advance the campaign).

Once in the quest, each character takes a turn by moving, using a skill, using a potion, and attacking. Then the monsters get to do the same to you. There are variables and twists that can alter the core turn, but that is the basic sequence. It's pretty easy to learn, and it gets levels of complexities added to keep it challenging.

There are some great guides out there for the game and the map editor (I'm excited about creating my own maps).

author: {'steamid': '76561198039570003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1379, 'last_played': 1594523742}

Impossible to play multi-player unless you have friends that play it. I reccomend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024267821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1534559719}
review:
Great game! only gripe is as follows:

No transparency or easy way to select heroes/treasure/enemies when alot is in the room.  Also, there is no confirm quit feature.  If you accidently (i misclicked) and lost all progress for one area.

Pros:

Great turn based game
Fast paced (depending on your walking speed setting)
No bugs i have found so far in the campaign (just smashed the orc army)
You can replay most levels (except bonus room) with higher difficulty if you need to level a new hero/grind
Really enjoyed certain levels where you had to fight alot of enemies.  Was fun to strategize on spell/skill usage and to implement my team build to defeat the room.

All in all this is more than worth the asking price if you like turn based dungeon stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998672673', 'num_games_owned': 1387, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1603878801}
review:
Eine Homage an Hero Quest.
Tolles rundenbasiertes RPG mit einfachen aber spaßigen Mechaniken.
Die Grafik ist okay und erinnert stark an Hero Quest.
Es hat einen online Coop Modus und einen Editor um eigen Dungeons zu erstellen.
Das UI ist verbesserungswürdig aber schmälert meiner Meinung nach nicht den Spielspaß.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313189000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1526019299}
review:
この「Dark Quest 2」は、いわゆるファンタジー世界を舞台としたタクティクス系RPG。尚、海外製で日本語未対応の為、雰囲気でレビューしていきます。
ファンタジー世界ではスタンダードなキャラクターを操り、ダンジョン化した城に住む悪の魔法使いを倒しに行く、というストーリー。（と思われる）。
ゲーム本編は、クォータービューで描かれたマップを先行側→後攻側と行動していくターン性タクティクスRPG。行動させるキャラを選択し移動→攻撃を行う。行動範囲内であればアイテムや魔法等の特殊行動の使用も可能。行動範囲は緑のガイドラインで表示される。
敵を倒しながらダンジョン内にある宝（金貨や宝石、マジックポット等）を集めていく。無造作に転がっている死体（骸骨）や宝箱からもアイテムが回収出来る。また、シークレットドアや様々なスイッチもある為、画面内はくまなく探索しよう。
ちなみに、マジックポット（画面右上の青いツボ）は、各キャラクターが特殊能力や魔法を覚える際使用する重要アイテム。
基本的に多勢に無勢の状態で戦う事になる為回復が重要。更に、敵の飛び道具部隊（弓・魔法）や戦闘補助部隊（士気を上げる太鼓持ち等）は優先的に対処していきたい。その為にはアイテム・スキルの取得は必須。クリアしたダンジョンは何回も挑戦出来るので、序盤に金貨とマジックポットの回収を進めると後が楽と思われる。
魔法使いを倒す目的の他に、3つのアーティファクトを探すクエストもあり、やり込み要素もあるようだ。
以下のHPで画像付きの解説を行っています。興味がありましたら、御一読頂けると幸いです。
http://ryukishi2.wixsite.com/dragonknight/single-post/2018/04/14/Dark-Quest-2

author: {'steamid': '76561198051709367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1527073084}
review:
[h1] Heroquest! [/h1]

Chi ha avuto il piacere di vivere l'indimenticabile saga del boardgame più famoso degli anni 90, non potrà che amare questo gioco! 
Per tutti gli altri, questo dungeon crawler presenta varie missioni in cui dovrà scegliere quali eroi usare strategicamente, i loro item e spell (o skill per i combattenti).
Fate attenzione, il Signore degli Stregoni vi osserva....

author: {'steamid': '76561197997102198', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1524314390}
review:
Méltó utóda az első résznek, de annál sokkal jobb.
Aki szereti a körökre osztott fantasy játékokat, annak kötelező darab!
A grafika remek, a hangok rendben vannak, a zene jó, bár vannak idegesítő számok benne.
A hangulat kiváló!
A karaktereinket könnyen lehet tápolni úgy, hogy az adott pályán összegyűjtjük a kék üvegcséket (ezekből lehet fejleszteni a karakterek képességeit), majd elmenekülünk. Bár a pályán begyűjtött tárgyak és az arany fele elveszik, de az üvegcsék megmaradnak!
A pályákat meg lehet csinálni a végigvitelük után ismét, de ekkor a nehézségük emelkedni fog (az ellenségnek több életereje lesz).
Ha az utolsó szörnyet is megöltük a pályán, akkor egy további kék üvegcse a jutalmunk a szétszórtan felszedhetőkön felül!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984221489', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1573690149}
