author: {'steamid': '76561198142425910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1524171697}
review:
Highly recommend if you enjoy turn-based dungeon crawls. Can't recommend highly enough, actually.

A great game that has me wishing for more. The design is simple and fun. I've never actually played Hero Quest, but I've played IOS versions of the Warhammer equivalent, and this game definietly scratches that itch -- far better in many ways. 

The dungeons are not proceduraly generated, they're each hand-crafted and it benefits from this greatly. The fights, encounters and challenges continue to feel fresh and different. 

The playable characters are fun and each have their own strengths. There are a few options to pick from (six) and you usually crawl with three at a time. 

The game is not deep but playing it, I wish it were. I want more, which I guess is the hallmark of a good game with a solid design. 

I plan to pick up Dark Quest 1, the original, to just measure the changes made (just looking, the visuals are a big improvement) and to support these devs, they deserve it. Hopefully they're working on Dark Quest 3, with it hopefully having the same enjoyability and more depth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064901782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1539165968}
review:
If you have ever played Hero Quest the boardgame, this game will feel very familiar..

The good:
The art is really nice. 
The music and sound is good.
Feels like an oldschool dungeoncrawler.
6 character classes with few, but pretty interesting skills and items.

The bad:
Some people complain about the UI, but I really have no problems with it..

Another thing is when you need to backtrack to a room you missed, 
and have to walk each individual character through all the rooms area transitions.. it takes a bit of time.
It kind of feels the same as a DM in a game like Hero Quest, who do not want your party to jump to the end, 
but want you to roll dice for every move to get to the staircase, even if there are no enemies on the board.
I have no major problem with that either.. 

I have played a few hours, unlocked all characters, but not finished the game yet.
It does not seem that long, but it might be a game that is enjoyable to try to beat on hardcore,
and something you can just jump into to take a couple of dungeons when you have some spare time.

It is not the most complicated game, but it has enough there to be enjoyable
and the price is on point, so yeah I recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053987570', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1661922292}
review: Simple and fun game overall, but it still has some little issues. For example, it is really hard to click ur dead party member when you want to revive them, especially when you enemey surround you or step on your dead body. It is really frustrating when you cannot click your dead team member. Or there are some hidden way to click them, but I am just too dumb that I did not find the way. Anyway, it is a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972907112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1561036903}
review: Very solid RPG for the price. 6 recruitable heroes, interesting skills that allow you to do great combos. Enemies are stronger as you progress the game and their behavior decent. Graphic style is fitting the narrative of the game and you will really feel like you are in the story, in the dungeon. That being sad, the game is nothing inovative or groundbreaking, but fine RPG for easy times. Dont get me wrojng, it can still punish you plenty, but the challenge is on "okay" level

author: {'steamid': '76561198273254344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1523552903}
review:
Well, it's relatively short, but I really enjoyed it. I appreciate that of all the "Hero Quest clones" I've played in the last year or so, this one seems to have incorporated the most new, fresh ideas. I especially liked the Dark Monk, even though he seemed slightly overpowered. That's probably why though, lol.

The main thing I didn't like is that you only get 3 heroes for most maps, and you only get to use 4 once in the whole game! I would strongly have preferred to use 4 on most maps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054157182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1674315294}
review: Dark Quest 2 is a nice turn by turn casual tactical RPG. It's fun, with nice art, and even a few cutscenes. Yeah, the interface could be improved, but the gameplay is solid and will give you hours of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036382744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1624759858}
review: Jogo que me fez querer jogar um rpg de mesa com um sistema tão simples como esse. Ao mesmo tempo que possui uma dinâmica fácil o jogo se torna bem desafiador. O modo hardcore foi excelente para desenvolver melhores táticas e evitar perder personagens. Só senti falta de mais missões para 4 personagens. Acabei usando os mesmos na maioria das missões. Anão, Dark Monk e alternava com o wizard ou a clériga. De qualquer maneira, recomendo muito o jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991342089', 'num_games_owned': 856, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1521225867}
review:
[h1]Dark Quest 2 — простенькая пошаговая РПГ в дженерик фэнтези вселенной[/h1]

Полный обзор: http://blast-games.ru/obzori/dark-quest-2-obzor-2018/

Dark Quest 2 – это очень простая, я бы даже сказал, казуальная пошаговая РПГ в абсолютно дженерик фэнтези вселенной и с довольно скудным количеством контента. Геймплей при этом совсем неплох, играть в целом довольно весело, особенно в первое время, пока игра не показывает свой подход к челленджу, а он таков – больше врагов есть больше челленджа. 

Недостатков, само собой, игра Dark Quest 2 не лишена. Первое что приходит на ум – это крайне неудачная музыка, которую я выключил почти сразу. Отсутствие разнообразия врагов – только орки и гоблины, хоть и немного отличающиеся, тоже не сильно помогает реиграбильности и желанию продолжать проходить игру. Тактическая составляющая очень-очень скудная – брать игру ради сложных тактических заруб я вам совсем не рекомендую. А вот графика в Dark Quest 2 великолепная, особенно вы ее оцените, если любите изометрические игры. 

Как итог, свои 195 рублей Dark Quest 2 стоит на все 100%, никаких критических недостатков у нее нет, но я лично проходить до конца не хочу – для меня слишком прямолинейно и незамысловато, пускай и круто выглядит.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083815420', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1521196358}
review:
Nos­t­al­gi­ker werden sich freuen. Hero Quest lässt grüßen. Auf Normal nimmt der Schwierigkeitsgrad bei ein paar Missionen am Ende gehörig zu. Es lohnt sich ältere Missionen zu wiederholen um zusätzliche Phiolen zu bekommen. Mit diesen kann man die Fähigkeiten der Charaktere  steigern. Da steckt auch der große Reiz im Spiel.
 Toll ist es die unterschiedlichen Vor und Nachteile der 6 Charaktere aus zu probieren. Je nach Mission muss man switchen. 
Die Musik im Hintergrund ist sehr schön und passt immer gut in die Szenerie. Grafik geht voll in Ordnung.
Mit etwa 10-12 Stunden Spielzeit ist die Solo Kampagne groß. Will man alle Charaktere komplett Upgraden ist man wesentlich länger dran.
Wer Rundenstrategie Kämpfe mag sollte mal ein Blick drauf werfen. Mir hat es eine Menge Spaß gemacht.
Hier mein Let´s Play zum Spiel: https://youtu.be/XmM6p74HweE

author: {'steamid': '76561198055838774', 'num_games_owned': 1303, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1521021813}
review:
[h1]Ein klassischer Dungeon-Crawler[/h1]
Befreie das Dorf aus den Fängen des bösen Hexers und seiner Untertanen, in einem klassischen Dungeon-Crawler. Inspiriert von dem Brettspiel Hero Quest.

[table]
[tr]
[th] [/th]
[th]Zusammenfassung[/th]
[th]Punkte (max. 100)[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Story[/b][/td]
[td]typisch[/td]
[td]78[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Gameplay[/b][/td]
[td]linear[/td]
[td]70[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Grafik[/b][/td]
[td]handgezeichnet[/td]
[td]75[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Musik[/b][/td]
[td]passend[/td]
[td]69[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Fazit[/b][/td]
[td]solider Dungeon-Crawler[/td]
[td]72 [/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/-German_Gamer_Community-#curation] [i]Diese Review wurde durch das Kuratorprogramm der GGC zur Verfügung gestellt[/i] [/url]

[h1]Story [/h1]

[quote]Eines Nachts hielt der König ein Fest in seiner Burg, bei dem Bewohner aus dem ganzen Reich gekommen waren. Doch die feierliche Nacht sollte ein jähes Ende finden.
Der Hexer ließ seine Schar an Orks und Goblins die Burg untertunneln und attackierte in dieser Nacht den König. Es wurden Kreaturen aus anderen Dimensionen von dem Hexer beschworen und in wenigen Stunden wurden alle anwesenden, Männer, Frauen und sogar Kinder abgeschlachtet.
Die einzigen die es überlebt haben waren jene die sich zu dieser Zeit im Dorf aufhielten. Doch dies bedeutet nicht, dass sie verschont von dieser Grausamkeit waren. Seit dem Sturz des Königs durch den Hexer werden die Bewohner des Dorfes geplagt durch die Schreie der Gefallenen.
Deine Aufgabe ist es die Burg zu betreten und den Wahnsinn, Horror und Tot gegenüberzutreten, sowie schlussendlich das Reich aus den Fängen des bösen Hexers und seiner Untertanen zu befreien.[/quote]


[h1]Gameplay [/h1]

[b]Dark Quest 2[/b] ist die zweite Anlehnung des Studios [i]Brain Seal Ltd[/i] an das 1989 erschienene Brettspiel [url=https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/699/heroquest]HeroQuest[/url]. 
Der Aufbau des Spiels ist recht simpel. In jedem Level erforscht der Spieler mit seiner Gruppe von Helden ein Dungeon, diese werden nicht zufällig generiert, anders als gewöhnlich für Dungeon-Crawler. Die Level sind klassisch zweidimensional, wie man es von Brettspielen gewohnt ist, und bestehen aus quadratischen Feldern. Die Gruppengröße variiert von 1 bis zu 4 Helden und der Spieler kann aus sechs unterschiedlichen Helden sein Team zusammenstellen.
Ziel in dem Level ist es den Ausgang bzw. die gefragte Quest (z.B. finde das Artefakt oder Töte jenen) abzuschließen. Zusätzlich lässt sich immer Gold und eine feste Anzahl an magischen Tränken im jedem Level finden, sofern ihr alle Gegner besiegt habt droppt der letzte Gegner einen weiteren magischen Trank. Mit diesen magischen Tränken ist es im Dorf dann möglich die Fähigkeiten der Helden zu verbessern.
Wie gewohnt können mit dem Gold Tränke gekauft werden (keine magischen Tränke), sowie neue Ausrüstung, ein Bett in der Taverne gemietet werden um die Helden zu heilen, Helden von Friedhof wiederbeleben oder Leistungen im Bordell erhalten für Bonus-Stats im nächsten Level.
Die Kampagne kann in drei Schwierigkeitsstufen (Einfach, Normal & Hardcore) gespielt werden. Dabei steigt der Schwierigkeitsgrad von Normal auf Hardcore enorm an, da es im Hardcore-Modus nicht mehr die Möglichkeit vorhanden ist gefallene Kameraden nach dem Abschluss des Levels wiederzubeleben.  Dennoch ist das Kampfsystem sehr linear und sofern das Spiel schon auf einem niedrigeren Schwierigkeitsgrad durchgespielt wurde ist die Herausforderung auch eher geringer.
Des Weiteren lässt die ganze Kampagne im Mehrspielermodus mit bis zu 4 Freunden spielen.
Zusätzlich zu der Kampagne ist ein Map-Editor vorhanden. Mit diesen kann jeder eigene Level entwerfen und später in den Steam Workshop hochladen, damit auch andere diese ausprobieren können.


[h1]Grafik[/h1]

Die Grafik in [b]Dark Quest 2[/b] ist handgezeichnet und besitzt eine gewisse Tiefe an Detail. Durch den eigenen Stil wird das Setting außerhalb der Level, im Dorf und Cutszenen, sehr gut vermittelt. Während im Dorf eine ziemlich düstere Stimmung vorherrscht, sind die Level innerhalb der Burg sehr stark beleuchtet. Die Stimmung geht dadurch leider zum großen Teil verloren, jedoch für den spielerischen Aspekt, dass der Spieler alles erkennen kann, ist es besser.
Die Kamera ist auf einen Blickwinkel beschränkt und kann in größeren Räumen nur in der Ebene verschoben werden. Das Blickfenster wird umrandet mit raumspezifischen Baumaterialien, so schaut der Spieler im Verließ durch Holzbalken, während dieser in der Burg durch ein Loch in Decke/Wand die Geschehnisse beobachtet.  Ein Problem hat diese Sicht. Oftmals blockieren die eigenen Charaktere mehrere Felder und müssen oftmals neu positioniert werden damit man wieder auf den Ausgang des Raumes klicken kann, dasselbe Problem stört auch ab und an in Kämpfen, dennoch gewöhnt man sich relativ zügig daran und lernt darum zu spielen.  
Die Level mögen einen zweidimensionalen Aufbau haben, so sind jedoch die Charaktere und Gegner vollkommen dreidimensional modelliert. Die Charaktere und Gegner sehen sehr passend aus. Leider müssen Abzüge im Charakterdesign gemacht werden, da ausgerüstete Gegenstände sich nicht auf das Aussehen des jeweiligen Charakters auswirken.


[h1]Musik [/h1]

Die Musik ist authentisch und vermittelt einer der Situation entsprechende Stimmung. Insgesamt ist eher ein ruhigerer Stil der zu dem Spielprinzip passt, dabei pendelt die Melodie sie startet langsam mit ein paar Elementen und steigert im Verlauf die Soundelemente bis zu einem gewissen Punkt und wird dann wieder weniger. 
Die Soundeffekte für Kämpfe oder für die Stadt sind sehr gut gewählt worden, doch bieten sie keine Abwechslung und so hört man vor allem beim Kampf immer aufs Neue dieselben Sounds z.B. wenn ein Angriff geblockt wird.


[h1]Persönliches Fazit [/h1]

[b]Dark Quest 2[/b] ist ein solides RTS-Spiel. Es hat zwar seine Ecke und Kanten mit dem linearen Kampfsystem und eingeschränkten Blickwinkel, dennoch ändert dies kaum etwas an dem Spielspaß. Für 7,99 € erhält man ein qualitativ angemessenes Spiel mit einer groben Kampagnenspielzeit von 6 Stunden, mit der zusätzlichen Möglichkeit eigene Level zu entwerfen und zu spielen.  

[b]Eine gelungene Überführung eines Brettspiels auf den PC[/b]

[i]Wenn euch diese Review zusagt folgt gerne unserem [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/-German_Gamer_Community-#curation] Reviewprogramm [/url].[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198018345646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1551904454}
review:
Dark Quest 2 is good fun for its price. Especially since you can play multiplayer co-op with friends. Too many board games forget the importance of this.

The atmosphere and music are great.

All it needs is deeper character building, customization and equipment systems for better replayability. And the UI could be improved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141167939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1520706460}
review:
The game is a good old fashioned dungeon crawl, clearly inspired by Hero Quest but with references to other games as well (the blue potions look like Golden Axe, and there are Diablo references here and there as well).

Each level you have to select a small number of fighters, 3 for the most part of the game, which forces you to plan ahead carefully. If, for instance, you pick Barbarian (Melee DPS) and Knight (Tank/Healer) you have to decide whether you want a ranged attacker (Archer), a trap spotter (Dwarf) or a magic user (Wizard). You can also carry a limited number of potions. Different teams may lead to very different approach to the level.

The interface is not the best, but unless you are using a controller we are not talking of something that makes the game unplayable, in fact you get used to it quite quickly.

I finished the game at normal difficulty in about a day of play (taking pauses) so it's not particularly long. While levels can be re-played, this probably makes more sense in co-op. Hopefully new levels, and new classes, will add some life to a game that is overall very fun and pleasant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065091371', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1603104625}
review: would like a hot-seat multiplayer

author: {'steamid': '76561198066721049', 'num_games_owned': 966, 'num_reviews': 325, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1688211571}
review:
В марте 2018, на релизе, не реконмендовал эту игру, потому что за свою цену давала мало контента.
Спустя 5 лет купил её снова, но уже за 1 Евро (в 5 раз дешевле) и увидел, что многие минусы были исправлены. Итак, что мы имеем теперь?

Плюсы: графика шикарна, как и прежде; музыкальных композиций много и они неплохи; геймплей напоминает настольные данжн краулеры 80-ых, типа Dungeon Quest, рэндом есть, как и в них, но он не напрягает; классы довольно разнообразные и навыки повторяются крайне редко; есть мултиплеер(!), хотя попробовать не довелось - жена хочет летом гулять :) ; есть редактор уровней и возможность играть чужие.

Минусы: прокачка по-прежнему слабовата - как и говорил когда-то, даже самый мошный навык можно прокачать после первой же карты; синергиё между героями почти нет; видов монстров не наберётся и десяток; игра проходится полностью за 7 часов, если вообще никуда не спешить; карта на 4-ых всего одна; относительно сложная карта всего одна, даже босс проходится с 1-го раза, но хардкорный режим - бред.

Вывод: за фуллпрайс вряд ли посоветую, но даже за 50% уже можно брать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286017559', 'num_games_owned': 2641, 'num_reviews': 416, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1520625972}
review:
So, with a bland name like Dark Quest, is the game itself also bland, or is it actually fun? Considering how both the setting and the characters look and act, they are quite generic, but Dark Quest 2 as a turn-based RPG is actually quite fun and interesting.

The game puts you in control of up to three heroes, which need to defeat an evil sorcerer. Featuring an amazing, hand-drawn isometric art style and dice-based mechanics, Dark Quest 2 really looks like a board game that came to life in a digital form.

Every map is made to question the strength, courage, and sanity of your party, so make sure you come prepared. Besides the challenging single player mode, Dark Quest 2 even features a multiplayer mode, where players can either play together to try to defeat the evil sorcerer or they can just go to the arena and try to kill each other.

We don't see many turn-based dungeon crawlers these days, but Dark Quest 2 definitely looks promising. The game is in Early Access at the moment, but it's quite packed with content which should keep you entertained at least for a little while!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970799950', 'num_games_owned': 1071, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1547402734}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994750031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1569986452}
review:
This game is awesome. It mixes the classic dungeon and classic rules of dungeon games of the past in with a supurb modernization that most nastalga remakes completely miss.

Add in Co-Op, and good humor and you're looking at an ultra fine dungeon crawl developed exactly how you dreamed the future would be when you were a kid on your 386,  if FPS haddn't taken over gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092142580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1520702619}
review:
By the time of writing this, I have put about 5 hours into this game. If you like roguelike combined with turn-based game play, you might very well enjoy this game. The graphics and game play are very nostalgic and appealing. It's the type of game that hooked me instantly. And I look forward to putting more time into it.

There is one glaring issue I've encountered while playing and that is that you are unable to rotate the camera. It can make it difficult to pick up items, choose the correct opponent, take the right path and causes some frustration when you're trying to do one thing and you end up accidentally doing another. I hope at some point in the future a rotate feature is included in the game but I don't think it's such a huge issue that it should prevent you from enjoying the game play experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042235490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1587665846}
review: The game is pretty fun, but a little lacking in content.  It doesnt take long to max out a heros' skill and the crafting is fairly limited.  Also, when playing 2 person multiplayer, you should be able to bring more than 1 person on a 3-4 player quest.  All in all, the game has potential.  If updated with more quests and a more engaging story this could be a pretty amazing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143938587', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1522990413}
{'steamid': '76561198043468087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1397, 'last_played': 1532636059}
review:
El juego está esquisitamente realizado.
En su día jugué a HeroQuest, en tablero y en Spectrum, pero he de reconocer que este es muchísimo mejor.
Es muy rejugable, debido a que cada vez que entras a la misma mazmorra, los enemigos son más dificiles.
Eso unido a la posibilidad de elegir tu camino de  habilidades, armas, y heroes, me ha encantado.
Las gráficos, las animaciones y hasta la música (que soy de los que suelen desactivarla nada más instalar un juego) están muy bien conseguidos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003048262', 'num_games_owned': 1213, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1520445303}
review:
Dark Quest 2 ist Hero Quest trifft Diablo trifft Dungeon Crawler. Mit mutigen Helden durch die Dungeons des Schlosses welches vom bösen, bösen Zauberer übernommen wurde. Vorher hat dieser aber noch alles Männer, Frauen und Kinder getötet. Grund genug also um Rache zu nehmen. Während der Quests pimpen wir unsere Helden im Dorf beim Magier, Waffenschmied oder im Puff. Entspannung nach dem totknüppeln von Goblins und Orks muss halt sein! Nettes Spiel!

https://youtu.be/p1sx-Z13wpQ

author: {'steamid': '76561197968907104', 'num_games_owned': 1058, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1520423178}
review:
[b]tl;dr:[/b] Potentially fun casual turn-based game, ruined by offensively bad UI and controls.

WARNING: Quite the wall of text incoming.

[b]The good:[/b] 

First of all, if you are looking for a tactical challenge rivaling X-COM or Battle Brothers, look somewhere else.
What we have here is a rather simple and casual turn-based game with some light RPG attached to it.
Not every game has to be super hard and complex, so this isn't a downside to me.

You are in control of a bunch of heroes, of which you can take a number with you on each dungeon.
Dungeons are relatively short (I don't think you'll need more than 15 or 20 minutes for each) and filled with traps to step into, monsters to fight and lots of loot to find.

Graphics and sound are adequate, if a bit too cartoonish for my taste. It does fit the cheesy tone, though.

While casual, it isn't fully mindless, you actually have to make sure not to do really dumb moves that would get your characters killed and have to make good use of your abilities - as well as try to send a well-rounded team.
That said, the game is on the easy side of things and I very much recommend playing on Hardcore, or at the very least Normal. Easy will most likely put you into sleep.

As you progress through the game, more heroes will be unlocked, items can be bought and found magic potions are used to increase abilities and skills of your heroes.

I'd say it would be a fun little casual turn-based RPG to be played in small sessions or on the side.


Unfortunately, the game has such significant [b]downsides[/b] that make enjoying it almost impossible:

The UI and controls must have been designed with maximum waste of time in mind.
I have no other explanation for the things I will list now:

There are no hotkeys. I kid you not. 2018 and someone releases a turn-based tactical RPG without any hotkeys at all. ESC does not open the menu, nor does it close open menus. Tab opens no inventory or map, neither does M or I. Space or Enter does not end your turn. Everything requires moving the mouse around. It is a mind-boggling waste of time.

No minimap, either. And the map that is there opens not focused on your current location so you have to scroll around each time to find your room. What a waste of time, again.

Leaving a section of the dungeon requirew you to move every single one of your heroes to the exit manually. Every time, each section. When having four heroes with you, that means clicking eight times (!!!!) to leave an area. I would somewhat understand this, if the game allowed you to split your group, but that's not even possible. The developers obviously didn't care to have any kind of different logic attached for singleplayer vs co-op. A baffling waste of a player's time. 

Menus in the town are their own version of "how to waste the maximum amount of time of my players".
Is your idea of a good level-up interface to drag-and-drop a UI element onto a skill in order to improve it, instead of just clicking the ability?
Do you like having to drag-and-drop hero portraits around to rest, instead of clicking on them or - even better - having them auto-selected as there is no thinking involved in selecting them anyway?
Just how much do you love having to repeat "click sex worker, select menu, drag-and-drop a SINGLE hero, confirm" for every hero you want to receive a temporary bonus, despite the fact that other menus at least offer multiple slots to drag multiple heroes into?
And don't you totally dig having to drag-and-drop heroes into the slots for a mission instead of auto-selecting or just clicking them?
If the answer to any of these is "no", then... well, bad luck.
I don't know if the logic behind this nonsense was "immersion", but a drag-and-drop action is not immersive, it as an utter waste of my time. 

The character that has the ability to uncover traps in an area around him will still gladly walk into them, if the move command was given before the trap was discovered. Brillant. If you like moving in mini-steps to waste your time a little.

Good luck clicking on anything to top-left to top of one of your characters. The sprites block the view, so clicking anything there is quite the hassle. This is solved by moving the character around so you are able to click, e.g. on the exit.

The cherry on top? No linux support despite using Unity. Obviously, a dual-boot or virtual machine to test-run the binaries would have been asking too much. At least it does run fine under Wine.

All of this gives off the impression that the last 30 years of game development never happened, the developer never played a PC game or what we have here is a weird mobile port. But the game isn't even available for mobile!
I have rarely been this dumbfounded by shortcomings in a game as much as here. All of these could have been avoided by anyone ever having played another PC game taking a look at it and saying "Uhm... you might want to change this".

[b]Conclusion:[/b]
Should the horrible UI and controls ever be fixed (or rather, something decent be implemented in the first place), I'd actually recommend this. Until then, if you do not have a Gandhi-like patience for a game wasting your time without any need, avoid this.

And finally, dear developer, repeat after me:
I shall not waste a player's time. I shall not waste a player's time. I shall not waste a player's time. I shall not waste a player's time. I shall not waste a player's time. I shall not waste a player's time. I shall not waste a player's time. I shall not waste a player's time...

author: {'steamid': '76561198067608206', 'num_games_owned': 4450, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1520390280}
review:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1323053435

Dark Quest 2 tem o jogo de tabuleiro Hero Quest como influência, e é um jogo de RPG com jogabilidade e progressões simples, com uma simples história de fundo.

No jogo, você controlará um grupo de heróis utilizando de com câmera isométrica, atribuindo comandos individualmente. Toda a parte de mecânicas do jogo é rolada automaticamente nas ações necessárias, portanto é um RPG simples e acessível, mais até que um boardgame.

Sua campanha principal conta com 28 fases, e cada fase possui um limite de heróis, com suporte a 1, 2 ou 3 heróis por fase. Você começa a campanha com um herói, escolhe outro a ser destrancado após a primeira missão, e já libera o terceiro em uma missão também, rapidamente fechando o grupo. Você poderá destrancar novos heróis posteriormente.

O jogo permite que fases sejam revisitadas, e isso irá aumentar o desafio da fase cumulativamente.

Entre cada missão, você retornará à vila, onde poderá utilizar recursos importantes, como restaurar a vida de personagens na taverna, aprender magias, comprar poções, ressuscitar heróis mortos e iniciar novas missões.

Cada herói possui suas próprias estatísticas, e tem 2 tipos de habilidades: ativas (abilities), que podem ser usadas apenas uma vez por aventura, e passivas (skills), que sempre funcionam. Você poderá aprender essas habilidades e passá-las de nível gastando Poções Mágicas, encontradas nas fases.

Posteriormente irá liberar o ferreiro, onde poderá construir itens por dinheiro. Você poderá atribuir os itens aos personagens, com certos itens sendo restritos a determinados personagens, e a um limite de 2 itens por personagem.

Fora isso, há o gerenciamento de poções: cada personagem possui 2 espaços para poções, que deverão ser compradas no alquimista e poderão ser usadas nas fases também.

Além de sua campanha principal, o jogo vem com um editor de mapas para quem quiser se aventurar e criar suas próprias missões, e integração ao workshop do Steam, onde você pode facilmente encontrar novas fases para jogar, feitas pela comunidade.

Seu cooperativo online é para até 4 jogadores, embora na prática, a campanha principal possua mapa para até 3 jogadores apenas. No multiplayer, cada jogador controlará apenas um herói.

Recomendado para quem curte combates em turnos, e quer uma experiência mais casual e simples, ou simplesmente pra dar uma coçada na saudade do HeroQuest!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971040782', 'num_games_owned': 1038, 'num_reviews': 257, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1520727421}
review:
Good o fashion dungeon crawler with single player and co-op.  Upgrade weapons, visit the vendors, recruit hero's and pickup characters some of the dungeons.    
Note crafting is really stock item upgrades
The more you play the stronger your hero gets.   
More loot would be great but probably better detection skill bonus could effect that.   
Walking tutorial
The mod support for more maps adds great replay value
Would have loved more voice acting as the intro is really good
If you liked Hero Quest you'll love this

author: {'steamid': '76561198336861356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1518937368}
review:
linear, simplistic character progression (not even visual progression is offered).
hugely lacking in character customization. homogenous playstyles.
short campaign supplemented by hit-or-miss user designed content. 
empty town hub lacking personality.
lack of incentive for me to keep playing.

the tactical combat and art style have their charm, 
but the rest of the experience could only be summed up as vapid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134730614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1517601401}
review:
It's a good game for £5, looks good and is fun to play.  Easy to complete once you max out a couple of characters out and find a party dynamic that works for you.  

Though, if I'm completely honest, the character development/level up/equipment improvement is poor; they tried to do something a little different, but unfortunately it doesn’t work.  The story is really quite bad as well, at no point did I feel engaged with what was going on, which is REALLY important if you re going to have a success dungeon crawl due to how monotonous they can get.

If they develop a third edition, I'd be happy to pay £20 for it IF they create a proper narrative, better character development and less restrictive equipment choices.   There is SO much potential here, just needs somebody to create a better world and characters.  Put another way, if Warhammer Quest and Dark Quest merged into one super game, I’d be happy. Better still just ask Games Workshop for the rights to develop 1980s classic Hero Quest…

author: {'steamid': '76561198183622617', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 15470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2169, 'last_played': 1543358947}
review: Πολύ καλή προσέγγιση του επιτραπέζιου Hero Quest. Θυμίζει τον παλιό καιρό που το παίζαμε ομαδικά στο τραπέζι! Το συνιστώ σε φίλους που αγαπάνε τα παιχνίδια με τακτική και ομαδικότητα και δεν βασίζονται μόνο στο να σκοτώνουν και να αναβαθμίζονται. Σίγουρα δεν θα ήταν ωραίο να το παίξετε μόνοι σας αλλά με παρέα για να κάνετε χαβαλέ. Στα, αρνητικά του θα βαλω το μικρό campaign το οποίο πιστεύω κάποια μέρα θα επεκταθεί όχι μονο από τον δημιουργό αλλά και από τους φίλους που φτιάχνουν πίστες στο editor. Η τιμή του είναι καλή! Ενα άλλο που θα ήθελα να προστεθεί είναι η δυνατότητα να βλέπεις τα ζάρια. Ετσι για να θυμίζει τον παλιό καλό καιρό. Υπάρχουν αρκετά bug αλλά με τον καιρό βελτιώνεται. Ακόμα κάτι που θα μπορούσε να βελτιωθεί είναι η αναβάθμιση των skills να γίνει πιο δύσκολη ώστε να αναγκάζεσαι να βοηθάς άλλους παίζοντας περισσότερο. Γιατί τώρα τελειώνει το παιχνίδι πολύ εύκολα. Παρ'όλα αυτά αξίζει και μπράβο στην προσπάθεια να γίνει τρισδιάστατο σε σχέση με το πρώτο της σειράς.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007394070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2355, 'last_played': 1528475976}
review:
Excellent game but only for those which are into simple classic turn based rpgs. It is an enhanced board game version of Heroquest and with the Editor for own maps and the ability to play it with friends online it is worth its money.
Those players which expect a full price rpg with lots of content will be disapointed. Hopefully there will be expansions to enhance the gameplay further. It is almost bug free, has nice grafics for a low priced game and the music is fine. I recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035611765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2751, 'last_played': 1521378021}
review:
I think that this game could have a lot of potential if more content / variety was added.  For example, crafting is limited to stock items - no means for customization and once the available items have been crafted, that is it - no more.  I think the game description of 'crafting' is therefore a little misleading. It would also be more fun if monsters dropped some loot, or you could find the odd useful hidden item, rather than just gold / items to sell.

Monster types are limited to variations on Orcs, Goblins or the odd Chaos Warrior.  Traps and Secret doors are not really challenging - i.e, no 'search for' option.  The variety of room type is also limited, and quickly become tedious / boring.  What about some outdoor environmments?  Also carrying a  max of two potions?  Seriously?  Even the simpler, but more accurate homage to Heroquest 'Mighty Dungeons' (I have the tablet version) allows you to carry multiple potions.

I know it pays homage to the original Heroquest, but what about bringing in some of the concepts from the 'Advanced Heroquest' game? - this was more of a half-way house toward full AD&D and could be more fun, though I guess this would probably require a redesign in coding, though I am sure a few elements could still be added to enrich the game.

A plus point, however, is the availability of the workshop and user maps - some of these have been fun and more challenging than the main quest lines.

Note that I cannot comment on any networking issues, as I don't play multiplayer.

All in all 5/10 for me, though I do like it, it is just that it needs more.  I would recommend this, once finally released and out of EA, but only on sale, not at full price, at least not until further content / variety was added.  Obviously my comments are based on the EA version, but - it is the late EA and so should therefore be very close to the final product, baring the very last map.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970330814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1509195584}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971623455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1509287412}
review:
No es un juego que vaya a ganar ningún premio, pero sin duda te mantendrá entretenido unas cuantas tardes. Tiene un agradable regustillo a los años 80, una jugabilidad adecuada (aunque en ocasiones el manejo de los personajes sea complicado debido a la perspectiva), y la dificultad es la correcta.

100% recomendado si lo pillas en rebajas, si eres un fan de los dungeon crawlers, o si echas de menos HeroQuest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168228621', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1507557840}
review:
遇到一个烦人的BUG，人物触发陷阱掉落另一间房间。视角在该人物身上，技能界面却停留在其他未行动的人身上。然后未行动的不知道如何抵达该房间（无法选择行动终了），在该房间的已行动无法再动。游戏就这样卡死了。遇到几次了，很影响体验。
游戏本身质量可以。

author: {'steamid': '76561198043726774', 'num_games_owned': 1552, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1505526516}
review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Category[/th]
        [th]Points*[/th]
        [th]Description[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Gameplay[/td]
        [td]7[/td]
        [td]Controls are intuitive. It's a point-and-click board game. Difficulty comes from strategy behind how to approach enemies and avoid traps.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Content[/td]
        [td]5[/td]
        [td]The game has an overworld similar to Super Mario World and a common area in a village for purchasing supplies, healing, and hiring new party members. Each level (quest) is a series of rooms reminiscent of the Hero Quest board game and take a decent amount of time to get through. I only have a couple of hours in the game as of this review, but could imagine it taking a good 20 hours to complete. Online co-op is also present, but we had difficulties keeping connection and staying in synch.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Graphics[/td]
        [td]7[/td]
        [td]Graphics are better than what you would typically expect for a board game. Character and environmental artwork is nice, animation is fluid if somewhat stretchy looking. Overall the game looks nice.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Audio[/td]
        [td]7[/td]
        [td]The sound effects are nothing special, but the music is good. Some of the tracks remind me of Heimdall from the Sega CD days.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Re-Playability[/td]
        [td]5[/td]
        [td]Re-Playability is probably average at best, at least until multiplayer and Steam Workshop is fully functional.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Total[/td]
        [td]6.3[/td]
        [td]If you like table top RPGs a la Hero Quest or Dragon Strike, then give this game a go. However, if you want to do online co-op, hold off and keep an eye on its development.[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

* Points are weighted by 35%, 25%, 20%, 10%, and 10% for gameplay, content, graphics, audio, and re-playability, respectively.

[table]
    [tr]
        [td]Bang-for-Buck[/td]
        [td]6[/td]
        [td]At it's current state I wouldn't pay more than $8 or $9 for it. When the game is finished then it's full asking price of $13 will be a good value.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Achievements[/td]
        [td]1[/td]
        [td]I can't give this a good score as one achievement is currently not attainable as it is for defeating a yet to be implemented enemy. Another achievement for getting 100k gold also is silly.[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561198022318021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1524892555}
review:
If you ever find yourself looking for that D&D or Pathfinder type game you could play with your friends online, then this game is definitely worth looking at. By far, this game's greatest strength is its co-op campaign. My friends and I took to this game almost instantly for its fantasy setting, turn-based combat, and online co-op. VERY few games fall into that category.

So, selling points on the game:
- online co-op campaign, easy to use invites through steam.
- very huge improvement from the first Dark Quest, I mean you can really appreciate the game so much more if you play or even look at the first one.
- very well done art, making for a very visually pleasing experience. 
- great tactical combat, but think more "board game" than actual D&D
- interesting characters, 7 total at this time...looks like there might be room for 3 more?
- persistency between maps, you keep equipment, potions, gold and whatnot, interact with the village. 
- great replayability, the maps increase in difficulty after you beat them, so replaying actually does provide a challenge.
- super cheap for the hours of playtime you'll get!
- simple but effective story. Bad sorceror in giant castle torments the town, and he has an army of goblins, orcs, and undead. What more do you need here?

Cons:
- there are a few bugs here and there, it's Early Access
- sometimes, you'll find yourself wishing for more (like, dang I wish there were more characters, dang I wish we could further customize these characters, or dang I wish my equipment showed up on my character) but remember, it's Early Access
- you have to start with only the Barbarian and the Mage, then beat the first 5 levels if you wanted a specific other character (Devs if you're reading this, can we pick our starting heroes please?) but once again, Early Access!

In summary, all of the (admittedly minor) faults I found in this game, I was able to forgive because it is absolutely charming, super fun to play with 2 more of your friends, and if something didn't work for whatever reason...I just found myself saying "Oh well it's Early Access".
I'll be creating an account on their forums soon to list the few bugs we found, and maybe highlight some areas where the game could easily gain some free points with players. But overall, I absolutely recommend this game. It's a real winner, and I love supporting hard-working indie devs just like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004308115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1634079097}

author: {'steamid': '76561198333322621', 'num_games_owned': 14855, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1500392104}
review:
非常好玩的美式硬派地牢战棋游戏，英语四级水平畅玩游戏无压力。游戏过程可解锁六名角色，每个关卡最多能派三名角色上场，前期能用的三名角色分别是野蛮人、巫师和矮人，每个角色都可以通过技能树学习自己独有的天赋和技能（需要在战斗中获得技能瓶方能习得），每个天赋和技能最多可以升到三级，其中每种天赋每个关卡只能使用一次，而技能（多为被动技能）则可无限次使用。

野蛮人比较实用的技能是反击、二连击、三连击、低血时物攻增强等；巫师的实用技能是魔法盾，实用天赋是随机闪电（满级可随机攻击三个敌人）、幻影分身（满级可召唤三个幻影，每个幻影都可进行魔法攻击，相当于让我方人数增加一倍）、冰冻（满级可冰冻4×4的敌人并造成冰冻伤害）、炎弹（3×3范围攻击）；矮人的实用技能是弓箭及魔法格挡、陷阱探测、陷阱拆除，实用天赋是击晕、100%物理格挡（满级可在三回合内对任意物理攻击免疫）。

除了技能树，游戏还设了武器锻造系统，通过花费游戏中收集到的金币打造各种武器，比如100%防御弓箭的盾牌、可全地图移动的靴子、可同时攻击周围敌人的流星锤、可重复使用天赋的天书等等，对扭转战局有着至关重要的作用。

即便有技能和武器的加持，游戏也是颇具挑战性的，比如每个角色最多只能携带两个血瓶、每场战役埋伏着各种各样会伤血的陷阱、隐藏着敌人的宝箱等等，而战斗中损失的HP在战斗结束后也不能恢复，需要去旅馆（花钱）休息才能恢复。

好在游戏并不是永久死亡机制，战斗结束后可以通过花费三分之一的金币来复活死去的角色，除此以外没有其它惩罚机制，而死去之时在战斗中获得的金币也会保留下来。

已经通过的关卡可以反复挑战，只是每完成一次挑战，再次挑战时难度会倍增（比如敌人的HP和攻击伤害会增加、陷阱数目会增加等），而反复挑战的目的主要是为了刷技能瓶和金币。

目前游戏还在不断更新中，角色和敌人的参数、属性和平衡性在每次更新后都会得到优化和修正，同时也会有新的关卡被解锁，我目前已经玩了8个小时，还没看到什么BUG，再加上游戏的音乐也非常棒，强烈推荐一玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561197998110256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1018, 'last_played': 1515806083}
review: Neat dungeonner, with very simple mechanics but still very tactical. Think Hero Quest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029868886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 3007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1609560646}
review:
Gamers like Bullfrog and Brilyn don't seem to get what early access means. This game is being updated and built upon on a roughly bi-weekly basis. The last update unlocked more levels, patched errors and the developers asked for feedback on making new quests and balance issues.

As for price and gameplay, for the first the game may have only had 12-14 accessable levels a month or two ago from the time of this review, but its growing now. Read the description of the game.  And the gameplay, if you don't see gameplay footage on the store page go to youtube to check the game out to see if it's for you.


Been playing games since the mid 80's, and this is one of the funnest I have ever played. Its simple, addictive, a little flawed - but getting better each and every week with great updates. I've finished all the levels but there are another 8 levels they are still working on that I am looking forward to playing. Each class has 7 ability/spells that you can claim and then upgrade and you can craft gear to better prepare yourself in different levels. Having a shield will protect you from arrows, important when those goblin archers have you in their sites. Its worth a try, and now I'm going for DQ1  !!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986286716', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1499253093}
review: nice game

author: {'steamid': '76561198034698929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1575066052}
review:
Being an old fan of the boardgames Heroquest (and later D&D boardgame), I was pleasantly surprised to discover the game Dark Quest 2. 

Dark Quest 2 brings a lite-version of those boardgames, with gorgeous handdrawn graphics and a great dungeoncrawl-feel to it. An added bonus is the mapeditor for infinite content to even extend replayability.

Pros: 
- dungeons
- loot
- multiplayer
- mapeditor
- great soundtrack

Cons:
- more keyshortcuts would be nice

author: {'steamid': '76561198047549283', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1586903286}
review:
Thumps up!

Just trying and keep it short an clean. [Written during Early Access Phase / ~10 Hours into the Game]

+ HeroQuest flair!
+ Lovely Artworks
+ Grinding and Looting Deluxe
+ Soundtrack very fitting
+ Coop feels just awesome
+ Great Support!

- Mechanics can be exploited pretty easily (terms of leveling)
- Skill cap reached pretty quickly
- (Minor) Teething problems, but no bugs so far!
- Replayability, long-term motivation, balancing questionable (at this point of the development)

Short but fun experience, especially for Tabletop Roleplay aficionados! Definitely something to keep an eye on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970435474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1668635506}
review:
This is very much a heroquest inspired game and fans of that board game will probably get more out of this than people who never played that.

The graphics are a great improvement over the first game and look pretty nice with an 80's cartoon/tabletop feel and i find the quests fun. There's also a dungeon builder tool which will greatly improve the longevity and provide entertainment in itself if creating dungeons is your thing. And a possibility of a procedural generated based expansion coming up which would be awesome if done right.

Those complaining about the games difficulty may have not noticed that you can replay earlier dungeons, which whilst grindy, is a good way to make sure you are well equipped and prepared for the more difficult dungeons. I also like the in game global chat, tales of maj'eyal has something like that too and its a good way to ask advice from other players if the numbers are there.

So, good game, glad i finally got around to getting it! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198109352410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1651, 'last_played': 1502493227}
review:
Dark Quest 2 ist an die alten Fantasy-Brettspiele wie Hero Quest angelehnt. Man führt eine Gruppe aus max. 3 Helden, die man aus einem Kader von bisher 7 Helden zusammenstellt durch verschiedene Dungeons. Die Kämpfe sind rundenbasierend. Graphik und Animationen im speziellen Comic-Retro-Look und Musik sind für das Spielerlebnis ausreichend.
Die einzelnen Charaktere werden durch Abilities und Skills im Laufe des Spiels stärker, je mehr Urnen man bei seinen Abenteuern erbeutet.  Das Spiel hat noch ein paar kleine Verbesserungen nötig. Z.B. Der "Zufallsschädel" fügt Einem in 8 von 10 Fällen 2 Schaden zu .Nachdem man es ein paar Mal ausprobiert hat lässt man es lieber ganz. Der Anfang kann etwas knifflig sein, wenn die Helden noch nicht so viel können Außerdem kommen hoffentlich mehr Levels, mehr Charaktere, mehr Gegenstände, mehr Taktikelemente, einfach noch mehr Inhalt bis zum Release.

Alles in Allem ist hier ein Spiel mit viel Potential, welches allerdings erst noch weiter ausgebaut werden muss. In jedem Fall aber schon spielbar und fesselnd. Daumen hoch.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986624324', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1583634599}
review:
Apesar de não ser oficial. O dark quest 2 é uma cópia do antigo jogo de tabuleiro chamado Hero Quest, que foi lançado no Brasil pela Estrela. O jogo é bem legal, tem uma dificuldade bem desafiadora e pode jogar cooperativo com até mais 3 amigos, cada um com uma das classes.
Para quem ama RPG, board games e jogos cooperativos é um prato cheio.
Recomendo não só o dark quest 2, como também o dark quest 1 que tem uma visão bem board game e é tão divertido quanto, apesar dos gráficos serem bem mais simples.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041229794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1496216166}
review:
This down vote is mostly because of the cost.

There really isn't much game here and I became bored pretty quickly.  I get that it's early access, but I feel it would suit a mobile platform better where simple gameplay is ok and you play in short stints.

It's not really the nostalgic old school adventure I expected.  I'd recommend buying it only if it's less than $5 and you don't expect more than a short casual adventure game for your tablet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056018413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1494202624}
review: jogo muito bom, mas ele não salva na nuvem... perdi o progresso todo e desisti

author: {'steamid': '76561198026679609', 'num_games_owned': 1456, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1515462624}
review:
This is a pretty terrible game, put together quit cheaply. The graphics aren't awful, but would be best considered mediocre. The combat is turn-based, but *extremely* simplistic.

Story? No, there's no story. "Evil wizard lives in castle, you're going to the castle because the Evil Wizard lives there". No effort went into the narrative *at all*.

I finally gave up after walking into a trap, and the game told me "hey, you can avoid traps by carrying a torch". Lol, wut? That's not how traps work, *and* the walls are covered in goddamn torches.

Garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032588422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1650740116}
review: Für alle, die vor ca.100 Jahren "HeroQuest" als Brettspiel oder ebenfalls "HeroQuest" auf Amiga gespielt haben UND es gemocht haben - ist "Dark Quest 2" ein Muss. Es ist um einiges komplexer als "HeroQuest": es gibt Ausrüstugsgegenstände,  mehr Heldentypen und verschiedene Aktionen und Skills, die man erlernen kann. Da das Spiel noch in der Entwicklungsphase ist, sind noch nicht alle Dungeons freigeschaltet. Ich finde es jetzt schon geil.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004980905', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1533403502}

author: {'steamid': '76561198110094218', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1547873361}
review: This game has potential. Alot of it.  Looks great, plays great, and it's simple and easy in a good way.  Nothing complicated, just easy time wasting fun.  And perfectly suited to the price point.  Multiplayer needs some work, namely a lobby or drop-in and out play, but its in early access. I look forward to seeing where the developers take this.  Oh and co-op.  This game needs local co-op.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046140987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1693429260}
review:
Das Spiel wäre eigentlich überragend gut ! Aber:

1. Die Campagne ist nach so langer Zeit immer noch unvollständig !
2. verschiedene Szenarien sind auch nach mehrmaligen Versuchen nicht zu schaffen 
3. Das größte Übel jedoch ist, daß es keine ordentliche und detaillierte Editor-Dokumentation
    gibt, die es einem von Anfang an ermöglicht, eigene Campagnen zu erstellen.
4. Wegen der Schwierigkeit der einzelnen Szenarien wäre ein eingebauter Cheat-Code erfreulich
5. Es wäre sehr zu empfehlen, das Spiel (dto. Editor-Dokumentation in Deutscher Sprache anzubieten

Fazit: sobald der Entwickler das Spiel hinsichtlich der oben aufgeführten Punkte überarbeitet haben wird,
          werde ich zu größten Fan dieses im Grunde hervorragenden Spiels und könnte es danach empfehlen

PS: Vielleicht könnte das Spiel zusätzlich als Kaufversion (DVD) mit umfangreichem gedrucktem Handbuch
      auf dem Markt angeboten werden !

author: {'steamid': '76561198040488723', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1631637028}
review: Excellent jeu de dungeon explore, j'espère qu'il y aura de nouveaux personnages :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198123630426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1503584110}
review:
북미쪽에서 유명한 보드게임인 '히어로 퀘스트' 를 모티브로 만든 게임입니다. 전작인 다크 퀘스트 1을 모바일로 꽤열심히 했던지라 기대감을 갖고 구입 했구요, 아직 제작단계인지라 컨텐츠도 부족하고 꼼수도 많지만, 꽤 재밌게 하고 있어서 천천히 플레이 하고 있는 중입니다.

전작보다 그래픽 퀄리티는 훨씬 좋아졌습니다. 얼굴과 표정등으로 표현했던 전작에 비해 전신이 다 나오는 캐릭터를 사용하며, 몇몇은 아직 매끄럽진 않지만 애니메이션 퀄리티도 꽤좋습니다. (스파인을 써보신 분들은 압니다. 2.5디 애니가 그렇게 녹록한게 아니란걸.. )

스샷만 보신다면 로그라이크형식의 게임이라고 생각 할 수 있겠지만, 정해진 맵을 클리어하는 방식으로 진행되며, 최소 한명 이상의 캐릭터를 활용해야 합니다. 알피지 게임다운 장비나 물약, 스킬 등의 시스템이 있지만, 물약이나 스킬은 한번밖에 사용 못하고 (스킬을 한번 더 쓸 수 있게 해주는 물약이있긴 합니다만, 기본적으론 한번만 가능) 제한적인 맵에서 제한적인 캐릭터로 턴을 활용해서 극복해 나가는건 보드게임의 느낌을 잘 살린 부분이라 생각이 듭니다. 

무엇보다 8~90년대 모험형 보드게임같은느낌을 잘 살려서 아주 맘에 듭니다만, 단조로운 플레이나 운빨 요소 (랜덤 효과 스위치나 발판 등)가 생각보다 플레이에 큰 긴장감을 주진 않고, 퍼즐적인 요소고 강하지 않아슴슴한 느낌을 주기도 합니다. 또한 랜덤맵이아닌지라 컨텐츠가 부족할것도 같네요. 

스타의 유즈맵처럼 플레이어가 맵을 만들수 있게 툴을 제공하는데 이게 얼마나 활성화 될지 모르겠네요. 하지만 이런거 저런거 다 차치하고 어드벹처 보드게임의 느낌을 잘 살려준 것 만으로도 전 대단히 만족하며 가볍게 플레이 할 수 있고 언어의장벽도 그리 높지 않아서 라이트한 게임을 좋아하는 분들에게 추천합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002865819', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1492024160}
review: This game is a shit!  And it stills in beta...

author: {'steamid': '76561198054880803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1491242919}
review:
Jogo promissor, se voce jogou heroquest ou algum RPG de tabuleiro, Dark Quest é compra obrigatoria, o jogo ainda esta em desenvolvimento e possui alguns bugs, mas nada que atrapalhe o gameplay.
Recomendo farmar Skill Elixir no segundo mapa para upar as skills dos seus herois antes de partir para novas aventuras.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070091020', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 47590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3810, 'last_played': 1689977952}
review:
Dass Dark Quest 2 derzeit nur Early-Access (Stand: 31.03.17) ist, merkt man schon an diversen Stellen. So sind z.B. derzeit 19 der 30 Maps der Kampagne spielbar und noch nicht alle Helden verfügbar.
Die Balance ist auch noch nicht ganz ausgewogen und könnte noch etwas angepasst werden. Alles in allem aber nichts, was den Spielspaß mindern könnte.

Trotz Early-Access hat das Spiel durchaus Potenzial und macht mir bisher wirklich Spaß. Ich fühle mich ein Stück weit an Hero Quest erinnert und bin gespannt, was die Zukunft noch so bringt. Auf den ersten Blick wirkt es eher simpel, allerdings kommt mit weiteren Fähigkeiten, welche die Helden erlernen können, mehr Tiefe ins Spiel.

Der Editor bietet viele Möglichkeiten, die bestehende Auswahl an Quests nach Belieben zu erweitern (selbst erstellte oder durch die Community – in der Hoffung, dass es zukünftig noch mehr werden).
Bei einer Frage zum Editor im Forum habe ich bereits innerhalb einer Stunde Hilfe vom Entwickler bekommen. Auch sonst scheint der Entwickler interessiert an der Community. Das finde ich sehr positiv!

Der Multiplayer funktioniert schon, könnte aber noch etwas optimiert werden. Beispielsweise ist bei 2 Spielern auf einer Karte für 3 Helden ein Heldenplatz unbesetzt, so dass die Quest herausfordernder wird.

Der Preis von 12,99€ hat mich anfangs davon abgehalten, das Spiel zu kaufen, so dass ich auf ein Angebot gewartet habe. Im Nachhinein muss ich aber sagen, dass mir das Spiel auch 12,99€ wert gewesen wäre, da ich davon ausgehe, dass es auch noch weitere Inhalte geben wird.

Von mir also eine klare Kaufempfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011561313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1676485033}
review:
Greetings jung lad. Come and take a seat. I will tell you from a time of darkness...
It all took place in a world, similar to one we know, but different enough to be worth another story.
Were a handful of heroes gathered to defeat the evil sorcerer Zantor. For ages he dwelled in the darkness, raising his foul minions unter his iront fist, and one after the other, free lands fall before him.
Mighty castles turned into lairs of terror, swarmed by his minions, til a few remaining heroes gathered:
The wild barbarian, the wise wizard, the studdy dwarf, the mysterious dark monk, the swift archer and the honorable knight. Together, under the leadership of the barbarian warrior, they march towards the darkest of all places in the world: Zantors Keep.
Be the way were long and danger were everywhere. The first quest were easy, not more than a tutorial for the barbarian, who were alone in the beginning, til the wizard found him and together, they did another quest. And another, and...
Reaching a village that no map knows, they realized the adventure has even just begun. 
More enemies raised upon them, deadly traps waited patiently for their blood, and in every shadow, there were these eyes. Watching, waiting. 
The villagers had them welcome and here the heroes found, whatever they could need:
A blacksmith, crafting weapons and armor, even artifacts.
An old Woman, selling potions of strange herbs - useful, but unstable in quality.
A sage of the old realms, who tought our heroes to master her abilities.
A Merchant, buying juwels and items the heroes didn't need anymore.
And the gravedigger, who could even brought back the dead (and were the richest men in town).
The tavern provided a rest for the wounded, while the brothel...well :)

And there he were. The eldar. A strange old man, who sent for the barbarian and his mates.
He gave them advice and - more important - quests. 
Rescue the dwarf he said, for the dungeons get bigger and harder as you proceed, and 2 heros soon won't be enough.

The tale seems simple young lad, but you surely will be entertained well. The fights were simple, the graphic and sound nostalgic. The devs of the kingdom were busy these days, even in the forums, what is always a good sign.
Go now, adventurer. Go for the honor, for the gold and get your own tale to tell....

author: {'steamid': '76561198078498143', 'num_games_owned': 2152, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1519675934}
review:
Take a step back into the good old times where Computers were just in beginning. A time without Smartphones, with simple Consoles like the ATARI 2600. That was the time of Table Games. Sitting together, rolling the dices, playing cards, setting Figures. One Table Game was HERO QUEST. This Game was special, because it was one of the first games that was able to change the Gamefield. You choose one Character, take your dice and go into an adventure. 
The Characters are different. A Mage, a Dwarf, a Barbarian, an Archer and in following Add Ons more Characters. Each Character has special abilitys to survive the Game. Winning this Game depends very much on Luck.
You roll the Dice, you accept the Dice. 
The Final Goal is to defeat an evil Mage. The way is full of enemys and traps. A long way.

Yes, i was speaking of HERO QUEST, but this is also DARK QUEST 2. 
And no, i don`t think it is a stolen idea, for me it is a homage, a tribute to an old game.
Many Years ago there was a homecomputer Version i liked very much, but that was in the 80`s. From that time on i was waiting for a new version and i found it in DARK QUEST 1. It was in 2D, not like the AMIGA Version, but now with DARK QUEST 2 i reached what i was searching for.

DARK QUEST 2 has it all. Good Graphics in Old School Style, an atmospheric Soundtrack and a nice Gameplay. For me its a little bit like coming home, after all the years. Thank you very much Brain Seal LTD. :)

This Game is Early Access and many areas on the Castlemap are Locked, because they are not ready. Not all Characters are playable but 5 are. The Developer brought in fresh ideas like a City with some Shops. You can buy items and potions there, which are essential for your goings in the Castle. You can also use special Bottles that can be found on adventering  to raise the abilitys and skills of your Characters. 
And this is the point that makes this game fair and not inbalanced. The more you raise you Skills and abillitys the better you survive. I didn`t found a map that is unfair, all can be done with the right preparation and plannings. For example momently i`m using 3 Characters. The Barbarian for Fighting/Tanking, the Dwarf for finding and disarming Traps and the Knight for healing.  It really goes well for me.
BUT NEVER FORGET, like rolling a dice on the Table Game, here the Rollings depends on LUCK. You can have good ones and have a fine run in a room full of monsters or you can have a bad run and loose. 
It`s a fair game and in the beginning it may be a little bit difficult to reach higher Maps, but learn the specializing of the Characters, choose your Favourites, rise them, give them Weapons and Potions and you will success.

I hope in the Future some of my Friendlist will get this game, too, because of a nice Multiplayer Game. For now i`m excited to see whats coming in the future and the Developer did very much in the last Time to continue finishing this game. So if you like good old Table Games, you`re in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102094986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1698593012}
review:
Comprei pq havia adorado o Dark Quest 1. Decepção. Embora tenha bem mais elementos de RPG, a visão isométrica por comodos, não se mostrou legal para esse tipo de game... A versão topdown de mapa, utilizada pelo Dark Quest 1, é bem melhor.  Enfim, os gráficos ficaram bem bonitos, mas continuo preferindo a primeira versão do game... Uma pena

Voltei a joga-lo, depois de uns meses, para ver o que tinha mudado, pois gostei muito do primeiro... Realmente essa visão isométrica, por salas, não ficou "caiu bem" para esse tipo de game... Uma pena. Se mantivessem a visão topdown... Tipico jogo que poderia ter sido destinado  para mobile....

author: {'steamid': '76561198187888530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1595449716}
review:
Das Spiel macht sehr viel Spaß. Die Grafik ist sehr angenehm und passt super zum Genre. Es spielt sich wie ein Brettspiel. Ich war früher ein großer Fan des Heroquest Brettspiels und dieses PC-Spiel kommt schon nahe heran.

Was noch fehlt ist eine Map für die Räume die man bereits entdeckt hat. 

Was man leider noch vermeiden muss, ist der Multiplayer, für den ich das Spiel hauptsächlich gekauft habe. Immer wieder kommt es vor, dass es mitten im Dungeon nicht mehr möglich ist, den Charakter zu bewegen.

Natürlich habe ich nicht vergessen, dass es ein Early Access ist, aber auch ein Early Access sollte spielbar sein. Das ist der Multiplayermodus definitv nicht! (Laut Entwickler wurde der Fehler behoben.)

Trotz der Makel ist es ein sehr schönes Spiel, welches ich weiter beobachten werde. Ich hoffe, dass die Fehler mit der Zeit entfernt werden. Allerdings ist es so seien 15 EUR noch nicht wert. Leider.

Edit: Was ich wirklich erwähnen muss: Der Entwickler zeigt wirklich Intresse an Problemen im Spiel. Er hat mich selbstständig angeschreiben und sich erkundigt, wo es gehapert hat. Sucht eine Lösung und wollte sogar mit mir das Spiel gemiensam spielen, um zu testen, ob es wieder funktioniert. Daumen hoch!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014239944', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1583927190}
review: A gameplay é muito baseada na sorte, até mesmo para um RPG. Quando você completa uma quest se sente sortudo e não habilidoso.  Tentei apos alguns meses, mais uma vez esse jogo e notei que foram feitas algumas alterações, mas ainda penso que não vale a pena, as habilidades e os itens são confusas de entender só pela descrição, é mais fácil entender com o uso na pratica, mas gera muita frustração porque o resultado geralmente é diferente daquele que vc planejou com base nas descrições. Não dá pra vc planejar o posicionamento dos seus personagens quando entra na sala de modo que os personagens com defesa alta fique na linha de frente e aqueles com defesa mais baixa fiquem na retaguarda e isso em um RPG é fundamental. Por fim  os personagens lutadores corpo a corpo como o bárbaro e o guerreiro tem um índice de acerto muito baixo e ainda por cima com dano baixo (média de 2 de dano quando acerta) e como na maioria das vezes vc está em menor numero acaba dependendo da sorte....uma pena por o jogo poderia ser um RPG leve de rodar no PC e casual.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129370019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1491314601}
review:
I thought this was going to be like Hero Quest games of old.  Am I missing something ?  This game has no balance to it whatsoever.  There is dozens of ways your characters get screwed and very limited number of ways you can buff them to prevent that.  On top of that a lot of it is locked at the beginning to its a bunch of save and reload.

You can't speedup the animations, yes there is an option for that, but it doesn't work.

Nice graphics.  Responsive devs, still bugs being ironed out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059829008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1508803437}
review:
O jogo desenvolvido em um estilo de arte isométrico desenhado à mão e conta com uma mecânica baseada em dados para todos os cálculos (rola dados para determinar um resultado), com uma mecânica turn based (em cada turno os seus heróis podem tomar uma única ação que irá determinar o resultado), e inspirado no lendário jogo de tabuleiro Hero Quest.

Em Dark Quest 2: Castle of Doom, temos diversas novidades, tais como novos heróis, artefatos e itens, inimigos, cenários, editor de mapas e modos de jogo, sendo um o mais esperado, o modo multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040701504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1508005470}
review:
Très beau, soigné, simple et efficace. L'état d'accès anticipé du jeu ne se ressent absolument pas, tout ce qui est actuellement en place fonctionne agréablement, les bugs ne sautent pas aux yeux. Les maps, correctifs et autres nouveautés s'ajoutent au fil des patchs réguliers. Reste à voire la durée de vie de la version finale... Un éditeur de niveau est déjà disponible.

De l'exploration de donjon classique (avec progression des persos) au tour par tour, tout simple mais prenant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037003719', 'num_games_owned': 4057, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1478793454}
review:
陰森昏暗的地城、蠢蠢欲動的哥布林、殘忍致命的陷阱、邪惡至極的老巫師、以及步步深入險境的冒險者，《Dark Quest 2》是款結合以上多點要素的回合制策略角色扮演遊戲，本作故事顯而易懂，法力高強的邪惡老巫師建立了一座城堡，並且操縱哥布林與獸人等類人生物脅迫手無寸鐵的小鎮居民，打算進一步擴張勢力以便統治整個國度。然而，自告奮勇的冒險者進入城堡，手持刀劍的野蠻人、法力高強的魔法師、持有神聖信仰的治療騎士、以及精通工藝製品的矮人戰士，他們將集結各自的專長，突破重重難關並把惡勢力驅逐出境。

遊戲的主要目的十分單純，玩家必須操縱一到三位數量不等的冒險者在地城中斬妖除魔（最初的冒險者只有野蠻人跟魔法師，後期可靠金錢或完成任務解鎖新夥伴），破解謎題和致命陷阱，其過程不外乎會遭遇到怪物的攻擊或是被陷阱暗算，一旦受傷扣除生命值，就一定要透過從藥水商人處購買的生命藥水或是治療騎士的治癒法術來恢復生命，但是購買而來的藥水又有一定機率無效化（因為對方賣假貨給你），各職業的技能使用上限又只有一次，所以要如何在不受傷的情況下到達終點，這就要考驗玩家夠不夠小心謹慎。


在你動一回合，我也動一回合的規則下，如何在自身回合對敵人造成最大傷害，同時將敵人對自己產生的損害降到最低，就是順利通關的致勝關鍵。由於本作還處於早期測試階段，能夠遊玩內容有限，不太清楚遊戲完成後是否還是這樣，近戰職業遠比法系職業有用許多，儘管魔法師的法術不能格檔又可以在遠距離迅速殲滅數名目標，但是在不喝藥水重啟技能使用權的情況下，放完法術的魔法師就像是沒有屁用的薄皮木樁，普通攻擊不僅無法有效對敵人造成傷害，更會因為貧乏的腳程與防禦力，成為第一個陣亡目標。

正因為法術職業不太可靠，高傷害的野蠻人和高防禦的矮人戰士成為最吃香的兩名職業，野蠻人格檔率偏低，不過能學習機率性反擊的技能，有機會在敵人攻擊後揮劍砍殺對方；矮人戰士格檔率奇高，搭配無視所有傷害的技能，確實是最理想的坦克職業，加上被動技能有著不可或缺的【陷阱偵測】功能，直接讓他躍昇為本作最屌職業之一。治療騎士算是頗為微妙的職業，身為近戰卻有著偏低的攻擊防禦，強大之處在於群體減傷和額外治療機會，讓隊伍有更大容錯率，輸出跟吸引仇恨的工作就交給其他職業吧！


提升冒險者戰力的方法主要分為兩種，首先是在地城蒐集藍色瓶裝藥水，使用它們來學習技能或增加技能等級，筆者建議先把其中某職業的單項技能升到最滿，接下來再考慮強化其他技能，主要原因是技能點取得途徑有限，又尚未支援洗點功能，過於分散學習技能，只會落得樣樣不精通的窘境。另一種方法是前往鐵匠鋪選擇裝備，目前版本的裝備不用材料或金錢就能直接拿來使用（正式版聽說會要求素材製作），大致是攻擊提升、防禦增加、輔助功能等三種功能，鎧甲盾牌適合裝備在近戰職業上，提供額外生命值的項鍊適合給予法術職業以增加生存機率，死人是無法製造傷害的，所以防具的價值比武器高出許多。


終於來到最終結論，這是一款值得一玩的遊戲嗎？單論遊戲性來說，它確實是款樂趣十足的角色扮演遊戲，不過就像是前段所提到的要點，《Dark Quest 2》目前仍處於早期測試階段，可玩內容非常貧乏，接近 400 元台幣的售價卻只能由玩到一個半小時的遊戲內容，儘管遊玩機制已經大致完善，但耐玩度還是有些差強人意。想要體驗本作的玩家建議等到遊戲正式完成再去購買，製作團隊 Brain Seal 已經在 Steam 遊戲頁面上承諾會在 17 年第一季完成遊戲，增加更多職業、豐富地城關卡、以及將依然在 Beta 測試階段的四人連線模式處理得更加完善，相信《Dark Quest 2》正式發售後肯定會再次引起四人同樂的地城探索風潮。


優點：
+百玩不厭的地城探索題材，不用華麗 3D 畫面也能吸引住奇幻迷的目光。
+遊戲整體難度偏高，妥善分配小隊成員、步步為營探索地城才是上上策。
+支持超萬用的地圖編輯器，往後開放 Steam 工作坊肯定會大幅增加耐玩度。


缺點：
-視角無法自由切換，人物時常卡在行經路線，造成滑鼠不易點擊的缺點。
-職業優劣過於明顯，法術技能使用次數貧乏的規則下，近戰職業成為主流。


結論：現階段遊戲完成度約五分之一，建議大家等到明年春季製作完成再購買。


網誌圖文好讀版：
http://mgrim214.blogspot.tw/2016/11/dark-quest-2.html

author: {'steamid': '76561197971338654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1478861431}
review:
** Note: I haven't put a ton of time in yet, but I believe I have enough experience to write a review of the early access status of the title.

Dark Quest 2 is a turn based RPG that reminds me of Darkest Dungeon. I make that comparison in all the best ways especially in the way that, like Darkest Dungeon, this game might be in early access but is full of content, mostly bug free and already has solid gameplay mechanics that are fun and engaging. 

You control a party of heroes in a quest to defeat an evil sorcerer. To do this, you must do battle in a series of dungeons while managing your team in town between missions. It's very addicting and well worth the budget price tag. 

Pros
- Great art style and music
- Challenging but fair gameplay
- Runs great and is easy on the wallet

Cons
- Settings and characters are really generic

Suggestions
- Would be great if the maximum movement restriction could be removed when rooms are free of enemies. Kinda annoying having to switch between your characters 2-3 times just to move through an empty room
- Keybindings plz?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HXHiJSBb_zo

author: {'steamid': '76561198072064881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1484759635}
review:
[German]
Ich habe das Spiel jetzt über 3 Stunden gespielt und bin begeistert. Müsste ich morgen nicht früh raus würde ich weiter spielen. Das Spiel macht noch wesentlich mehr Spaß als der erste Teil und macht vieles besser, vor allem die Motivation bleibt aufrecht erhalten.

Das Spiel lohnt sich für Spieler von Brettspielen oder Rundenbasierenden Strategiespielen!!!

Nach über 11 Stunden kann ich sagen ich habe das Spiel in mein Herz geschlossen!

[English]
I loved the first Darkquest but Darkquest 2 is more fun. They did change some things in the game and this makes the game very fresh and funny.

Everyone who likes the tabletop Heroquest or roundbased strategie games should try this game!!!
It's worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198098634404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1520551412}
review:
This is a first impression review of sorts and I will write an indepth review later.

I love the art style and it seems to have captured the essence of Hero Quest, but where is the hot seat option for multiplayer?!

Game looks good and plays really well with a simplistic and user-friendly interface. I like the music, although it's nowhere near the epic theme music from Hero Quest :)

The game is still early access but it doesn't feel like it. 

Gotta get back to playing :D
